mcp-simple.name: Tech Stack & MCP Recommender
mcp-simple.description: Intelligent MCP server for tech stack detection and MCP server recommendations with smart prompts
mcp-simple.usageInstructions: Use prompts for tech stack analysis, then tools for MCP server recommendations

everything.name: Everything
everything.description: Reference/test server with prompts, resources, and tools
everything.usageInstructions: Development and testing server with example implementations

fetch.name: Fetch
fetch.usageInstructions: Fetch and process web content for efficient LLM usage

filesystem.name: Filesystem
filesystem.usageInstructions: Read, write, and manage local files and directories

git.name: Git
git.usageInstructions: Perform Git operations like commit, push, pull, and branch management

skyvern.name: Skyvern
skyvern.description: Advanced browser automation with AI-powered web interaction
skyvern.usageInstructions: Automate browser-based workflows, fill forms, download files, and interact with websites using AI

memory.name: Memory
memory.usageInstructions: Store and retrieve persistent memories across conversations

sequentialthinking.name: Sequential Thinking
sequentialthinking.usageInstructions: Enable step-by-step reasoning and problem-solving approaches

time.name: Time
time.usageInstructions: Get current time, schedule events, and manage time zones

obsidian.name: Obsidian
obsidian.description: Read and search through Obsidian vault or Markdown notes directory
obsidian.usageInstructions: Access and search Obsidian notes and Markdown files

spotify.name: Spotify
spotify.description: MCP server allowing LLM to play and use Spotify
spotify.usageInstructions: Control Spotify playback and search music

kubernetes.name: Kubernetes
kubernetes.description: Connect to Kubernetes cluster and manage pods, deployments, and services
kubernetes.usageInstructions: Manage Kubernetes resources via natural language interface

aws.name: AWS
aws.description: Specialized MCP servers bringing AWS best practices to development workflow
aws.usageInstructions: Interact with various AWS services and resources

clerk.name: Clerk
clerk.description: Authentication and user management with Clerk for AI agents
clerk.usageInstructions: Integrate Clerk authentication with AI agent frameworks. Manage users, organizations, and inject session claims into AI prompts. Warning: Agent behavior is non-deterministic - use carefully in production.

playwright.name: Microsoft Playwright
playwright.description: Browser automation and testing with Playwright
playwright.usageInstructions: Automate browser interactions, perform web testing, and capture screenshots

context7.name: Context7
context7.description: Context management and conversation memory system
context7.usageInstructions: Manage conversation context, maintain session memory, and handle context switching

taskmaster.name: Task Master
taskmaster.description: Comprehensive task management with projects, contexts, and advanced organization
taskmaster.usageInstructions: Manage tasks with projects, contexts, priorities, due dates, and dependencies. Supports natural language input for task creation and filtering.

xcodebuild.name: Xcode Build
xcodebuild.description: Xcode project building and iOS/macOS development automation
xcodebuild.usageInstructions: Build, test, and manage Xcode projects for iOS and macOS development

supabase.name: Supabase
supabase.description: Complete Supabase platform integration for database and project management
supabase.usageInstructions: Manage Supabase projects, design tables, run SQL queries, create database branches, generate TypeScript types, and handle migrations

postgres-crystal.name: PostgreSQL (Crystal DBA)
postgres-crystal.description: PostgreSQL database operations with advanced DBA capabilities
postgres-crystal.usageInstructions: Execute SQL queries, manage database schema, perform DBA operations on PostgreSQL databases. Requires a PostgreSQL connection string.

qdrant.name: Qdrant
qdrant.description: Vector database operations for Qdrant - store and search high-dimensional vectors
qdrant.usageInstructions: Manage collections, insert vectors, perform similarity searches, and handle vector data in Qdrant. Requires Qdrant instance URL.

nixos.name: NixOS
nixos.description: Provides real-time information about NixOS packages, configurations, and version histories
nixos.usageInstructions: Search NixOS packages, configuration options, Home Manager settings, nix-darwin configurations, and package version history. Queries live NixOS APIs for accurate data.

shadcn-ui.name: shadcn/ui
shadcn-ui.description: Browse and install shadcn/ui components and utilities for React applications
shadcn-ui.usageInstructions: Search, view documentation, and install shadcn/ui components directly into your React project. Supports component browsing, installation, and dependency management.

gpt-researcher.name: GPT Researcher
gpt-researcher.description: AI-powered research assistant that conducts comprehensive online research on any topic
gpt-researcher.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/assafelovic/gptr-mcp.git && cd gptr-mcp && pip install -r requirements.txt
gpt-researcher.usageInstructions: Perform deep research on topics, generate comprehensive reports, quick searches, and track sources. Requires manual setup with git clone and Python environment.

pr-reviewer.name: PR Reviewer
pr-reviewer.description: Automatically analyzes Pull Requests, reviews changes, and adds comments directly to modified files
pr-reviewer.usageInstructions: Review pull requests automatically, add inline comments, approve PRs, and optionally store reviews in Google Drive. Requires GitHub personal access token with appropriate permissions.

gdrive-ej.name: Google Drive (Enhanced)
gdrive-ej.description: Enhanced Google Drive integration with file listing, reading, and searching capabilities with automatic format conversion
gdrive-ej.usageInstructions: Access Google Drive files with advanced search, read documents with automatic format conversion, and manage Drive content. Requires Google OAuth credentials JSON file.

sharepoint.name: SharePoint
sharepoint.description: Lightweight Microsoft SharePoint integration for document and folder management
sharepoint.usageInstructions: List, read, search, and download SharePoint documents and folders. Requires Azure AD application credentials for authentication.

shrimp-task-manager.name: Shrimp Task Manager
shrimp-task-manager.description: Intelligent task management system based on MCP, providing efficient programming workflow framework for AI Agents
shrimp-task-manager.usageInstructions: Switch between TaskPlanner and TaskExecutor modes for systematic task planning and execution. Supports dependency tracking, research mode, task history, multiple languages, and customizable prompts.

just-prompt.name: Just Prompt
just-prompt.description: Unified interface to multiple LLM providers with parallel querying capabilities
just-prompt.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/disler/just-prompt && cd just-prompt && uv sync
just-prompt.usageInstructions: Query multiple LLM providers (OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, Groq, DeepSeek, Ollama) simultaneously or individually. Configure API keys for the providers you want to use.

circleci.name: CircleCI
circleci.description: Model Context Protocol server for integrating with CircleCI development workflows
circleci.usageInstructions: Retrieve build failure logs, find flaky tests, analyze job results, validate configuration, and manage CircleCI pipelines. Supports natural language interactions with CI/CD workflows.

clickup.name: ClickUp
clickup.description: Comprehensive ClickUp task management integration with 36 tools for AI applications
clickup.usageInstructions: Manage ClickUp tasks, spaces, lists, and folders with natural language. Create, update, track time, and manage team members. Supports HTTP/SSE transport and markdown formatting.

cognition-wheel.name: Cognition Wheel
cognition-wheel.description: AI-powered cognitive assessment and development tool that helps track and improve various cognitive abilities
cognition-wheel.usageInstructions: Assess and track cognitive abilities including memory, attention, reasoning, and problem-solving. Generate personalized cognitive development plans and track progress over time.

github-project-manager.name: GitHub Project Manager
github-project-manager.description: Comprehensive GitHub project management tool for managing repositories, issues, pull requests, and GitHub Projects
github-project-manager.usageInstructions: Manage GitHub repositories, create and update issues, handle pull requests, manage GitHub Projects (v2), and automate project workflows. Requires a GitHub personal access token with appropriate permissions.

github.name: GitHub
github.description: Official GitHub MCP server providing seamless integration with GitHub APIs for advanced automation and interaction capabilities
github.usageInstructions: Access GitHub APIs through MCP for repository management, issues, pull requests, actions, and more. Requires Docker and a GitHub Personal Access Token.

firecrawl.name: Firecrawl
firecrawl.description: Advanced web scraping and crawling with intelligent content extraction and data processing
firecrawl.usageInstructions: Crawl websites, extract structured data, and process web content at scale. Supports intelligent content extraction with configurable crawling parameters.

google-maps.name: Google Maps
google-maps.description: Google Maps integration for location services, directions, and place information
google-maps.usageInstructions: Search places, get directions, geocode addresses, and access Google Maps services. Requires Google Maps API key with appropriate services enabled.

apple-mcp.name: Apple MCP
apple-mcp.description: Apple ecosystem integration for accessing iOS/macOS system information and device management
apple-mcp.usageInstructions: Access Apple device information, system status, and integrate with iOS/macOS applications. Provides device management and system monitoring capabilities.

mindsdb.name: MindsDB
mindsdb.description: AI query engine for federated data sources with built-in MCP server for database and ML operations
mindsdb.usageInstructions: Connect multiple data sources (SQL databases, APIs, files) and query them with natural language. Includes ML capabilities and predictive analytics.

fastmcp.name: FastMCP
fastmcp.description: Python framework for rapidly building MCP servers and clients with simplified development workflow
fastmcp.usageInstructions: Build custom MCP servers quickly using Python. Provides scaffolding, decorators, and utilities for MCP development.

figma-context.name: Figma Context MCP
figma-context.description: Provides Figma design data and context to AI coding tools for design-to-code workflows
figma-context.usageInstructions: Access Figma files, frames, and design tokens to enhance AI-powered code generation. Requires Figma API access token.

ghidra-mcp.name: Ghidra MCP
ghidra-mcp.description: MCP server for autonomous reverse engineering with Ghidra - enables AI-powered binary analysis
ghidra-mcp.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/LaurieWired/GhidraMCP.git && cd GhidraMCP && python3 -m pip install mcp
ghidra-mcp.usageInstructions: Perform automated reverse engineering and binary analysis using Ghidra with AI assistance. Requires Ghidra installation and manual setup.

notion.name: Notion
notion.description: Official Notion MCP server for comprehensive workspace and database management
notion.usageInstructions: Access Notion pages, databases, and blocks. Create, read, update content in your Notion workspace. Requires Notion integration API key.

obsidian-advanced.name: Obsidian (Advanced)
obsidian-advanced.description: Comprehensive Obsidian vault interactions via Local REST API with advanced note management
obsidian-advanced.usageInstructions: Advanced Obsidian operations including note reading/writing, tag management, frontmatter operations, and graph navigation. Requires Obsidian Local REST API plugin.

git-advanced.name: Git (Advanced)
git-advanced.description: Comprehensive Git operations with clone, commit, branch, merge, rebase, and worktree support
git-advanced.usageInstructions: Full Git workflow support including advanced operations like interactive rebase, worktree management, tag operations, and repository cloning.

npm-docs.name: NPM Documentation
npm-docs.description: Fetches NPM package metadata and documentation with intelligent caching
npm-docs.usageInstructions: Retrieve package information, README content, and documentation from NPM registry with local caching for performance.

npm-search.name: NPM Search
npm-search.description: Search and discover NPM packages with dependency analysis and popularity metrics
npm-search.usageInstructions: Search NPM registry, analyze package dependencies, view popularity metrics, and discover related packages.

docker.name: Docker
docker.description: Secure code execution in Docker containers for AI development workflows
docker.installCommand: docker pull docker/mcp-server && docker run -d docker/mcp-server
docker.usageInstructions: Execute code securely in isolated Docker containers, manage containers and images, enable sandboxed AI operations.

json.name: JSON
json.description: Query and manipulate JSON data using JSONPath expressions
json.usageInstructions: Query JSON data using JSONPath (start with $), filter arrays, perform string/numeric/date operations, and data aggregation

slack.name: Slack
slack.description: Official Slack integration for posting messages, managing channels, and interacting with Slack workspaces
slack.usageInstructions: Post messages, reply to threads, add reactions, get channel history, and manage Slack workspace interactions. Requires creating a Slack App with bot token scopes and workspace installation.

slack-stealth.name: Slack Stealth
slack-stealth.description: Advanced Slack MCP server with stealth mode, OAuth support, and flexible message retrieval without additional workspace permissions

browser.name: Browser-based Tokens (XOXC/XOXD)
browser.description: Extract tokens from your browser session

oauth.name: User OAuth Token
oauth.description: More secure, uses Slack API OAuth token

slack-stealth.usageInstructions: Retrieve channel/thread messages, list channels, and access DMs with minimal workspace permissions. Choose between browser-based tokens (XOXC/XOXD) or OAuth token (XOXP) authentication methods.

exa.name: Exa
exa.description: AI-powered web search API integration for real-time searches, research papers, company info, and more
exa.usageInstructions: Enable web search, research papers, company research, crawling, competitor analysis, LinkedIn search, Wikipedia, and GitHub search. Get API key from dashboard.exa.ai/api-keys. Use --tools flag to select specific search capabilities.

magic.name: 21st.dev Magic
magic.description: AI-powered UI component generator that creates beautiful, modern React components through natural language descriptions
magic.usageInstructions: Type '/ui' in your AI chat and describe the component you want. Magic generates production-ready React components with TypeScript support. Get your API key from the 21st.dev Magic Console. Currently in beta with all features free.

vercel-api.name: Vercel MCP Server
vercel-api.description: An MCP server that connects to Vercel API, providing various tools for interacting with Vercel deployments, DNS, domains, projects, and environment variables.
vercel-api.usageInstructions: To use this MCP server, add it to your Cursor settings or Windsurf configuration with the VERCEL_API_KEY environment variable. The server provides various commands for managing Vercel resources.

workos.name: WorkOS MCP Server
workos.description: A lightweight MCP server for interacting with WorkOS API, deployed on Cloudflare Workers.
workos.installCommand: bun create mcp --clone https://github.com/zueai/workos-mcp && cd workos-mcp && bunx wrangler secret put WORKOS_API_KEY && bunx wrangler secret put WORKOS_CLIENT_ID
workos.usageInstructions: 1. Run the install command. 2. Configure Cursor Settings with the MCP server. 3. Deploy changes using 'bun run deploy'.

frontend-review.name: Frontend Review MCP Server
frontend-review.description: An MCP server that performs visual review of UI edit requests by comparing before and after screenshots.
frontend-review.usageInstructions: To use this MCP server, add it to your Cursor or Windsurf configuration with your Hyperbolic API key. The server provides a 'reviewEdit' tool that compares before and after screenshots of UI edits.

together-ai-image.name: Together AI Image Server
together-ai-image.description: An MCP server for generating images using Together AI API
together-ai-image.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/zym9863/together-ai-image-server.git && cd together-ai-image-server && npm install
together-ai-image.usageInstructions: 1. Set TOGETHER_API_KEY environment variable. 2. Configure Claude Desktop by adding server config to claude_desktop_config.json. 3. Run the server using 'npm run build' or 'npm run watch' for development.

code-indexer.name: MCP Code Indexer
code-indexer.description: An intelligent code retrieval tool based on Model Context Protocol, providing efficient and accurate code base retrieval for AI large language models.
code-indexer.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/zxfgds/mcp-code-indexer && cd mcp-code-indexer && pip install -r requirements.txt && python setup.py install
code-indexer.usageInstructions: 1. Configure Claude Desktop or VSCode extension settings with the correct installation directory path. 2. Use tools like identify_project, index_project, search_code, get_code_structure, analyze_code_quality, extract_documentation, find_similar_code, get_code_metrics, and analyze_dependencies.

mcp.name: ZoomEye MCP Server
mcp.description: An MCP server providing network asset information through ZoomEye API queries.
mcp.usageInstructions: 1. Install using 'pip install mcp-server-zoomeye'. 2. Set ZOOMEYE_API_KEY environment variable. 3. Run using 'python -m mcp_server_zoomeye'. Alternatively, use Docker: 'docker run -i --rm -e ZOOMEYE_API_KEY=your_api_key_here zoomeyeteam/mcp-server-zoomeye:latest'

warpcast.name: Warpcast MCP Server
warpcast.description: An MCP server for Warpcast integration allowing Claude to interact with Warpcast accounts
warpcast.installCommand: python3 -m venv venv && source venv/bin/activate && pip install -r requirements.txt && export WARPCAST_API_TOKEN=YOUR_TOKEN && uvicorn main:app --reload
warpcast.usageInstructions: 1. Create virtual environment and install dependencies. 2. Set WARPCAST_API_TOKEN environment variable. 3. Run server with uvicorn. Configure Claude Desktop by adding server details to claude_desktop_config.json.

blockchain.name: MCP Blockchain Server & DApp
blockchain.description: A secure MCP server enabling AI assistants to interact with blockchain smart contracts while maintaining user control over private keys and transaction signing.
blockchain.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/zhangzhongnan928/mcp-blockchain-server.git && cd mcp-blockchain-server && npm install && cp .env.example .env && npm run db:migrate && npm run dev
blockchain.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and install dependencies.
2. Configure environment variables in .env file.
3. Set up PostgreSQL database and run migrations.
4. Start the server using 'npm run dev' or use Docker Compose for a quick start.

evm-signer.name: MCP EVM Signer
evm-signer.description: An MCP server for managing Ethereum private keys and deploying smart contracts using Infura.
evm-signer.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/zhangzhongnan928/mcp-evm-signer.git && cd mcp-evm-signer && npm install && npm run build
evm-signer.usageInstructions: 1. Configure environment variables by copying .env.example to .env and editing it. 2. Integrate with Claude for Desktop by adding the server configuration. 3. Restart Claude for Desktop.

pa-ai-agent.name: MCP Personal Assistant Agent
pa-ai-agent.description: A versatile personal assistant AI agent built with the Model Context Protocol (MCP) that helps with calendar, tasks, emails, and more.
pa-ai-agent.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/zhangzhongnan928/mcp-pa-ai-agent.git && cd mcp-pa-ai-agent && pip install -r requirements.txt
pa-ai-agent.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and install dependencies.
2. Configure environment variables by copying .env.example to .env and editing it.
3. Start the server with 'python mcp_server.py'.
4. Configure Claude for Desktop to use this MCP server.

confluence.name: Confluence MCP Server
confluence.description: An MCP server providing Confluence integration with functionalities to execute CQL queries and retrieve page content.
confluence.usageInstructions: To use this server, set the required environment variables (CONFLUENCE_API_MAIL, CONFLUENCE_API_KEY, CONFLUENCE_URL, JIRA_URL) and run the command: env CONFLUENCE_API_MAIL=your@email.com CONFLUENCE_API_KEY=your-key CONFLUENCE_URL=your-confluence-url JIRA_URL=your-jira-url npx -y @zereight/mcp-confluence. Optionally, you can set CONFLUENCE_IS_CLOUD to 'false' for Server/Data Center version.

gitlab.name: Better GitLab MCP Server
gitlab.description: GitLab MCP Server with bug fixes and improvements over the original GitLab MCP server.
gitlab.usageInstructions: To use this server, set the required environment variables (GITLAB_PERSONAL_ACCESS_TOKEN, GITLAB_API_URL) and optionally configure other parameters. You can run it using 'npx -y @zereight/mcp-gitlab' or using Docker with 'docker run -i --rm -e GITLAB_PERSONAL_ACCESS_TOKEN=your_token -e GITLAB_API_URL=your_api_url iwakitakuma/gitlab-mcp'. Configure the server for Claude App, Cline, Roo Code, or Cursor by setting up the mcp.json file accordingly.

shortcut.name: Shortcut MCP Server
shortcut.description: An MCP server for interacting with Shortcut (formerly Clubhouse), allowing read-only and safe create operations.
shortcut.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/zekus/shortcut-mcp.git && cd shortcut-mcp && uv venv && source .venv/bin/activate && uv pip install -e .
shortcut.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and set up the environment. 2. Create a .env file by copying .env.example and add your Shortcut API token. 3. Run the server using 'python -m shortcut_mcp'. For Claude Desktop integration, add the server configuration to claude_desktop_config.json.

batchdata-real-estate.name: BatchData Real Estate MCP Server
batchdata-real-estate.description: An MCP server integrating BatchData.io's property and address APIs for property data, address verification, and geocoding.
batchdata-real-estate.usageInstructions:
1. Get BatchData.io API key from https://app.batchdata.com/settings/api
2. Create .env file with BATCHDATA_API_KEY=your_api_key
3. Run with 'npm start' or use Docker: './docker-manage.sh run'

docling.name: MCP Docling Server
docling.description: An MCP server providing document processing capabilities using the Docling library.
docling.usageInstructions: Start the server using 'mcp-server-lls' or 'uv run mcp-server-lls'. Configure transport and port with '--transport sse --port8000'. For qna_from_document tool, set Watson X credentials as environment variables.

zaj-mysql.name: zaj-MySQL-MCP Server
zaj-mysql.description: An MCP server implementation providing database interaction and business intelligence capabilities through MySQL.
zaj-mysql.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/zajTools/zaj-MySQL-MCP.git && cd zaj-MySQL-MCP && npm install && npm run build
zaj-mysql.usageInstructions:
1. Configure .env file with database credentials.
2. Run 'node build/index.js' to start the server.
3. Add server configuration to cline_mcp_settings.json.

gmail.name: Gmail MCP Server
gmail.description: An MCP server implementation for Gmail API integration, enabling AI assistants to interact with Gmail services including email and calendar operations.
gmail.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/zacco16/gmail-mcp-server.git && cd gmail-mcp-server && npm install && cp .env.example .env
gmail.usageInstructions:
1. Configure .env file with your Google API credentials
2. Run 'npm run build' to build the project
3. Run 'npm start' to start the server
4. Use the provided API interfaces for email and calendar operations

mysql.name: MySQL MCP Server
mysql.description: Model Context Protocol Server for MySQL databases, enabling LLMs to inspect database schemas and execute read-only queries.
mysql.usageInstructions: 1. Install via Smithery using 'npx -y @smithery/cli install @yuru-sha/mcp-server-mysql --client claude'. 2. Configure Claude Desktop by adding 'mcpServers' configuration to claude_desktop_config.json. 3. Use connection URL format: mysql://user:password@host:port/database

cosense.name: Cosense MCP Server
cosense.description: An MCP server for interacting with Cosense pages, providing functionality to retrieve, list, search, and insert text into pages.
cosense.usageInstructions: 1. Configure JSR registry: echo '@jsr:registry=https://npm.jsr.io' >> ~/.npmrc (Linux/macOS) or echo '@jsr:registry=https://npm.jsr.io' >> $env:USERPROFILE\.npmrc (Windows PowerShell). 2. Configure MCP client with 'cosense-mcp-server' command and required environment variables. 3. For debugging, use 'npm run inspect' after cloning the repository.

hackmd.name: HackMD MCP Server
hackmd.description: An MCP server for interacting with the HackMD API, enabling AI assistants to manage notes and teams.
hackmd.usageInstructions: 1. Install via Smithery using 'npx -y @smithery/cli install @yuna0x0/hackmd-mcp --client claude'. 2. Set HACKMD_API_TOKEN environment variable with your HackMD API token. 3. For manual installation, add server configuration to claude_desktop_config.json and restart Claude Desktop.

anilist.name: AniList MCP Server
anilist.description: An MCP server that interfaces with the AniList API, allowing LLM clients to access anime, manga, character, staff, and user data.
anilist.usageInstructions: 1. Install using Smithery CLI or mcp-get. 2. Configure Claude Desktop by adding the server to claude_desktop_config.json. 3. Restart Claude Desktop. 4. Optional: Set ANILIST_TOKEN environment variable for operations requiring login.

redmine.name: Redmine MCP Server
redmine.description: MCP server implementation for Redmine, integrating with Redmine's REST API to provide ticket and project information.
redmine.usageInstructions: 1. Enable REST API in Redmine admin settings. 2. Get API key from user settings. 3. Set REDMINE_HOST and REDMINE_API_KEY environment variables. 4. Configure with Claude using provided JSON configuration.

protolint.name: protolint MCP Server
protolint.description: A pluggable linting/fixing utility for Protocol Buffer files that supports MCP server functionality
protolint.usageInstructions: To start the MCP server, run: protolint --mcp. For detailed documentation, see the MCP documentation at ./mcp/README.md

pyodide.name: mcp-pyodide
pyodide.description: A Pyodide server implementation for the Model Context Protocol (MCP) enabling Large Language Models to execute Python code.
pyodide.usageInstructions:
To use as a server: import { runServer } from 'mcp-pyodide'; runServer().catch(error => console.error(error));
To use as CLI: mcp-pyodide [--sse]. Requires Node.js 18+ and npm 9+.

server.name: AI Development Assistant MCP Server
server.description: An MCP server providing AI-powered development tools for Cursor, including code architecture, screenshot analysis, code review, and file reading capabilities.
server.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/yeakub108/mcp-server && cd mcp-server && npm install && npm run build
server.usageInstructions: 1. Create src/env/keys.ts with API keys. 2. Configure MCP server in Windsurf Chat using the built index.js path. 3. Use tools in Cursor's Composer.

cipher42.name: Cipher42 MCP Server
cipher42.description: Unified MCP server providing API for database and data warehouse tools like Claude and Cursor
cipher42.usageInstructions: 1. Sign-up to Cipher42.ai. 2. Connect your datasource. 3. Get your personal API key. 4. Configure Claude Desktop by editing claude_desktop_config.json with CIPHER42_API_KEY. 5. Restart Claude.

js.name: YepCode MCP Server
js.description: An MCP server enabling AI platforms to interact with YepCode's infrastructure, executing LLM generated scripts and turning YepCode processes into AI-ready tools.
js.usageInstructions: 1. Install Node.js (version 18 or higher). 2. Configure YEPCODE_API_TOKEN environment variable with your YepCode API token. 3. Use 'npx -y @yepcode/mcp-server' to run the server. Optional: Configure YEPCODE_MCP_OPTIONS for additional settings like disabling run_code tool or run_code cleanup.

mongodb-mysql.name: MCP-MongoDB-MySQL-Server
mongodb-mysql.description: A Model Context Protocol server providing MySQL and MongoDB database operations
mongodb-mysql.usageInstructions: 1. Install via Smithery or manually clone and build the project. 2. Configure MySQL and MongoDB connections using .env file or direct connection parameters. 3. Use available tools for database operations.

wegene-assistant.name: WeGene Assistant MCP Server
wegene-assistant.description: MCP server for analyzing WeGene genetic testing reports using LLM
wegene-assistant.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository
2. Run 'uv sync --dev --all-extras'
3. Configure Claude Desktop by adding the MCP server configuration to claude_desktop_config.json
4. Create .env file with WeGene API key and secret

openmetadata.name: OpenMetadata MCP Server
openmetadata.description: An MCP server implementation for OpenMetadata, enabling standardized interaction with OpenMetadata through the Model Context Protocol.
openmetadata.usageInstructions: 1. Install using npm install @yangkyeongmo/mcp-server-openmetadata. 2. Configure OPENMETADATA_URL and OPENMETADATA_API_KEY environment variables. 3. Run the server.

tavily-search.name: MCP Tavily Search
tavily-search.description: An MCP server providing search functionality through Tavily.
tavily-search.usageInstructions: 1. Install using 'go install github.com/y7ut/mcp-tavily-search@latest'. 2. Configure in MCP config file with command and API key. 3. Use with npx @modelcontextprotocol/inspector for debugging.

neodb.name: NeoDB MCP Server
neodb.description: An MCP server implementation for interacting with NeoDB, a social book cataloging service, providing tools to fetch user information, search books, and retrieve detailed book information.
neodb.installCommand: curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh && uv venv && source .venv/bin/activate && uv pip install .
neodb.usageInstructions: 1. Install UV package installer. 2. Create and activate a Python virtual environment. 3. Install project dependencies. 4. Configure Claude Desktop with neodb-mcp server details including API base URL and access token.

repomix.name: Repomix
repomix.description: A tool that packs entire repositories into AI-friendly formats for use with Large Language Models.
repomix.usageInstructions: Run 'repomix' in your project directory after installation. The tool generates a 'repomix-output.xml' file by default.

pdf-extraction.name: PDF Extraction MCP Server
pdf-extraction.description: MCP server to extract contents from PDF files, with fixes for Claude Code CLI installation.
pdf-extraction.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/lh/mcp-pdf-extraction-server.git && cd mcp-pdf-extraction-server && pip install -e .
pdf-extraction.usageInstructions: 1. Clone and install the repository. 2. Find the installed command path using 'which pdf-extraction'. 3. Add the server to Claude Code using 'claude mcp add pdf-extraction <path>'. 4. Verify the server is connected in Claude with '/mcp'. Requires Python3.11+, pip or conda, and Claude Code CLI installed.

swagger-viewer.name: Swagger Viewer MCP
swagger-viewer.description: An MCP tool for Cursor editor to view and use Swagger API documentation.
swagger-viewer.usageInstructions: Create swagger.json in user root directory with swaggerUrl. Use MCP interfaces like mcp_swagger_initialize(), mcp_swagger_search(query), mcp_swagger_generate_code(path, method, language), mcp_swagger_get_all_endpoints().

go.name: Go MCP Server
go.description: An MCP server providing Go documentation tools for AI assistants, exposing Go's documentation and package listing capabilities.
go.usageInstructions: 1. Run 'go-mcp' after installation. 2. Configure your MCP-compatible assistant with the 'go-mcp' command and set WORKDIR to your Go project path.

grpcurl.name: MCP Grpcurl Server
grpcurl.description: An MCP server for interacting with gRPC services using grpcurl, enabling method invocation, service listing, and service description.
grpcurl.usageInstructions: 1. Install grpcurl from https://github.com/fullstorydev/grpcurl. 2. Run 'mcp-grpc-client'. 3. Configure MCP settings with 'mcp-grpcurl' command and set ADDRESS environment variable to your gRPC server address (e.g., localhost:8005).

gpt-proxy.name: GPT MCP Proxy
gpt-proxy.description: A REST API server providing HTTP access to Multiple Command Protocol (MCP) tools, acting as a bridge between HTTP clients and MCP-compliant tool servers.
gpt-proxy.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/wricardo/mcp-http-server.git && cd mcp-http-server && go build
gpt-proxy.usageInstructions: 1. Set NGROK_AUTH_TOKEN and NGROK_DOMAIN environment variables. 2. Create mcp_settings.json configuration file. 3. Run the server using 'go run main.go'. Ensure Go1.20 or later is installed and ngrok account is configured.

trader.name: MCP Trader Server
trader.description: A simplified Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for stock and cryptocurrency analysis.
trader.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/wshobson/mcp-trader.git && cd mcp-trader && uv venv --python3.11 && source .venv/bin/activate && uv sync
trader.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and set up the environment. 2. Create a .env file with your TIINGO_API_KEY. 3. Run the server using 'uv run mcp-trader'. For development mode, use 'uv run python -m mcp_trader.server'. Configure Claude Desktop App with the provided JSON configuration.

hotnews.name: HotNews MCP Server
hotnews.description: An MCP server providing real-time hot trending topics from major Chinese social platforms and news sites.
hotnews.usageInstructions: To use this MCP server, you can call the `get_hot_news` function with a list of platform IDs. For example: `get_hot_news([1,3,7])` to get hot lists from Zhihu Hot, Baidu Hot Discussion, and Hupu Hot List. The server can be run using NPX or built and run using Docker.

jina-reader.name: Jina Reader MCP Server
jina-reader.description: An MCP server that fetches the content of a remote URL as Markdown using Jina Reader
jina-reader.usageInstructions: 1. Install the package globally using npm. 2. Set the JINA_READER_API_KEY environment variable. 3. Run 'mcp-jina-reader' to start the server.

make.name: MCP Server Make
make.description: An MCP server that provides make functionality to LLMs, enabling safe execution of make targets from any Makefile.
make.usageInstructions: To run the server: 'uvx mcp-server-make'. Configure Claude Desktop by adding to claude_desktop_config.json: '"make": { "command": "uvx", "args": ["mcp-server-make", "--make-path", "/absolute/path/to/Makefile", "--working-dir", "/absolute/path/to/working/dir"] }'. See docs/user_guide.md for detailed configuration.

scrapbox-cosense.name: Scrapbox Cosense MCP Server
scrapbox-cosense.description: MCP server for cosense/scrapbox providing page retrieval, listing, searching, and creation capabilities
scrapbox-cosense.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/worldnine/scrapbox-cosense-mcp.git && cd scrapbox-cosense-mcp && npm install && npm run build
scrapbox-cosense.usageInstructions: Configure the server in Claude Desktop by adding the server configuration to claude_desktop_config.json. Set required environment variables COSENSE_PROJECT_NAME and COSENSE_SID. Optional variables can be configured as needed. Use the tools in Claude by specifying commands like get_page, list_pages, search_pages, create_page, and get_page_url.

textwell.name: Textwell Write Tool MCP Server
textwell.description: An MCP server that writes text to Textwell on macOS using various modes like replace, insert, and add.
textwell.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/worldnine/textwell-mcp.git && cd textwell-mcp && npm install && npm run build
textwell.usageInstructions: After installation, run the server. Configure Textwell on macOS to connect to this MCP server. Use the 'write-text' tool with appropriate modes (replace, insert, add) to write text to Textwell.

file-converter.name: File Converter MCP Server
file-converter.description: MCP server providing multiple file conversion tools for various document and image formats.
file-converter.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/wowyuarm/file-converter-mcp.git && cd file-converter-mcp && pip install mcp docx2pdf pdf2docx pillow pandas pdfkit markdown
file-converter.usageInstructions: Run the server in development mode with 'mcp dev file_converter_server.py'. Install for Claude Desktop with 'mcp install file_converter_server.py --name "File Converter"'. Use tools like 'docx2pdf', 'pdf2docx', 'convert_image', 'excel2csv', 'html2pdf', and 'convert_file' with appropriate input parameters.

claudecomputercommander.name: Desktop Commander MCP
claudecomputercommander.description: Execute terminal commands, manage files, and automate tasks through Model Context Protocol (MCP) with AI integration.
claudecomputercommander.usageInstructions: 1. Ensure Claude Desktop app is installed. 2. Run the installation command. 3. Configure Claude's desktop config if needed. 4. Restart Claude if running.

reddit.name: MCP Reddit Server
reddit.description: An MCP server for interacting with Reddit API, enabling AI assistants to browse and analyze Reddit content.
reddit.installCommand: docker run -i --rm -e REDDIT_CLIENT_ID=your_client_id -e REDDIT_CLIENT_SECRET=your_client_secret -e REDDIT_USER_AGENT=your_user_agent ghcr.io/nangeplus/mcp-reddit:latest
reddit.usageInstructions: 1. Configure Reddit API credentials as environment variables. 2. Use with Claude desktop client by adding mcpServer configuration. 3. Available tools: search_subreddit, get_post_details, get_subreddit_hot.

wix.name: Wix MCP Server
wix.description: Wix MCP server for integrating Wix tools and services with AI clients
wix.usageInstructions:
1. Ensure Node.js (version 19.9.0 or higher) is installed.
2. Configure the MCP server in your AI client using the provided JSON configuration.
3. For troubleshooting, check IDE logs, verify npx arguments, and try running the server directly via command line.

dingding.name: DingTalk MCP Server V2
dingding.description: An MCP server implementation for DingTalk robot interactions, providing features like sending messages, getting conversation info, user info, and calendar events.
dingding.installCommand: docker run -i --rm --name mcp-dingding-v2 -e DINGTALK_APP_KEY=your_app_key -e DINGTALK_APP_SECRET=your_app_secret ghcr.io/wllcnm/mcp-dingding-v2:latest
dingding.usageInstructions: 1. Set DINGTALK_APP_KEY and DINGTALK_APP_SECRET environment variables. 2. Run the Docker command. 3. Use the API tools like send_message, get_conversation_info, get_user_info, and get_calendar_list in your Claude configuration.

osm.name: MCP-OSM: OpenStreetMap Integration for MCP
osm.description: Provides OpenStreetMap integration for MCP, allowing users to query and visualize map data through an MCP interface.
osm.installCommand: uv run --with mcp[cli] --with psycopg2 mcp run mcp.py
osm.usageInstructions: 1. Configure environment variables in .env file. 2. Run using: uv run --env-file .env --with mcp[cli] --with psycopg2 mcp run mcp.py. 3. Access map interface at http://localhost:8889/. Available MCP tools: get_map_view, set_map_view, set_map_title, add_map_marker, add_map_line, add_map_polygon, query_osm_postgres.

wildfly.name: WildFly MCP Server
wildfly.description: A WildFly MCP server to integrate with AI chatbots for managing WildFly servers using natural language.
wildfly.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/wildfly-extras/wildfly-mcp.git && cd wildfly-mcp/wildfly-mcp-server && npm install
wildfly.usageInstructions: After installation, configure the server by setting optional parameters if needed. The server can be integrated with WildFly Chat Bot for interacting with WildFly servers.

cursor-a11y.name: Cursor A11y MCP
cursor-a11y.description: An MCP server providing accessibility testing capabilities for web applications using axe-core and Puppeteer.
cursor-a11y.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/westsideori/cursor-a11y-mcp.git && cd cursor-a11y-mcp && npm install
cursor-a11y.usageInstructions:
1. Run `npm run build` to compile the source code.
2. Start the MCP server with `npm start`.
3. Run the test site with `npm run start:test-site`.
4. Configure in Cursor by adding a new MCP Server with the command `node path/to/cursor-a11y-mcp/build/index.js`.

db-tool.name: Database Explorer MCP Tool
db-tool.description: A powerful Model Context Protocol (MCP) tool for exploring and managing different types of databases including PostgreSQL, MySQL, and Firestore.
db-tool.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/wirdes/db-mcp-tool.git && cd db-mcp-tool && npm install && npm run build
optionalParams: connection details for PostgreSQL, MySQL, or Firestore
db-tool.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies using 'npm install'. 2. Build the project using 'npm run build'. 3. Configure the tool in Cursor settings with the command 'node /path/to/project/dist/index.js'. 4. Connect to your database using '!pg' for PostgreSQL, '!mysql' for MySQL, or '!firestore' for Firestore with appropriate connection details. 5. Use commands like '!tables', '!triggers', '!functions', '!query', '!export-db', '!export-data' to manage your database.

datadog.name: Datadog MCP Server
datadog.description: MCP server for Datadog API, enabling incident management and observability features.
datadog.usageInstructions: After installation, configure Datadog API credentials and initialize the server. Use available commands like list_incidents, get_monitors, and query_metrics to interact with Datadog services.

webscraping-ai.name: WebScraping.AI MCP Server
webscraping-ai.description: An MCP server implementation that integrates with WebScraping.AI for web data extraction capabilities.
webscraping-ai.usageInstructions: 1. Run using npx: 'npx -y webscraping-ai-mcp'. 2. Set required environment variable WEBSCRAPING_AI_API_KEY. 3. Optional: Configure additional environment variables for customization.

waldur.name: Waldur MCP Server
waldur.description: Waldur MCP server enables integration between Waldur instance and Claude Desktop by implementing the Model Context Protocol (MCP).
waldur.usageInstructions: 1. Install Claude Desktop. 2. Install Python3.13+ and uv. 3. Configure Claude Desktop config file with WALDUR_API_URL and WALDUR_TOKEN. For development: use 'uv run waldur-mcp-server'. For debugging: use MCP Inspector via 'npx @modelcontextprotocol/inspector'.

jira.name: MCP Jira Server
jira.description: Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Jira Cloud products, enabling search and read operations on Jira issues.
jira.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/vurtnec/mcp-jira && cd mcp-jira && npm install && npm run build
jira.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and run 'npm install && npm run build'. 2. Configure the server in claude_desktop_config.json with your Jira credentials and URL. 3. Obtain API tokens from https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/security/api-tokens.

pubmed.name: PubMed Search MCP Server
pubmed.description: An MCP server that provides PubMed search functionality with note management capabilities.
pubmed.usageInstructions: To use this MCP server, configure it in Claude Desktop by adding the server details to claude_desktop_config.json. For development, use 'uv run pubmed_search' in the project directory. Debugging can be done using MCP Inspector via 'npx @modelcontextprotocol/inspector uv --directory /path/to/pubmed_search run pubmed-search'.

slim.name: Slim-MCP: Claude Tools
slim.description: Python-based MCP server providing calculator, weather, and datetime tools for Claude AI
slim.installCommand: conda create -n mcp-tools python=3.11 && conda activate mcp-tools && git clone https://github.com/webdevtodayjason/slim-MCP.git && cd slim-MCP && uv pip install -e .
slim.usageInstructions:
1. Create conda environment: conda create -n mcp-tools python=3.11
2. Activate environment: conda activate mcp-tools
3. Clone repository and install: git clone https://github.com/webdevtodayjason/slim-MCP.git && cd slim-MCP && uv pip install -e .
4. Configure Claude Desktop/Claude Web/Cursor IDE with the Python executable path from the conda environment

rosetta.name: MCP Rosetta Server
rosetta.description: MCP server integrating with Rosetta binary for protein structure analysis
rosetta.usageInstructions: After cloning the repository, set the required environment variables (ROSETTA_SCRIPT_PATH, PDB_DIR, OUTPUT_DIR, ROSETTA_BIN_PATH, ROSETTA_DB_PATH) to your specific paths. The server is configured by defining these paths.

gdrive.name: Google Drive MCP Server
gdrive.description: MCP server that integrates with Google Drive to list, read, and search files.
gdrive.usageInstructions: 1. Create Google Cloud project and enable Drive API. 2. Configure OAuth consent screen. 3. Create OAuth Client ID. 4. Rename OAuth key file to 'gcp-oauth.keys.json'. 5. Run 'node ./dist auth' to authenticate. For Docker: 'docker run -i --rm --mount type=bind,source=/path/to/gcp-oauth.keys.json,target=/gcp-oauth.keys.json -v mcp-gdrive:/gdrive-server -e GDRIVE_OAUTH_PATH=/gcp-oauth.keys.json -e GDRIVE_CREDENTIALS_PATH=/gdrive-server/credentials.json -p 3000:3000 mcp/gdrive auth'

ollama.name: MCP Server for Ollama
ollama.description: An MCP server enabling Claude Desktop to communicate with Ollama LLM server
ollama.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/vincentf305/mcp-server-ollama.git && cd mcp-server-ollama && pip install -r requirements.txt
ollama.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository
2. Copy `.env.example` to `.env` and configure as needed
3. Configure Claude Desktop by editing `claude_desktop_config.json` with the appropriate path to this MCP server

k8s.name: Kubernetes MCP Server
k8s.description: A Python-based MCP server for Kubernetes clusters that exposes a comprehensive API to retrieve cluster information and diagnose issues.
k8s.installCommand: git clone git@github.com:vlttnv/k8s-mcp.git && cd k8s-mcp && uv venv && source .venv/bin/activate && uv sync
k8s.usageInstructions: After installation, configure Claude for Desktop by editing ~/Library/Application Support/Claude/claude_desktop_config.json. Ensure proper kubeconfig setup or appropriate RBAC permissions if running in-cluster.

websocket.name: MCP WebSocket Server
websocket.description: An MCP server with WebSocket enhancements for real-time data updates, handling standard MCP requests and WebSocket subscriptions.
websocket.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/virajsharma2000/mcp-websocket.git && cd mcp-websocket && pip install websockets mcp-sdk
websocket.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and install dependencies.
2. Start the server with 'python server.py'.
3. Connect to WebSocket server at 'ws://localhost:8765' and subscribe with '{"action": "subscribe"}'.
4. Send MCP requests to 'http://localhost:8080'.

pg-schema.name: PostgreSQL MCP Server
pg-schema.description: An MCP server providing read-only access to PostgreSQL databases, enabling LLMs to inspect database schemas and execute read-only queries.
pg-schema.usageInstructions: To use with Claude Desktop, add the server configuration to claude_desktop_config.json. Replace '/mydb' with your database name. For Docker on macOS, use 'host.docker.internal' if the server is on the host network.

canvas.name: Canvas MCP Server
canvas.description: An MCP server implementation for interacting with Canvas Learning Management System API, providing educators with an intelligent interface while maintaining FERPA compliance.
canvas.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/vishalsachdev/canvas-mcp.git && cd canvas-mcp && python scripts/install.py
canvas.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and run the automated installer. 2. Configure environment variables in .env file. 3. Set up Claude Desktop integration by modifying claude_desktop_config.json. 4. Test the installation using 'canvas-mcp-server --test'

pandoc.name: mcp-pandoc Document Conversion Server
pandoc.description: An MCP server for document format conversion using pandoc, supporting multiple input/output formats.
pandoc.usageInstructions: 1. Install pandoc and uv. 2. Verify installations with 'pandoc --version' and 'uvx --version'. 3. For PDF conversion, install TeX Live. 4. Use the server with 'uvx mcp-pandoc' and configure as needed.

groww.name: Groww MCP Server
groww.description: An MCP server for interacting with the Groww trading API, allowing portfolio management and market data access.
groww.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/venkatakaushikvemani/groww-mcp && cd groww-mcp && npm install
groww.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and cd into it.
2. Run 'npm install' to install dependencies.
3. Create a .env file with GROWW_API_KEY and optional PORT.
4. Start the server with 'npm start'.

bc.name: Business Central MCP Server
bc.description: A server providing standardized development rules and context for Business Central projects, optimized for Cursor editor.
bc.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/vanachterjacob/BC-MCP.git && cd BC-MCP && npm install
bc.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository or copy bc-rules.json and .cursor-context to your project. 2. For administrators: Edit bc-rules.json or manage rules via MongoDB. 3. Set environment variables: MCP_SERVER_PORT and optionally MONGODB_URI. 4. Run node scripts/generateRules.js to update static rules from database.

vectara.name: Vectara MCP Server
vectara.description: Vectara MCP Server provides AI applications with fast, reliable RAG capabilities through the Model Context Protocol.
vectara.usageInstructions: After installation, configure Claude Desktop by adding the server to claude_desktop_config.json. Restart Claude Desktop to access Vectara MCP tools. First-time usage requires setting Vectara API key and corpus key(s) when prompted.

deepseek.name: MCP Server for Deepseek Integration
deepseek.description: An MCP server implementation that allows Claude Desktop to use Deepseek models running in Docker.
deepseek.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/vincentf305/mcp-server-deepseek.git && cd mcp-server-deepseek && pip install -r requirements.txt
deepseek.usageInstructions:
1. Create a .env file with DEEPSEEK_API_KEY=your_api_key_here
2. Run the server using Docker: docker build -t mcp_server_deepseek . && docker run -d --name mcp-server-deepseek -p8765:8765 -e DEEPSEEK_API_KEY=your_api_key_here mcp-server-deepseek
3. Configure Claude Desktop by adding the MCP server configuration to claude_desktop_config.json

vantage.name: Vantage MCP Server
vantage.description: An open-source tool that lets you interact with your cloud cost data through AI assistants and MCP clients.
vantage.usageInstructions: 1. Create a read-only Vantage API token. 2. Install using 'brew install vantage-sh/tap/vantage-mcp-server'. 3. Configure MCP client (Claude, Cursor, or Goose) with the Vantage MCP Server binary path and VANTAGE_BEARER_TOKEN.

x.name: X(Twitter) MCP Server
x.description: An MCP server to create, manage and publish X/Twitter posts directly through Claude chat.
x.usageInstructions: 1. Install via Smithery using the provided command. 2. Create claude_desktop_config.json in the appropriate directory based on your OS. 3. Configure the JSON with the correct command, args, and environment variables including your Twitter API credentials. 4. Quit and reopen Claude.

uiflowchartcreator.name: UIFlowchartCreator
uiflowchartcreator.description: An MCP server for creating UI flowcharts with easy-to-use API for flowchart creation
uiflowchartcreator.usageInstructions: Add to MCP configuration: { "mcpServers": { "uiflowchartcreator": { "command": "node", "args": ["path/to/uiflowchartcreator/build/index.js"], "env": {} } } }. Refer to src/index.ts for API documentation.

valyu-js.name: Valyu MCP Server
valyu-js.description: A Model Context Protocol server providing access to Valyu's knowledge retrieval and feedback APIs
valyu-js.installCommand: docker pull ghcr.io/tiovikram/valyu-mcp-server && docker run -i --rm -e VALYU_API_KEY=your-api-key ghcr.io/tiovikram/valyu-mcp-server
valyu-js.usageInstructions: 1. Pull the Docker image using 'docker pull ghcr.io/tiovikram/valyu-mcp-server'. 2. Run the server with 'docker run -i --rm -e VALYU_API_KEY=your-api-key ghcr.io/tiovikram/valyu-mcp-server'. 3. Configure Claude.app settings to use the server. 4. Use the 'knowledge' and 'feedback' tools as shown in the example interactions.

replicate.name: MCP Server for Replicate
replicate.description: A FastMCP server implementation for interfacing with Replicate's API, providing access to various AI models.
replicate.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/tzafrir/mcp-server-replicate && cd mcp-server-replicate && pip install -r requirements.txt
replicate.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and install dependencies.
2. Create a .env file with your REPLICATE_API_TOKEN.
3. Run the server using 'fastmcp dev server.py'.

wazuh.name: Wazuh MCP Server
wazuh.description: Production-grade Model Context Protocol server for Wazuh security platform integration
wazuh.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/gensecaihq/Wazuh-MCP-Server.git && cd Wazuh-MCP-Server && pip install -r requirements.txt && pip install -e .
wazuh.usageInstructions:
1. Configure .env file with Wazuh credentials
2. Configure Claude Desktop configuration file
3. Run server with 'python wazuh_mcp_server.py --stdio'

vertexai-search.name: MCP Server for Vertex AI Search
vertexai-search.description: An MCP server that integrates with Vertex AI to search documents using private data.
vertexai-search.usageInstructions: 1. Install the package using 'pip install git+https://github.com/ubie-oss/mcp-vertexai-search.git'. 2. Create a config file from config.yml.template. 3. Run 'mcp-vertexai-search serve --config config.yml --transport <stdio|sse>'. Prerequisites include uv and a Vertex AI data store. Refer to README for detailed configuration and testing instructions.

basescan.name: Base Network MCP Server
basescan.description: An MCP server for accessing Base Network blockchain data, providing tools for querying blocks, transactions, and smart contracts.
basescan.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/u-Operating-System/basescan-mcp-server.git && cd basescan-mcp-server && npm install && npm run build
basescan.usageInstructions: 1. Clone repository and install dependencies. 2. Configure environment variables as needed. 3. Run 'npm start' to start the server. For Claude Desktop, add configuration to claude_desktop_config.json. Docker users can run with 'docker run -p3010:3010 basescan-mcp-server'.

sol.name: Model Context Protocol Server for Solana Client
sol.description: An MCP server providing Solana blockchain functionality for Claude Desktop
sol.usageInstructions: 1. Install using 'npx -y @smithery/cli install @tywenk/mcp-solana --client claude'. 2. Configure Claude desktop JSON config with server details. 3. Ensure uv binary and paths are absolute.

puppeteer-py.name: Puppeteer MCP Server (Python)
puppeteer-py.description: A Model Context Protocol server providing browser automation capabilities using Playwright.
puppeteer-py.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/twolven/mcp-server-puppeteer-py.git && cd mcp-server-puppeteer-py && pip install -r requirements.txt && playwright install
puppeteer-py.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and install requirements.
2. Run 'playwright install' to install browsers.
3. Start the server with 'python puppeteer_server.py'.
4. Configure Claude Desktop with the appropriate command and args.

local-dev.name: MCP Local Dev
local-dev.description: A local development environment manager that lets LLMs configure and manage dev environments automatically.
local-dev.usageInstructions: 1. Install Claude Desktop from the MCP quickstart guide. 2. Add the server configuration to Claude Desktop config. 3. Point Claude at any GitHub repository and ask it to set up a dev environment.

surfpool.name: Surfpool
surfpool.description: Surfpool is a blazing-fast in-memory Solana testnet that allows instant point-forking of Solana mainnet.
surfpool.installCommand: brew install txtx/taps/surfpool # for macOS or snap install surfpool # for Linux
surfpool.usageInstructions: Start a local Solana network with: surfpool start. For Anchor projects, it automatically generates infrastructure as code, deploys programs, and provides a structured environment.

rand.name: MCP Rand
rand.description: An MCP server providing various random generation utilities including UUID, numbers, strings, passwords, Gaussian distribution, dice rolling, and card drawing.
rand.usageInstructions: After installation, you can use the server as a CLI tool with 'npx mcp-rand' or integrate it with MCP clients by configuring it in your client configuration. Various tools are available for generating random data, rolling dice, and drawing cards.

text-editor.name: MCP Text Editor Server
text-editor.description: An MCP server providing line-oriented text file editing capabilities through a standardized API, optimized for LLM tools.
text-editor.usageInstructions: Start the server using 'uvx mcp-text-editor' or 'docker run -i --rm --mount type=bind,src=/some/path/src,dst=/some/path/dst mcp/text-editor'. Configure Claude.app by adding the server configuration to claude_desktop_config.json.

shell.name: MCP Shell Server
shell.description: A secure shell command execution server implementing the Model Context Protocol (MCP) for remote execution of whitelisted shell commands.
shell.usageInstructions: Start the server with: ALLOW_COMMANDS='ls,cat,echo' uvx mcp-shell-server. Configure allowed commands via ALLOW_COMMANDS environment variable. Send requests with command arrays and optional stdin, directory, and timeout parameters.

tavily-proxy.name: Tavily MCP Server with Proxy Support
tavily-proxy.description: An MCP server providing AI-powered web search capabilities with proxy support
tavily-proxy.usageInstructions: 1. Install using 'pip install mcp-tavily-proxy'. 2. Set TAVILY_API_KEY environment variable. 3. Optionally configure HTTP_PROXY and HTTPS_PROXY. 4. Run using 'python -m mcp_server_tavily'. For Claude integration, add appropriate configuration to Claude settings.

akshare.name: AKShare MCP Server
akshare.description: An MCP server providing financial data analysis capabilities using AKShare library.
akshare.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/yourusername/akshare_mcp_server.git && cd akshare_mcp_server && python -m venv venv && source venv/bin/activate && uv pip install -e .
akshare.usageInstructions: 1. Activate virtual environment: source venv/bin/activate. 2. Run server: python run_server.py. 3. Configure Claude Desktop with the server details.

interactive.name: Interactive MCP Server
interactive.description: A Node.js/TypeScript MCP server facilitating interactive communication between LLMs and users, enabling features like user input prompts and OS notifications.
interactive.usageInstructions: To use with Claude Desktop/Cursor, add configuration to claude_desktop_config.json or mcp.json. For VS Code, add to User Settings (JSON) or .vscode/mcp.json. Use command-line options like --timeout and --disable-tools in the client's args array.

instagram.name: Instagram DM MCP Server
instagram.description: An MCP server for sending Instagram Direct Messages and managing Instagram interactions.
instagram.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/trypeggy/instagram_dm_mcp.git && cd instagram_dm_mcp && uv sync
optionalParams: command line arguments for username and password
instagram.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies using 'uv sync'. 2. Configure Instagram credentials using environment variables or command line arguments. 3. Create configuration files for Claude Desktop or Cursor. 4. Restart Claude Desktop or Cursor to use the Instagram DM MCP integration.

facebook-ads-library.name: Facebook Ads Library MCP Server
facebook-ads-library.description: An MCP server for searching and analyzing Facebook's public ads library, providing insights into companies' advertising strategies.
facebook-ads-library.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/trypeggy/facebook-ads-library-mcp.git && cd facebook-ads-library-mcp && python -m pip install -r requirements.txt
facebook-ads-library.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and cd into it. 2. Obtain an API token from Scrape Creators. 3. Configure the MCP server connection by creating a JSON config file with your API key. 4. Restart Claude Desktop or Cursor to see the Facebook Ads Library integration.

pdf2png.name: PDF to PNG MCP Server
pdf2png.description: An MCP server that converts PDF documents to PNG images.
pdf2png.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/truaxki/mcp-Pdf2png.git && cd mcp-Pdf2png && uv venv && .venv/Scripts/activate && uv pip install -e .
pdf2png.usageInstructions: 1. Configure MCP client by adding server configuration to claude_desktop_config.json. 2. Use the pdf2png tool with read_file_path and write_folder_path parameters.

youtube-summarizer.name: YouTube Summarizer MCP Server
youtube-summarizer.description: MCP server exposing YouTube Summarizer APIs as tools for AI applications
youtube-summarizer.installCommand: docker build -t youtube-summarizer-mcp . && docker run -i --rm youtube-summarizer-mcp
youtube-summarizer.usageInstructions: To use with Claude Desktop, add the server configuration to claude_desktop_config.json. Alternatively, use the MCP Inspector with ./inspector.sh or run the MCP client sample using ./run.sh after running ./setup.sh

cua.name: C/ua - Computer-Use Agent
cua.description: Docker for Computer-Use Agents enabling AI control of operating systems in virtual containers
cua.usageInstructions: 1. Install Docker. 2. Run the installation command. 3. Follow the guided setup to launch the Computer-Use Agent UI.

aws-pricing.name: AWS EC2 Pricing MCP Server
aws-pricing.description: An MCP server providing real-time AWS EC2 pricing information for LLMs and automation scripts.
aws-pricing.usageInstructions: To use this MCP server, first configure your mcp_config.json with the appropriate Docker command. For local Python usage, download the pricing data using 'curl https://cloudfix-public-aws-pricing.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com/pricing/ec2_pricing.json.gz | gunzip > ec2_pricing.json' and ensure it's in the same directory as server.py.

variance-log.name: MCP Variance Log
variance-log.description: Agentic tool that logs statistical variations in conversation structure to a SQLite database, built using the Model Context Protocol (MCP).
variance-log.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/truaxki/mcp-variance-log.git && cd mcp-variance-log && uv pip install -e .
variance-log.usageInstructions: 1. Configure Claude Desktop by adding the server to claude_desktop_config.json. 2. Update the PATH_TO_REPO in the config file to point to the installation directory. 3. Use commands like 'log-query', 'read-logs', 'read_query' to interact with the logged data stored in data/varlog.db.

lara.name: Lara Translate MCP Server
lara.description: An MCP server for Lara Translate API, enabling powerful translation capabilities with language detection and translation memories.
lara.usageInstructions: After installation, configure the Lara Translate API key as an environment variable. Run 'lara-mcp --help' for available commands and options. The server listens on the configured port (default: 8080).

pdf-reader.name: PDF Reader MCP Server
pdf-reader.description: An MCP server for reading and extracting text from PDF files, supporting both local files and URLs.
pdf-reader.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/trafflux/pdf-reader-mcp.git && cd pdf-reader-mcp && docker build -t mcp/pdf-reader .
optionalParams: path to local PDF files directory for volume mounting
pdf-reader.usageInstructions:
1. Run with local PDFs: docker run -i --rm -v /path/to/pdfs:/pdfs mcp/pdf-reader
2. Run without local PDFs: docker run -i --rm mcp/pdf-reader
3. Configure MCP settings as shown in the README

python-run.name: Python MCP Server
python-run.description: Python service implementing Model Context Protocol (MCP) for executing Python code via standardized API endpoints.
python-run.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/topherbc/python-run-mcp && cd python-run-mcp && pip install -r requirements.txt
python-run.usageInstructions:
1. Start the server: python src/server.py
2. Send requests to the /run_python endpoint: curl -X POST http://localhost:8000/run_python -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"code": "print(\'Hello, World!\')"}'

memory-cache.name: Memory Cache Server
memory-cache.description: An MCP server that reduces token consumption by caching data between language model interactions.
memory-cache.usageInstructions: 1. Install via Smithery using the provided command. Alternatively, clone the repository, run 'npm install', and 'npm run build'. 2. Configure the server by creating a config.json file or using environment variables in your MCP client settings. 3. Add the server to your MCP client settings, specifying the path to the built index.js file.

toolhouse.name: Toolhouse MCP Server
toolhouse.description: MCP server connecting to Toolhouse's tools via their API
toolhouse.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository: git clone https://github.com/toolhouse-community/mcp-server-toolhouse.git
2. Configure TOOLHOUSE_API_KEY and TOOLHOUSE_BUNDLE environment variables
3. Modify Claude's configuration file (claude_desktop_config.json) to include the server configuration

cognee.name: Cognee - Memory for AI Agents
cognee.description: Cognee is an AI memory management system that replaces RAG systems, providing dynamic memory for agents through scalable ECL pipelines.
optionalParams: other configuration variables as described in the documentation
cognee.usageInstructions: 1. Install using 'pip install cognee'. 2. Set LLM_API_KEY environment variable with your OpenAI API key. 3. Use the provided Python example to add, cognify, and search data.

nativewind.name: NativeWind MCP Server
nativewind.description: MCP server for transforming Tailwind components to NativeWind4
nativewind.usageInstructions: Run 'mcp-nativewind' as a CLI tool or configure in Claude for Desktop by adding to claude_desktop_config.json

strava.name: Strava MCP Server
strava.description: An MCP server providing access to Strava API for athlete activities data
strava.usageInstructions: 1. Create Strava API application and get Client ID/Secret. 2. Run 'python get_strava_token.py' to get refresh token. 3. Set STRAVA_CLIENT_ID, STRAVA_CLIENT_SECRET, and STRAVA_REFRESH_TOKEN environment variables. 4. Configure Claude for Desktop or use Claude Web with MCP extension.

claude-data-explorer.name: Claude MCP Data Explorer
claude-data-explorer.description: An MCP server for data exploration with Claude, enabling CSV loading and JavaScript data analysis.
claude-data-explorer.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/tofunori/claude-mcp-data-explorer.git && cd claude-mcp-data-explorer && npm install && npm run setup
claude-data-explorer.usageInstructions: 1. Start Claude Desktop. 2. Select the 'Explore Data' prompt template. 3. Enter CSV file path and exploration topic. Ensure Node.js v16+ and Claude Desktop are installed. Enable Developer Mode in Claude Desktop.

ietf.name: MCP-Server-IETF
ietf.description: An MCP server for fetching IETF RFC documents for Large Language Models
ietf.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/tizee/mcp-server-ietf && cd mcp-server-ietf && pip install -e .
ietf.usageInstructions: Start the server with 'mcp-server-ietf'. Use with MCP inspector: 'npx @modelcontextprotocol/inspector uv run mcp-server-ietf'. Requires Python 3.11 or higher.

tinybird.name: Tinybird MCP Server
tinybird.description: An MCP server to interact with a Tinybird Workspace from any MCP client, supporting SSE and STDIO modes.
tinybird.usageInstructions: 1. Install using 'uvx mcp-tinybird'. 2. Configure Claude Desktop by creating claude_desktop_config.json with TB_API_URL and TB_ADMIN_TOKEN. 3. Restart Claude Desktop. For SSE mode, run 'uvx mcp-tinybird sse'.

youtube-transcripts.name: YouTube Transcript Extractor
youtube-transcripts.description: A command-line tool that extracts transcripts from YouTube videos with support for various URL formats and configurable output options.
youtube-transcripts.usageInstructions: python youtube_transcript.py <youtube-url> [options]. Requires Python 3.12 or higher. Automatically installs dependencies: click and youtube_transcript_api.

unix-manual.name: Unix Manual Server
unix-manual.description: An MCP server providing Unix command documentation within Claude conversations.
unix-manual.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/tizee/mcp-unix-manual.git && cd mcp-unix-manual && pip install -e . && mcp install unix_manual_server.py
unix-manual.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install the package using 'pip install -e .' or 'uv install -e .'. 2. Install the server in Claude Desktop using 'mcp install unix_manual_server.py'. For development, use 'mcp dev unix_manual_server.py'. Requires Python3.13+ and Claude Desktop.

tana.name: Tana MCP Server
tana.description: An MCP server connecting to Tana's Input API for LLM data manipulation
tana.usageInstructions:
1. Install using 'npm install -g tana-mcp'
2. Configure TANA_API_TOKEN environment variable with your Tana API token
3. Set up Claude Desktop or Raycast configuration to use the server

google-calendar.name: Google Calendar MCP Server
google-calendar.description: An MCP server that integrates with Google Calendar, allowing event management and calendar insights through Claude Desktop.
google-calendar.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/thisnick/google-calendar-mcp.git && cd google-calendar-mcp && npm install && npm run build
google-calendar.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies. 2. Set up Google Cloud credentials by enabling the Google Calendar API and creating OAuth2.0 credentials. 3. Place the client secret JSON file as `.client_secret.json` in the project root. 4. Configure Claude Desktop by adding the server config to `claude_desktop_config.json`. 5. Run the server and complete the initial authentication process.

tigris.name: Tigris MCP Server
tigris.description: Tigris MCP Server implements the MCP specification to connect AI agents with Tigris object storage, enabling bucket and object management.
tigris.usageInstructions: 1. Sign up at storage.new. 2. Get access key from storage.new/accesskey. 3. Set AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, and AWS_ENDPOINT_URL_S3. 4. Run using Docker or npx.

ai.name: thirdweb AI
ai.description: Comprehensive toolkit for blockchain data analysis, wallet management, and AI agent interaction with blockchains
ai.usageInstructions:
1. Run using uvx: uvx thirdweb-mcp
2. Alternatively, install using pipx: pipx install thirdweb-mcp
3. Set THIRDWEB_SECRET_KEY environment variable before running
4. For Python SDK, install using pip: pip install "thirdweb-ai[all]"
5. See documentation at https://portal.thirdweb.com/ for comprehensive guides

terraform.name: Terraform Registry MCP Server
terraform.description: An MCP server providing tools for interacting with the Terraform Registry API, enabling AI agents to query provider information and module metadata.
terraform.usageInstructions: To use this MCP server, configure it in Cursor or Claude Desktop by providing the command 'npx -y terraform-mcp-server'. For Terraform Cloud features, set the TFC_TOKEN environment variable with your Terraform Cloud API token.

terminal.name: MCP SSE Server and STDIO Server Examples
terminal.description: Examples of MCP servers using different transport methods and environments
terminal.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository: git clone https://github.com/theailanguage/terminal && cd terminal. 2. Follow the tutorial for your chosen setup: Option1 (Local Python): https://youtu.be/_veLqeCzdIQ, Option2 (Docker): https://youtu.be/cgml6yzrOjc, Option3 (SSE Local Docker): https://youtu.be/s0YJNcT1XMA, Option4 (SSE on GCP): https://youtu.be/s0YJNcT1XMA. 3. Test the server using prompts in Claude.

squad.name: Squad MCP Server
squad.description: An MCP server connecting Squad AI platform to LLM applications, providing tools for product strategy artefacts.
squad.usageInstructions: 1. Obtain Squad API key from https://meetsquad.ai Settings  Developer  API Keys. 2. Run server using one of the methods: standalone executable, Docker, or from source. 3. Configure MCP client by adding 'mcpServers' entry with command and environment variables.

tox-testing.name: Tox Testing MCP Server
tox-testing.description: An MCP server that executes tox commands to run Python tests using pytest, providing various test execution modes.
tox-testing.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/that1guy15/tox-testing && cd tox-testing && npm install && npm run build
tox-testing.usageInstructions: Configure the server in your MCP settings file with the path to your Python project and optional timeout. Use the 'run_tox_tests' tool with different modes (all, file, case, directory) to execute tests. Follow the recommended workflow with Cline for efficient test execution and debugging.

openai.name: OpenAI MCP Server
openai.description: An MCP server that integrates with OpenAI's API, allowing users to query OpenAI models directly from Claude.
openai.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/thadius83/mcp-server-openai.git && cd mcp-server-openai && pip install -e .
openai.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and install dependencies.
2. Configure Claude Desktop by adding the server to your MCP settings configuration.
3. Get an OpenAI API key and add it to your configuration file.
4. Restart Claude.
5. Use the 'ask-openai' tool in Claude with the use_mcp_tool command.

cursor-rust-tools.name: Cursor Rust Tools
cursor-rust-tools.description: MCP server providing Rust Analyzer, Crate Docs, and Cargo Commands to Cursor LLM
cursor-rust-tools.usageInstructions: 1. Run 'cursor-rust-tools' to start with UI or 'cursor-rust-tools --no-ui' for headless mode. 2. Configure projects via UI or manually in ~/.cursor-rust-tools. 3. Create .cursor/mcp.json in your project directory. 4. Enable MCP server in Cursor settings.

supabase-nextjs.name: Supabase NextJS MCP Server
supabase-nextjs.description: A TypeScript-based MCP server implementing a simple notes system for NextJS with resources, tools, and prompts.
supabase-nextjs.usageInstructions: 1. Install using Smithery CLI. 2. Configure Claude Desktop by adding server config to claude_desktop_config.json. 3. Set NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL and NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY environment variables.

xrpl-service.name: XRPL MCP Service
xrpl-service.description: An MCP server providing comprehensive access to the XRP Ledger through standardized endpoints
xrpl-service.installCommand: pip install xrpl-py fastapi uvicorn python-dotenv && uvicorn main:app --host 0.0.0.0 --port 8000 --reload
xrpl-service.usageInstructions: 1. Create a .env file with XRPL_NODE_URL. 2. Run the server using uvicorn. 3. Use API endpoints for XRPL operations.

ip-geolocator.name: MCP IP Geolocation Server
ip-geolocator.description: An MCP server providing IP geolocation services via IP-API.com, returning structured location data without requiring an API key.
ip-geolocator.usageInstructions: 1. Install using 'npm install -g mcp-ip-geolocator'. 2. Run the server with 'mcp-ip-geolocator'. 3. Connect to the server in Claude Desktop and query IP locations.

alpaca.name: Alpaca MCP Server
alpaca.description: An MCP server enabling LLMs like Claude to interact with Alpaca trading API for stock trading and account management.
alpaca.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/alpaca-mcp.git && cd alpaca-mcp && pip install mcp alpaca-py python-dotenv
alpaca.usageInstructions: 1. Create a .env file with Alpaca API credentials. 2. Run 'python alpaca_mcp_server.py'. 3. Configure Claude for Desktop by adding server configuration to claude_desktop_config.json.

u301.name: U301 URL Shortener MCP Server
u301.description: MCP server for creating short URLs using U301 service
u301.usageInstructions: 1. Create an API key in U301 Dashboard (https://u301.com). 2. Optionally configure custom domain via Cloudflare. 3. Configure MCP server with API key in config: { "mcpServers": { "u301-url-shortener": { "command": "npx", "args": ["-y", "@u301/mcp"], "env": { "U301_API_KEY": "<Your-U301-API-Key>" } } } }

imessage.name: Mac iMessage MCP for Claude
imessage.description: An MCP implementation for reading and sending iMessages on MacBook, allowing AI assistants like Claude to interact with iMessage.
imessage.usageInstructions: To use this MCP server, ensure you have Node.js installed. After installation, configure the server according to your iMessage setup. The server allows Claude or other AI assistants supporting MCP to read and send iMessages.

loxo.name: Loxo MCP Server
loxo.description: An MCP server providing tools for interacting with the Loxo recruitment platform API, enabling AI assistants to manage candidates, jobs, activities, and call queues.
loxo.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/tbensonwest/loxo-mcp-server.git && cd loxo-mcp-server && npm install && npm run build
loxo.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies. 2. Copy .env.example to .env and fill in required values. 3. Run 'npm start' to start the server. Configuration requires setting LOXO_API_KEY and LOXO_AGENCY_SLUG. LOXO_DOMAIN defaults to 'app.loxo.co' if not set.

github-projects.name: GitHub Projects MCP Server
github-projects.description: An MCP server that enables AI agents to create and manage Agile Sprint-based projects using GitHub Projects.
github-projects.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and cd into it. 2. Run 'bun install'. 3. Create a .env file with required environment variables. 4. Run 'bun run build'. 5. Configure your MCP client with the server settings.

bart.name: BART MCP Server
bart.description: An MCP server implementation for accessing BART departures data
bart.usageInstructions: To use this server, simply run 'bart-mcp' after installation. The server will start and be ready to serve MCP requests.

homeassistant.name: Home Assistant MCP Server
homeassistant.description: An MCP server that bridges Home Assistant with Language Learning Models (LLMs) for natural language control and monitoring of smart home devices.
homeassistant.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/jango-blockchained/homeassistant-mcp.git && cd homeassistant-mcp && docker compose up -d
homeassistant.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and cd into it.
