2. Configure environment variables by copying .env.example to .env and editing it.
3. Run 'docker compose up -d' to start the server.
4. Verify installation by checking http://localhost:3000/health.

tv-recommender.name: TV Recommender MCP Server
tv-recommender.description: An MCP server providing TV show recommendations and information through TMDb API integration.
tv-recommender.installCommand: npm install -g tv-recommender-mcp-server && export TMDB_API_KEY=your_api_key_here && tv-recommender-mcp-server
tv-recommender.usageInstructions:
1. Install globally using npm
2. Set TMDB_API_KEY environment variable
3. Run tv-recommender-mcp-server
4. Configure in Cursor using .cursor/mcp.json

smartsheet.name: Smartsheet MCP Server
smartsheet.description: An MCP server providing seamless integration with Smartsheet for automated document management and data operations.
smartsheet.usageInstructions: 1. Install using npm. 2. Set SMARTSHEET_API_TOKEN environment variable. 3. Run the server. 4. Configure MCP client to connect to the server.

tavily.name: Tavily MCP Server
tavily.description: Tavily MCP server provides real-time web search, data extraction, web mapping, and crawling capabilities for AI assistants.
tavily.usageInstructions:
1. Ensure Node.js (v20 or higher) is installed.
2. Obtain a Tavily API key from https://app.tavily.com/home.
3. Run the server using 'npx -y tavily-mcp@latest'.
4. Configure MCP clients (VS Code, Cursor, Claude Desktop) with the server settings, including the Tavily API key.

docker-servers.name: Docker MCP Servers
docker-servers.description: Docker-based MCP servers for various services like Slack, Notion, and GitHub
docker-servers.usageInstructions: Choose the appropriate service (slack, notion, github) and replace 'your-{service}-token' with the actual token. For Slack, both SLACK_BOT_TOKEN and SLACK_TEAM_ID are required. For Notion and GitHub, their respective API tokens are required.

tecton.name: Tecton MCP Server
tecton.description: Tecton MCP Server provides tool-based context and assistance for feature engineering through integration with LLM-powered editors like Cursor.
tecton.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/tecton-ai/tecton-mcp.git && cd tecton-mcp && brew install uv && MCP_SMOKE_TEST=1 uv --directory $(pwd) run mcp run src/tecton_mcp/mcp_server/server.py
tecton.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and cd into it.
2. Install uv package manager.
3. Verify installation with MCP_SMOKE_TEST=1 uv command.
4. Configure Cursor with the MCP server path.
5. Log into your Tecton cluster using 'tecton login'.

diff-python.name: MCP Server Diff Python
diff-python.description: An MCP server for obtaining text differences between two strings using Python's difflib library.
diff-python.usageInstructions: To use with Claude Desktop, add the server config to claude_desktop_config.json. For development, clone the repository and use 'uv sync' and 'uv build'.

perplexity.name: Perplexity MCP Server
perplexity.description: MCP Server for the Perplexity API, enabling chat completion with citations.
perplexity.usageInstructions: To use this server, install it via 'uvx mcp-server-perplexity', set PERPLEXITY_API_KEY environment variable, and configure Claude Desktop by adding the server details to claude_desktop_config.json.

diff-typescript.name: MCP Server Diff TypeScript
diff-typescript.description: A Model Context Protocol server that generates unified diffs between text strings.
diff-typescript.usageInstructions: To use with Claude Desktop, configure the server in claude_desktop_config.json. For global installation, use 'npx -y mcp-server-diff-typescript'. For local development, clone the repository, run 'npm install', and 'npm run build', then configure with the path to build/index.js.

usescraper.name: UseScraper MCP Server
usescraper.description: An MCP server providing web scraping capabilities through the UseScraper API, allowing content extraction from web pages in various formats.
usescraper.usageInstructions: 1. Install using Smithery CLI. 2. Configure Claude Desktop by adding server config to claude_desktop_config.json. 3. Use the 'scrape' tool through MCP interface with required URL and optional format parameters.

twitter-scraper.name: Twitter MCP Server
twitter-scraper.description: An MCP server providing tools for interacting with Twitter using the agent-twitter-client library.
twitter-scraper.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/takiAA/twitter-scraper-mcp.git && cd twitter-scraper-mcp && npm install
twitter-scraper.usageInstructions:
1. Create a .env file with required Twitter credentials.
2. Run the server using 'npx fastmcp dev' for development or 'npx fastmcp inspect' for visual inspection.

supavec.name: Supavec MCP Server
supavec.description: An MCP server that enables AI assistants to fetch relevant embeddings and content from Supavec.
supavec.usageInstructions:
1. Get your Supavec API key from https://supavec.com
2. Run: supavec-mcp --api-key your_api_key
3. Configure in Cursor/VS Code/Claude using npx @supavec/mcp-server

ts-introspect.name: TypeScript Package Introspector MCP Server
ts-introspect.description: An MCP server that extracts TypeScript package information and provides it to LLM applications.
ts-introspect.usageInstructions: To use this MCP server, run 'npx ts-introspect-mcp-server'. For project integration, create a .roo/mcp.json configuration file with the appropriate command and args. The server provides 'introspect-package' and 'introspect-source' tools.

linear.name: MCP Linear
linear.description: An MCP server implementation for Linear GraphQL API enabling AI assistants to interact with Linear project management systems.
linear.usageInstructions: 1. Get Linear API token from linear.app settings. 2. Configure MCP settings file with LINEAR_API_TOKEN. 3. Run using 'npx -y @smithery/cli install @tacticlaunch/mcp-linear --client [cursor/claude]' or manually with 'mcp-linear' after global installation.

ssh-rails-runner.name: MCP Server: SSH Rails Runner
ssh-rails-runner.description: An MCP server for secure remote execution of Rails console commands via SSH, enabling read-only operations and managed mutations.
ssh-rails-runner.usageInstructions: Configure environment variables, then run with Claude Desktop using the provided configuration. Review code snippets before executing mutations.

cgv.name: CGV Cinema API Client
cgv.description: A Python client for interacting with CGV Cinema's mobile API, providing access to movie listings, cinema locations, and booking capabilities.
cgv.usageInstructions: After installation, import the client in your Python script and configure it according to your needs. Check the GitHub repository for example usage.

dblp.name: MCP-DBLP Server
dblp.description: An MCP server providing access to DBLP computer science bibliography database for Large Language Models.
dblp.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/szeider/mcp-dblp.git && cd mcp-dblp && uv venv && source .venv/bin/activate && uv pip install -e .
dblp.usageInstructions: 1. Install an MCP-compatible client (e.g., Claude Desktop app). 2. Clone the repository and set up the virtual environment. 3. Create the configuration file at the specified path with the required content. 4. Configure the 'command' and 'args' in the configuration file to point to the mcp-dblp directory.

stability-ai.name: Stability AI MCP Server
stability-ai.description: MCP server integrating Stability AI's Stable Diffusion image manipulation functionalities
stability-ai.usageInstructions:
1. Sign up for Stability AI API key at https://platform.stability.ai/account/keys
2. Set STABILITY_API_KEY and IMAGE_STORAGE_DIRECTORY environment variables
3. Run the server using 'mcp-server-stability-ai'
4. Configure MCP client to connect to the server

claude-chatgpt.name: Claude ChatGPT MCP Tool
claude-chatgpt.description: MCP tool allowing Claude to interact with ChatGPT desktop app on macOS.
claude-chatgpt.usageInstructions: 1. Run 'npx claude-chatgpt-mcp'. 2. Configure Claude Desktop by editing ~/Library/Application Support/Claude/claude_desktop_config.json. 3. Restart Claude Desktop. 4. Grant necessary permissions in System Preferences.

claude-outlook.name: Claude Outlook MCP Tool
claude-outlook.description: MCP tool allowing Claude to interact with Microsoft Outlook for macOS, enabling email, calendar, and contact operations.
claude-outlook.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/syedazharmbnr1/claude-outlook-mcp.git && cd claude-outlook-mcp && bun install && chmod +x index.ts
claude-outlook.usageInstructions: 1. Configure Claude Desktop by editing ~/Library/Application Support/Claude/claude_desktop_config.json to include the tool. 2. Restart Claude Desktop. 3. Grant Terminal accessibility permissions in System Preferences. Use Claude to perform Outlook operations like checking emails, scheduling events, or managing contacts.

redash.name: Redash MCP Server
redash.description: MCP server for integrating Redash with AI assistants like Claude, enabling query and dashboard management.
redash.usageInstructions: 1. Set REDASH_URL and REDASH_API_KEY environment variables. 2. Configure Claude for Desktop by adding the MCP server configuration to claude_desktop_config.json. 3. Use npx -y @suthio/redash-mcp to start the server.

zotero.name: Zotero MCP Server
zotero.description: MCP server for interacting with local Zotero repository, enabling programmatic access to search papers, manage notes, and more.
zotero.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/swairshah/zotero-mcp-server && cd zotero-mcp-server && pip install -e .
zotero.usageInstructions: 1. Create .env file with ZOTERO_API_KEY and ZOTERO_USER_ID. 2. Configure Anthropic Desktop app by modifying claude_desktop_config.json. 3. Run server using 'python -m zotero_mcp.server' after activating virtual environment.

sumup-agent-toolkit.name: SumUp Agent Toolkit MCP Server
sumup-agent-toolkit.description: MCP Server that integrates with AI-powered code editors and apps such as Claude or Cursor to interact with SumUp API.
sumup-agent-toolkit.usageInstructions: Set SUMUP_API_KEY environment variable with your SumUp API key before running the server. The server integrates with applications supporting Model Context Protocol (MCP) like Claude and Cursor.

paradex-py.name: MCP Paradex Server
paradex-py.description: MCP server implementation for Paradex trading platform, enabling AI assistants to interact with Paradex services.
paradex-py.usageInstructions: 1. Set PARADEX_ENVIRONMENT to 'testnet' or 'mainnet'. 2. Set PARADEX_ACCOUNT_PRIVATE_KEY to your private key. 3. Run using 'uvx mcp-paradex' or configure in Claude Desktop.

upload-file.name: MCP File Upload Server
upload-file.description: An MCP server for file uploading with configurable upload URL and form data
upload-file.usageInstructions: Configure MCP server by adding 'upload-file' configuration with required env vars (UPLOAD_URL, FILE_KEY) and optional params (FILE_NAME, EXTRA_FORM). Ensure npx is available by installing Node.js.

imagesorcery.name: ImageSorcery MCP
imagesorcery.description: ComputerVision-based image recognition and editing tools for AI assistants, enabling local image processing without sending images to servers.
imagesorcery.installCommand: python -m venv imagesorcery-mcp && source imagesorcery-mcp/bin/activate && pip install imagesorcery-mcp && imagesorcery-mcp --post-install
imagesorcery.usageInstructions: 1. Create and activate a virtual environment using Python's venv module. 2. Install the package using pip or uv pip. 3. Run the post-installation script. Configure the MCP client to use ImageSorcery MCP by adding its configuration to the MCP-configuration file.

typesense.name: Typesense MCP Server
typesense.description: An MCP server implementation providing AI models with Typesense search capabilities
typesense.usageInstructions: Configure Claude Desktop by adding server config to claude_desktop_config.json with command and args: ['--host', 'your-typesense-host', '--port', '8108', '--protocol', 'http', '--api-key', 'your-api-key']

agent-toolkit.name: Stripe Agent Toolkit
agent-toolkit.description: The Stripe Agent Toolkit enables popular agent frameworks to integrate with Stripe APIs through function calling, supporting both Python and TypeScript.
agent-toolkit.usageInstructions: To use the Stripe Agent Toolkit, configure it with your Stripe secret key. For MCP server, run: npx -y @stripe/mcp --tools=all --api-key=YOUR_STRIPE_SECRET_KEY

beeminder.name: MCP Beeminder Server
beeminder.description: An MCP server implementation for interacting with the Beeminder API, enabling AI assistants to manage Beeminder goals and datapoints.
beeminder.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/strickvl/mcp-beeminder.git && cd mcp-beeminder && uv run mcp-beeminder
beeminder.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and configure Claude Desktop by adding the server configuration to claude_desktop_config.json. 2. Set BEEMINDER_API_KEY and BEEMINDER_USERNAME environment variables. 3. Use Claude Desktop to interact with Beeminder goals and datapoints.

trino.name: Trino MCP Server
trino.description: Model Context Protocol server for Trino, providing AI models with structured access to Trino's distributed SQL query engine.
trino.usageInstructions: Start the server with docker-compose up -d. The server will be available at http://localhost:9097. Use curl -X POST 'http://localhost:9097/api/query' -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"query": "SELECT 1 AS test"}' to verify the API is working.

k8s-go.name: MCP K8S Go
k8s-go.description: Golang-based MCP server connecting to Kubernetes, enabling interaction with Kubernetes resources through various clients like Claude Desktop.
k8s-go.usageInstructions: After installation, configure Claude Desktop by adding 'mcp-k8s' to claude_desktop_config.json. You can also use it with other clients or run directly with 'npx @strowk/mcp-k8s'. For Docker, use 'docker run -i -v ~/.kube/config:/home/nonroot/.kube/config --rm mcpk8s/server:latest'.

peekaboo.name: Peekaboo MCP
peekaboo.description: A powerful macOS utility for capturing screenshots and analyzing them with AI vision models, working as both a standalone CLI tool and an MCP server.
peekaboo.usageInstructions: For CLI usage: 'peekaboo image', 'peekaboo list', 'peekaboo analyze'. For MCP server, configure in Claude Desktop or Cursor IDE settings. Create configuration file with 'peekaboo config init'.

semgrep.name: Semgrep MCP Server
semgrep.description: An MCP server for integrating Semgrep static code analysis into development environments.
semgrep.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/stefanskiasan/semgrep-mcp-server.git && cd semgrep-mcp-server && npm install && npm run build
semgrep.usageInstructions: Start the server using 'npm start' for production or 'npm run dev' for development. The server provides various MCP tools for Semgrep integration including scan_directory, list_rules, and analyze_results.

steel.name: Steel MCP Server
steel.description: An MCP server enabling LLMs like Claude to navigate the web through Puppeteer-based tools and Steel integration.
steel.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/steel-dev/steel-mcp-server.git && cd steel-mcp-server && npm install && npm run build
steel.usageInstructions: 1. Clone and build the project. 2. Configure Claude Desktop by adding a server entry to ~/Library/Application Support/Claude/claude_desktop_config.json. 3. Set STEEL_LOCAL and STEEL_API_KEY/STEEL_BASE_URL environment variables accordingly. 4. Start Claude Desktop to launch the MCP server.

chain-of-draft.name: Chain of Draft MCP Server
chain-of-draft.description: MCP server implementing Chain of Draft reasoning approach for efficient LLM interactions
chain-of-draft.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/stat-guy/chain-of-draft && cd chain-of-draft && pip install -r requirements.txt
chain-of-draft.usageInstructions:
1. Clone repository
2. Install dependencies: pip install -r requirements.txt
3. Configure ANTHROPIC_API_KEY in .env file
4. Run server: python server.py
5. Configure Claude Desktop config file with server details

stateset.name: StateSet MCP Server
stateset.description: A world-class Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for StateSet API integration, providing comprehensive e-commerce operations management.
stateset.usageInstructions: 1. Set up environment variables by copying .env.example to .env and editing it with your StateSet API credentials. 2. Run the server using 'stateset-mcp-server' command. 3. Connect your MCP client using the provided SDK.

harvester.name: Harvester MCP Server
harvester.description: MCP server for Harvester HCI enabling AI assistants to interact with Harvester clusters
harvester.usageInstructions: 1. Install using 'go install'. 2. Configure kubeconfig path via --kubeconfig flag or KUBECONFIG env var. 3. Run with appropriate log level. 4. Configure Claude Desktop to use the server.

feature-discussion.name: Feature Discussion MCP Server
feature-discussion.description: An MCP server providing AI lead developer capabilities for feature discussions and architectural guidance.
feature-discussion.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/squirrelogic/mcp-feature-discussion.git && cd mcp-feature-discussion && npm install && npm run build
feature-discussion.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies using 'npm install'. 2. Build the server using 'npm run build'. 3. Configure Claude Desktop by adding the server path to claude_desktop_config.json. 4. For development, use 'npm run watch' for auto-rebuild. 5. Use 'npm run inspector' for debugging with MCP Inspector.

architect.name: MCP Architect
architect.description: An MCP server providing architectural expertise through specialized agents and tools for various architectural domains.
architect.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/squirrelogic/mcp-architect.git && cd mcp-architect && npm install
architect.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and install dependencies.
2. Copy the .env.example file to .env.
3. Add your OpenAI API key to the .env file.
4. Configure any additional parameters as needed.

svelte-docs.name: Svelte5 Documentation MCP Server
svelte-docs.description: An MCP server providing comprehensive Svelte5 reference for LLMs, including migration patterns, features, and best practices.
svelte-docs.usageInstructions: To use this MCP server, configure it according to the examples provided for your platform (Claude Desktop, Windsurf, Windows, macOS, or Linux). The server can be started using 'npx -y mcp-svelte-docs' command. No additional environment variables or parameters are required.

memory-libsql.name: MCP Memory LibSQL Server
memory-libsql.description: A high-performance, persistent memory system for the Model Context Protocol (MCP) powered by libSQL, providing vector search capabilities and efficient knowledge storage.
memory-libsql.usageInstructions: Configure LIBSQL_URL environment variable to point to your database. For local SQLite databases, use 'file:/path/to/database.db'. For remote libSQL databases, use 'libsql://your-database.turso.io' and provide LIBSQL_AUTH_TOKEN.

perplexity-search.name: MCP Perplexity Search
perplexity-search.description: An MCP server integrating Perplexity's AI API with LLMs for advanced chat completion capabilities.
perplexity-search.usageInstructions: Configure the server by setting the PERPLEXITY_API_KEY environment variable. Use an MCP client to interact with the server's chat_completion tool.

sequentialthinking-tools.name: MCP Sequential Thinking Tools
sequentialthinking-tools.description: An MCP server that guides tool usage in problem-solving through sequential thinking and intelligent tool recommendations.
sequentialthinking-tools.usageInstructions: Configure the server through your MCP client settings. For Cline, add the server configuration to your MCP settings JSON. For Claude Desktop with WSL, modify your configuration accordingly. The server requires parameters like 'thought', 'next_thought_needed', 'thought_number', and 'total_thoughts' to function.

embedding-search.name: MCP Embedding Search Server
embedding-search.description: An MCP server for vector similarity search in transcript databases using Turso embeddings.
embedding-search.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/spences10/mcp-embedding-search.git && cd mcp-embedding-search && npm install && npm run build
embedding-search.usageInstructions: Configure the server through your MCP client by providing TURSO_URL and TURSO_AUTH_TOKEN environment variables. Use the search_embeddings tool to query transcript segments by asking questions.

youtube.name: Youtube MCP Server
youtube.description: A bridge between the YouTube API and AI assistants, enabling features like video summary creation through closed captions download.
youtube.usageInstructions: 1. Install using 'uv tool install git+https://github.com/sparfenyuk/mcp-youtube'. 2. Configure Claude Desktop by adding 'mcp-youtube' to claude_desktop_config.json. 3. For development: clone the repository, run 'uv sync', and then 'uv run mcp-youtube --help'.

cargo-doc.name: Cargo Doc MCP Server
cargo-doc.description: MCP server for managing Rust documentation through cargo doc commands, providing tools to check, build, and search Rust documentation locally.
cargo-doc.usageInstructions: 1. Install dependencies and build the server using 'pnpm install && pnpm run build'. 2. Configure the MCP server by adding the path to the built index.js in your configuration file. 3. For development, use 'pnpm run watch' for auto-rebuild. 4. Use 'pnpm run inspector' for debugging.

visitbeijing.name: Beijing Tourism MCP Server
visitbeijing.description: Provides real-time Beijing tourism information including visitor flow data, performance updates, and travel guides.
visitbeijing.installCommand: Configuration requires manual setup: create MCP server configuration JSON with URL and API key
visitbeijing.usageInstructions: 1. Create configuration JSON with 'mcpServers' object containing 'visitbeijing' server details. 2. Set 'url' to http://mcp.visitbeijing.com.cn/sse. 3. Obtain and set 'ak' (API key) through certification process. 4. Contact lishuo@huaqniu.com for certification and security information.

prompts.name: MCP Prompts Server
prompts.description: A robust server for managing and serving prompts for LLM applications, built on the Model Context Protocol (MCP).
prompts.usageInstructions: Run with NPX: npx -y @sparesparrow/mcp-prompts. For Docker: docker run -d --name mcp-server -p3003:3003 -v $(pwd)/data:/app/data ghcr.io/sparesparrow/mcp-prompts:latest. Configure storage type and Postgres URL if needed.

project-orchestrator.name: MCP Project Orchestrator
project-orchestrator.description: A comprehensive project orchestration tool for managing Model Context Protocol (MCP) projects, templates, prompts, and Mermaid diagrams.
project-orchestrator.usageInstructions: After installation, initialize the respective managers (TemplateManager, PromptManager, MermaidGenerator) with appropriate paths and use their methods to manage templates, prompts, and generate diagrams. Refer to Quick Start examples in README for detailed usage.

excel-reader.name: Excel Reader Server
excel-reader.description: An MCP server that reads Excel files and returns data in JSON format.
excel-reader.usageInstructions: After installation, use the server by providing Excel file paths and optionally sheet names or indices. The server returns JSON data representing the Excel content.

atlassian.name: MCP Atlassian
atlassian.description: Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Atlassian products (Confluence and Jira) supporting both Cloud and Server/Data Center deployments.
atlassian.usageInstructions: 1. Set up authentication using API Token, Personal Access Token, or OAuth2.0. 2. Configure environment variables for Confluence and Jira. 3. Run the Docker container with required environment variables. 4. For IDE integration, configure the MCP server in your IDE settings.

solana-dev.name: Solana Model Context Protocol (MCP) Demo
solana-dev.description: A simple MCP server implementation for Solana development providing basic RPC methods and helpful prompts.
solana-dev.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/solana-foundation/solana-dev-mcp.git && cd solana-dev-mcp && pnpm install
solana-dev.usageInstructions: 1. Explore the code in index.ts. 2. Modify the server by adding more tools and resources. 3. Generate configuration file using 'pnpm generate-config' or 'pnpm build && pnpm generate-config:js'. Use the generated config with Claude, Windsurf, or Cursor.

s3.name: S3 Tools MCP Server
s3.description: An MCP server providing tools for interacting with AWS S3 buckets through the Model Context Protocol.
s3.usageInstructions: 1. Configure AWS credentials using 'aws configure' or environment variables. 2. Add server configuration to Claude Desktop config file. 3. Run using 'uvx s3-tools' or configure in Claude Desktop.

binance.name: Binance Cryptocurrency MCP
binance.description: MCP service for accessing Binance cryptocurrency market data, allowing AI agents to execute Binance API calls and obtain real-time data.
binance.usageInstructions: To use in Cursor IDE: 1. Go to Cursor Settings > MCP, 2. Click + Add New MCP Service, 3. Configure with command: 'npx -y @snjyor/binance-mcp@latest'. For other MCP-compatible environments, create mcp.json with appropriate configuration. Start querying cryptocurrency data using available tools like get_price, get_order_book, etc.

openapi.name: OpenAPI MCP Server
openapi.description: An MCP server for Claude/Cursor that enables searching and exploring OpenAPI specifications through oapis.org.
openapi.usageInstructions: 1. Install using 'npx -y @smithery/cli install @janwilmake/openapi-mcp-server --client claude'. 2. Ensure Node.js >=16.17.0 is installed. 3. Use with Claude Desktop or Cursor by asking queries like 'Find information about the Stripe API'.

ntropy.name: Ntropy MCP Server
ntropy.description: MCP server for enriching banking data using the Ntropy API
ntropy.usageInstructions: 1. Obtain an Ntropy API key from ntropy.com. 2. Run the server using 'uvx run ntropy-mcp --api-key YOUR_NTROPY_API_KEY'. 3. Configure Claude Desktop by adding the server configuration to claude_desktop_config.json.

salesforce.name: MCP Salesforce Connector
salesforce.description: An MCP server implementation for Salesforce integration, enabling SOQL queries, SOSL searches, and various Salesforce operations.
salesforce.usageInstructions: Configure the server in your claude_desktop_config.json file. For OAuth, set SALESFORCE_ACCESS_TOKEN and SALESFORCE_INSTANCE_URL as environment variables. For legacy authentication, use SALESFORCE_USERNAME, SALESFORCE_PASSWORD, and SALESFORCE_SECURITY_TOKEN.

figma.name: Figma MCP Server
figma.description: An MCP server providing Figma API integration for AI assistants like Claude.
figma.usageInstructions: 1. Install using 'npm install -g mcp-figma'. 2. Configure Claude with 'mcp-figma' settings. 3. Set Figma API key using 'mcp-figma set_api_key <your_api_key>'. 4. Use available Figma API functions through Claude.

aidd.name: SkyDeckAI Code MCP Server
aidd.description: An MCP server providing AI-driven development tools including file operations, code analysis, and web content fetching.
aidd.usageInstructions: After installation, configure Claude Desktop by adding 'skydeckai-code' to claude_desktop_config.json. Use the CLI tool 'skydeckai-code-cli' for various operations like reading files, executing code, and web searches.

test-repo.name: Uber Eats MCP Server
test-repo.description: An MCP server implementation for Uber Eats integration with LLM applications
test-repo.installCommand: uv venv && source .venv/bin/activate && uv pip install -r requirements.txt && playwright install
test-repo.usageInstructions:
1. Activate virtual environment: source .venv/bin/activate
2. Configure ANTHROPIC_API_KEY in .env file
3. Run server: uv run mcp dev server.py

rememberizer.name: MCP Server Rememberizer
rememberizer.description: An MCP server for interacting with Rememberizer's document and knowledge management API, enabling Large Language Models to search, retrieve, and manage documents and integrations.
rememberizer.usageInstructions:
1. Install using: npx @michaellatman/mcp-get@latest install mcp-server-rememberizer
2. Set REMEMBERIZER_API_TOKEN environment variable with your Rememberizer API token
3. Configure Claude Desktop or SkyDeck AI Helper App to use the server
4. Use tools like retrieve_semantically_similar_internal_knowledge, smart_search_internal_knowledge, list_internal_knowledge_systems, rememberizer_account_information, list_personal_team_knowledge_documents, remember_this

apple-notes.name: Apple Notes MCP Server
apple-notes.description: An MCP server that reads the local Apple Notes database and provides it to Claude Desktop for enhanced note search capabilities.
apple-notes.usageInstructions: 1. Install using 'uvx apple-notes-mcp'. 2. Configure Claude Desktop by editing claude_desktop_config.json with the appropriate MCP server configuration. 3. Grant Full Disk Access to the server on MacOS to access the Apple Notes database.

pdf.name: PDF MCP Server
pdf.description: An MCP server for managing and reading PDF files in a specified local directory.
pdf.installCommand: go build -o pdf-mcp-server main.go && export PATH=$PATH:$(pwd) && source ~/.zshrc
pdf.usageInstructions: 1. Build the server using 'go build -o pdf-mcp-server main.go'. 2. Add the binary to your PATH. 3. Start the server with 'pdf-mcp-server -pdfdir=/path/to/papers'. Configure the Cursor settings with 'url': 'http://127.0.0.1:8080/sse'.

pinecone.name: Pinecone Model Context Protocol Server
pinecone.description: MCP server that enables reading and writing to a Pinecone index, providing semantic search and document management capabilities.
pinecone.usageInstructions: 1. Install using 'uvx install mcp-pinecone'. 2. Configure Claude Desktop by editing claude_desktop_config.json with your Pinecone index name and API key. 3. Sign up for Pinecone at https://www.pinecone.io/ and create an index. 4. For debugging, use 'npx @modelcontextprotocol/inspector uv --directory {project_dir} run mcp-pinecone'.

systemd-coredump.name: systemd-coredump MCP Server
systemd-coredump.description: An MCP server for managing and analyzing systemd-coredump functionality
systemd-coredump.usageInstructions: Add server configuration to MCP settings file. Requires Node.js18+, systemd-coredump, and coredumpctl. Some operations may need elevated privileges.

worldpay.name: Worldpay MCP Server
worldpay.description: An MCP server implementing Worldpay APIs for payments and payment queries.
worldpay.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/simonwfarrow/worldpay-mcp.git && cd worldpay-mcp && npm install && npm run build
worldpay.usageInstructions: 1. Configure environment variables WORLDPAY_USERNAME and WORLDPAY_PASSWORD. For stdio transport, create claude_desktop_config.json with server configuration. 2. Run 'node dist/server-sse.js' for SSE transport or let Claude start it automatically for stdio.

tidb-ai.name: TiDB AI MCP Server
tidb-ai.description: An MCP server allowing Cursor to interact with TiDB AI using stdio transport
tidb-ai.usageInstructions:
1. Run the server: ./tidb-ai-mcp
2. Configure Cursor to use the MCP server by specifying the path to the tidb-ai-mcp binary in Cursor settings

nebius.name: Nebius MCP Server
nebius.description: An MCP server integrating with Nebius services
nebius.usageInstructions: 1. Install using npm install mcp-nebius. 2. Set NEBIUS_API_KEY and NEBIUS_SERVICE_URL environment variables. 3. Run the server, optionally configuring PORT and LOG_LEVEL.

etoroportfoliomcp.name: eToro MCP Server
etoroportfoliomcp.description: MCP server for interacting with eToro's public API endpoints, allowing portfolio fetching, instrument details lookup, and instrument searching.
etoroportfoliomcp.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/shlomico-tr/etoroPortfolioMCP.git && cd etoroPortfolioMCP && npm install
etoroportfoliomcp.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies using 'npm install'. 2. Start the development server with 'npm run dev' or build for production with 'npm run build' and start with 'npm start'. 3. Use the REST API to access tools, e.g., 'curl -X POST http://localhost:3000/tools/fetch_etoro_portfolio/execute -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"username": "example"}''

couchbase.name: Couchbase Model Context Protocol Server
couchbase.description: An MCP server providing semantic search for Star Wars planets using Couchbase's vector search.
couchbase.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/shivay-couchbase/couchbase-mcp.git && cd couchbase-mcp && npm install
couchbase.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies. 2. Set required Couchbase environment variables. 3. Create a vector search index named 'vector-search-index' in Couchbase. 4. Start the server with 'npm start'. 5. Interact with the server using MCP requests via stdin/stdout.

shieldmcp.name: Shield MCP
shieldmcp.description: A security middleware for Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers that enhances security and monitoring capabilities without modifying the official SDK.
shieldmcp.usageInstructions: After installation, import and use the @secure_tool decorator to secure your MCP tools. Configure allowed tools, sanitization, and rate limiting as needed. See Quick Start section for example usage.

xtb.name: XTBApiServer
xtb.description: An MCP server exposing XTB API functionality for trading account interactions
xtb.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/sharplygroup/xtb-mcp-server.git && cd xtb-mcp-server && npm install
xtb.usageInstructions:
1. Create .env file with XTB API credentials
2. Run 'npm run build' to compile TypeScript
3. Run 'node build/index.js' to start server
4. Use MCP Inspector to connect to the server

mcptools-langchain-integration.name: Langchain TypeScript with MCP Tools Integration
mcptools-langchain-integration.description: A TypeScript project integrating Langchain with MCP tools for interactive chat with Language Models and tool execution.
mcptools-langchain-integration.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/shashwat001/mcptools-langchain-integration.git && cd mcptools-langchain-integration && npm install
mcptools-langchain-integration.usageInstructions: 1. Ensure Node.js (v14 or higher) and npm are installed. 2. Clone the repository and install dependencies. 3. Configure Ollama and MCP server settings in src/llm.js. 4. Start Ollama and MCP servers. 5. Run the application with 'node src/index.js'.

hefeng-weather.name: HeFeng Weather MCP Server
hefeng-weather.description: An MCP server providing weather forecast data through HeFeng Weather API
hefeng-weather.usageInstructions: Add the server configuration to claude_desktop_config.json with your API_KEY. The server provides weather forecast data through the 'get-weather' tool.

postman.name: Postman MCP Server
postman.description: An MCP server that enables running Postman collections using Newman, allowing LLMs to execute API tests and get detailed results.
postman.usageInstructions: 1. Install via Smithery using 'npx -y @smithery/cli install mcp-postman --client claude'. 2. Configure Claude desktop by adding the server to ~/Library/Application Support/Claude/claude_desktop_config.json. 3. Use in Claude by asking it to run a Postman collection.

knowledge-graph.name: MCP Knowledge Graph Server
knowledge-graph.description: A knowledge graph memory server implementing the Model Context Protocol (MCP) for persistent memory across AI chats.
knowledge-graph.usageInstructions: To use with Claude Desktop, add the server configuration to claude_desktop_config.json. For other AI platforms, configure according to their MCP implementation guidelines. The server exposes tools like create_entities, add_observations, and search_nodes through the MCP interface.

github-pr.name: GitHub PR Comments MCP Server
github-pr.description: An MCP server that fetches GitHub Pull Request comments using a personal access token.
github-pr.usageInstructions: 1. Install using Smithery CLI or manually clone the repository and run 'npm install'. 2. Create a .env file with GITHUB_TOKEN. 3. Build with 'npm run build'. 4. Run with 'npm start' or 'node dist/server.js your_github_token_here'. Configure in Cursor using 'node /path/to/dist/server.js your_github_token_here'.

function-hub.name: Function Hub MCP Server
function-hub.description: MCP Server for the Function Hub API, integrating with Claude Desktop.
function-hub.usageInstructions:
1. Get a Function Hub API Key from https://function-hub.com/api-keys.
2. Add the MCP server configuration to your claude_desktop_config.json with the API key.
3. Run Claude Desktop with the configured MCP server.

youtube-subtitles.name: YouTube Subtitles MCP Server
youtube-subtitles.description: An MCP server that allows AI assistants to download and analyze YouTube video subtitles.
youtube-subtitles.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/setkyar/youtube-subtitles-mcp.git && cd youtube-subtitles-mcp && docker build -t mcp/youtube-subtitles .
youtube-subtitles.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and build the Docker image. 2. Configure Claude Desktop to use the MCP server by updating its config file with: { "mcpServers": { "youtube-subtitles": { "command": "docker", "args": ["run", "-i", "mcp/youtube-subtitles"] } } }. 3. Restart Claude Desktop and use commands like 'Get video information', 'List available subtitle languages', or 'Download and analyze subtitles' for YouTube videos.

wallpaper.name: Wallpaper MCP
wallpaper.description: An MCP server that generates wallpaper images using Luma Labs AI and sets them as desktop wallpaper on macOS.
wallpaper.installCommand: git clone git@github.com:shahanneda/wallpaper-mcp.git && cd wallpaper-mcp && uv pip install -r requirements.txt
wallpaper.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies. 2. Set LUMAAI_API_KEY environment variable. 3. Configure Claude Desktop to use this server by modifying claude_desktop_config.json. 4. Run using 'uv run mcp run /path/to/server.py' or test with 'LUMAAI_API_KEY=API_KEY_HERE mcp dev server.py --with lumaai --with requests'

bing-searches.name: Bing Searches Analysis Toolkit
bing-searches.description: A comprehensive system for collecting, processing, and analyzing Bing search data to extract insights and patterns.
bing-searches.usageInstructions:
1. Install using 'npm install bing-searches-toolkit'
2. Run initial collection with 'bingsearch collect --topic "your-search-topic"'
3. Analyze collected data with 'bingsearch analyze --input results.json'
4. Optional: Configure BING_API_KEY and PROXY_URL environment variables for enhanced functionality

scrapeless.name: Scrapeless MCP Server
scrapeless.description: MCP server that integrates Google SERP results into LLM applications
scrapeless.usageInstructions: 1. Register at Scrapeless to get API key. 2. Configure SCRAPELESS_KEY environment variable. 3. Use with LLM applications like Claude.

anki.name: Anki MCP Server
anki.description: An MCP server implementation that connects to a locally running Anki, providing card review and creation.
anki.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/scorzeth/anki-mcp-server.git && cd anki-mcp-server && npm install && npm run build
anki.usageInstructions: 1. Install Anki desktop app and Anki-Connect add-on. 2. Clone the repository and run 'npm install && npm run build'. 3. Configure Claude Desktop by adding the server path to claude_desktop_config.json. 4. Use 'npm run watch' for development with auto-rebuild.

vilnius-transport.name: Vilnius Transport MCP Server
vilnius-transport.description: An MCP server providing Vilnius public transport data to Large Language Models
vilnius-transport.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/sarunasdaujotis/vilnius-transport-mcp-server && cd vilnius-transport-mcp-server && uv pip install -r requirements.txt
vilnius-transport.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository: git clone https://github.com/sarunasdaujotis/vilnius-transport-mcp-server
2. Configure claude_desktop_config.json with the MCP server details
3. Run the client using: uv run client.py path/src/vilnius_transport_mcp/transport.py

sumologic.name: MCP Sumo Logic
sumologic.description: An MCP server integrating Sumo Logic's API for log searches with configurable time ranges and error handling.
sumologic.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/samwang0723/mcp-sumologic.git && cd mcp-sumologic && npm install && npm run build
sumologic.usageInstructions: 1. Create a .env file with ENDPOINT, SUMO_API_ID, and SUMO_API_KEY. 2. Start the server using 'npm start'. Alternatively, use Docker: 'docker build -t mcp/sumologic .' then 'docker run --env-file .env mcp/sumologic'

ragdocs.name: MCP Server for RAG Documentation
ragdocs.description: An MCP server implementation providing vector search for documentation retrieval and processing, enabling AI assistants to augment responses with relevant documentation context.
ragdocs.usageInstructions:
1. Configure environment variables (QDRANT_URL, EMBEDDINGS_PROVIDER, etc.)
2. Run using: npx -y @sanderkooger/mcp-server-ragdocs
3. For local development, use docker-compose up -d to start Qdrant and Ollama services
4. Configure Claude Desktop or OpenAI integration through their respective configuration files

tesla.name: Tesla MCP Server
tesla.description: An MCP server connecting to Tesla Fleet API for vehicle control through AI assistants
tesla.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/scald/tesla-mcp.git && cd tesla-mcp && pnpm install
tesla.usageInstructions:
1. Configure .env file with Tesla credentials
2. Run 'pnpm get-token' to obtain refresh token
3. Run 'pnpm register' to register application with Tesla API
4. Run 'pnpm start' to start the server
5. Configure Claude desktop client to use the MCP server

package-docs.name: MCP Package Documentation Server
package-docs.description: An MCP server providing efficient access to package documentation across multiple programming languages with LSP capabilities.
package-docs.usageInstructions:
1. Run 'npx -y mcp-package-docs' to start the server.
2. Configure MCP settings with server command and args.
3. Optional: Enable LSP support by setting ENABLE_LSP=true in environment variables.
4. Use provided tools (lookup_go_doc, describe_python_package, etc.) for documentation access.

llm.name: MCP LLM Server
llm.description: An MCP server providing access to LLMs using LlamaIndexTS library for code generation and documentation.
llm.usageInstructions: 1. Install via Smithery using the provided command. 2. Alternatively, clone the repository, run 'npm install', and 'npm run build'. 3. Configure MCP settings as needed. 4. Use the example script to test the server.

package-version.name: Package Version MCP Server
package-version.description: MCP server for checking latest stable package versions from multiple package registries
package-version.usageInstructions: After installation, configure your MCP client to use the server by providing the path to the binary or URL. For stdio transport, simply run 'mcp-package-version'. For SSE transport, use 'mcp-package-version --transport sse --port 18080 --base-url "http://localhost:18080"'

sourcesyncai.name: SourceSync.ai MCP Server
sourcesyncai.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for the SourceSync.ai API, enabling AI models to interact with SourceSync.ai's knowledge management platform.
sourcesyncai.usageInstructions:
1. Run with: npx -y sourcesyncai-mcp
2. Set required environment variable SOURCESYNC_API_KEY
3. Optional: Configure SOURCESYNC_NAMESPACE_ID and SOURCESYNC_TENANT_ID
4. For Claude Desktop, edit claude_desktop_config.json to add the MCP server configuration

data-extractor.name: MCP Data Extractor Server
data-extractor.description: An MCP server that extracts embedded data from TypeScript/JavaScript source code into structured JSON configuration files.
data-extractor.usageInstructions: Add to MCP Client configuration with 'npx -y mcp-data-extractor' command. Use extract_data or extract_svg tools with appropriate source and target paths. Configure DISABLE_SOURCE_REPLACEMENT env variable to control source file replacement behavior.

smtp.name: SMTP Email MCP Server
smtp.description: An MCP server providing email sending capabilities for AI assistants
smtp.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/samihalawa/mcp-server-smtp.git && cd mcp-server-smtp && npm install && npm run build
smtp.usageInstructions:
1. Start the server: npm start
2. Configure in MCP config with command and args
3. Use tools like send-email, send-bulk-emails, add-smtp-config

aws-kb.name: AWS Knowledge Base Retrieval MCP Server
aws-kb.description: An MCP server implementation for retrieving information from the AWS Knowledge Base using the Bedrock Agent Runtime.
aws-kb.usageInstructions: Configure AWS credentials using either IAM Access Keys or AWS SSO. Set required environment variables (AWS_REGION) and optional variables (AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SESSION_TOKEN, AWS_KB_IDS) as needed. Use with Claude Desktop by adding configuration to claude_desktop_config.json.

ankiconnect.name: mcp-ankiconnect MCP Server
ankiconnect.description: MCP server that connects Claude conversations with AnkiConnect for spaced repetition flashcards
ankiconnect.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/samefarrar/mcp-ankiconnect.git && cd mcp-ankiconnect && uv sync
ankiconnect.usageInstructions: 1. Install AnkiConnect plugin in Anki. 2. Configure Claude Desktop by adding mcp-ankiconnect configuration to claude_desktop_config.json. 3. Restart Anki and Claude Desktop. For debugging, use MCP Inspector with 'uv run mcp dev mcp_ankiconnect/server.py'

monday.name: Monday.com MCP Server
monday.description: MCP Server for monday.com, enabling interaction with Monday.com boards, items, updates, and documents.
monday.usageInstructions: 1. Create and save a personal API Token in Monday.com. 2. Get the Workspace Name from the Monday.com workspace URL. Configure the server using the generated API key and workspace name.

graphql-tools.name: GraphQL MCP Tools
graphql-tools.description: An MCP server implementation providing GraphQL API interaction capabilities for AI assistants.

raindrop.io.name: Raindrop.io MCP Server
raindrop.io.description: An MCP server integration for Raindrop.io that allows managing bookmarks programmatically through LLM apps.
raindrop.io.usageInstructions: 1. Get an API token from the Raindrop.io Developer Portal. 2. Add the MCP server configuration to your LLM app with the RAINDROP_TOKEN environment variable. 3. Restart your LLM app (e.g., Claude, Cursor).

runpod-ts.name: RunPod MCP Server
runpod-ts.description: MCP server for interacting with RunPod REST API through MCP-compatible clients
runpod-ts.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/runpod/runpod-mcp-ts.git && cd runpod-mcp-ts && npm install && npm run build
runpod-ts.usageInstructions: 1. Set RUNPOD_API_KEY environment variable. 2. Start server with 'npm start'. 3. Configure Claude for Desktop by editing config file and adding server configuration. 4. Restart Claude for Desktop.

batchit.name: MCP BatchIt
batchit.description: An MCP server aggregator that batches multiple tool calls into a single request, reducing overhead and token usage for AI agents.
batchit.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/ryanjoachim/mcp-batchit.git && cd mcp-batchit && npm install && npm run build && npm start
batchit.usageInstructions: After installation, send JSON-RPC requests with 'tools/call' method and 'name=batch_execute' to the server. Configure batch operations by specifying targetServer, operations, and options in the request body.

iceberg.name: IcebergMCP
iceberg.description: IcebergMCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that allows interaction with Apache Iceberg Lakehouse using natural language through MCP clients like Claude or Cursor.
iceberg.usageInstructions:
1. Ensure AWS profile is configured with access to Apache Iceberg catalog.
2. Install `uv` via `brew install uv`.
3. Configure the server in your MCP client (e.g., Claude or Cursor) with the provided JSON configuration.
4. Set `ICEBERG_MCP_PROFILE` to your AWS profile name.
5. Optionally set `ICEBERG_MCP_REGION` to specify the AWS region.
6. Use natural language queries to interact with your Iceberg tables.

alchemy.name: MCP Alchemy
alchemy.description: MCP server connecting Claude Desktop to various databases including PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQLite, and more through SQLAlchemy.
alchemy.installCommand: curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh && uv pip install mcp-alchemy
alchemy.usageInstructions: 1. Install uv if not already installed. 2. Configure claude_desktop_config.json with appropriate database connection details and driver. 3. Set DB_URL environment variable with your database connection string. 4. Optionally configure CLAUDE_LOCAL_FILES_PATH for large result sets.

notmuch-sendmail.name: MCP Notmuch Sendmail
notmuch-sendmail.description: An MCP server that connects Claude Desktop to a Notmuch email database, enabling email search, composition, and management with markdown support and LaTeX-style formatting.
notmuch-sendmail.usageInstructions:
1. Install uv if not already installed.
2. Add the server to your `claude_desktop_config.json` under `mcpServers` with the required environment variables.
3. Ensure the `NOTMUCH_DATABASE_PATH` points to your Notmuch database.
4. Set `NOTMUCH_REPLY_SEPARATORS` with pipe-separated reply markers.
5. Set `SENDMAIL_FROM_EMAIL` to your email address.
6. (Optional) Configure `SENDMAIL_EMAIL_SIGNATURE_HTML`, `NOTMUCH_SYNC_SCRIPT`, `LOG_FILE_PATH`, and `DRAFT_DIR` as needed.
7. Use the provided API tools to search, view, compose, and send emails.

asana.name: MCP Server for Asana
asana.description: An MCP server implementation for Asana, allowing interaction with Asana API from MCP clients like Anthropic's Claude Desktop Application.
asana.usageInstructions: 1. Install the package globally using 'npm install -g @roychri/mcp-server-asana'. 2. Set the ASANA_ACCESS_TOKEN environment variable with your Asana access token. 3. Optionally set READ_ONLY_MODE to 'true' to disable write operations. 4. Use an MCP client like Claude Desktop to interact with Asana by mentioning 'asana' in your queries.

deepseek-thinker.name: Deepseek Thinker MCP Server
deepseek-thinker.description: An MCP server that provides access to Deepseek's reasoning process via the Model Context Protocol, supporting both OpenAI API and Ollama local modes.
deepseek-thinker.usageInstructions: To use the server, configure it in your AI client (e.g., Claude Desktop) by specifying the command as 'npx -y deepseek-thinker-mcp' and setting the required environment variables. For OpenAI API mode, set API_KEY and BASE_URL. For Ollama mode, set USE_OLLAMA=true. Alternatively, run the server locally by cloning the repository, running 'npm install', 'npm run build', and executing 'node build/index.js'.

rowik.name: rowik-mcp
rowik.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for integrating with Wikipedia, enabling knowledge-based model interactions.
rowik.usageInstructions: After installation, set the required environment variables (WIKIPEDIA_API_KEY and MCP_SERVER_PORT). Start the server using 'rowik-mcp start'. Access the server via localhost at the specified port. For advanced configuration, optional environment variables can be set for logging, timeouts, and result limits.

robinhood.name: Robinhood MCP Server
robinhood.description: A comprehensive interface to the Robinhood Crypto API providing REST API and WebSocket interfaces for account management, market data, and trading operations.
robinhood.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/rohitsingh-iitd/robinhood-mcp-server && cd robinhood-mcp-server && python -m venv venv && source venv/bin/activate && pip install -r requirements.txt
robinhood.usageInstructions:
1. Create a .env file with required environment variables.
2. Run the server using 'python -m src.main'.
3. REST API available at http://localhost:8000.
4. WebSocket server available at ws://localhost:8001.

safari-screenshot.name: Safari Screenshot MCP Server
safari-screenshot.description: A Node.js MCP Server for capturing screenshots using Safari on macOS with configurable sizes and zoom levels.
safari-screenshot.usageInstructions: To use this MCP server, ensure you have macOS, Safari, and Node.js >=14.0.0. Grant Terminal Accessibility permissions in System Preferences. Install using 'npm install @rogerheykoop/mcp-safari-screenshot'. For Cursor integration, add the MCP server with command 'npx -y @rogerheykoop/mcp-safari-screenshot'.

screeny.name: Screeny MCP Server
screeny.description: A privacy-first macOS-only MCP server that enables AI agents to capture screenshots of pre-approved application windows for secure visual context in development and debugging tasks.
screeny.usageInstructions:
1. Install using pipx: pipx install mcp-server-screeny
2. Grant Screen Capture permission to your terminal and MCP host application in System Settings > Privacy & Security > Screen & System Audio Recording
3. Approve windows with: mcp-server-screeny --setup
4. Configure your MCP client (Claude Desktop/Cursor) with the provided JSON configuration
5. Use listWindows and takeScreenshot tools to capture approved windows
6. Restart your MCP host after configuration changes

ollama-db.name: Ollama MCP Database Assistant
ollama-db.description: An interactive chat interface combining Ollama's LLM capabilities with PostgreSQL database access through MCP, allowing natural language queries about database content.
ollama-db.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/robdodson/ollama-mcp-db.git && cd ollama-mcp-db && npm install
ollama-db.usageInstructions:
1. Create a .env file with DATABASE_URL=postgresql://user:password@localhost:5432/dbname
2. Pull Ollama model: ollama pull qwen2.5-coder:7b-instruct
3. Start the application: npm start
4. Ask natural language questions about your database

cve-search.name: CVE-Search MCP Server
cve-search.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for querying the CVE-Search API to access CVE data, including vendor and product information, specific CVE details, and recent CVE updates.
cve-search.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/roadwy/cve-search_mcp.git && cd cve-search_mcp && uv sync
cve-search.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository using `git clone https://github.com/roadwy/cve-search_mcp.git`.
2. Navigate to the directory and install dependencies with `uv sync`.
3. Add the server configuration to your MCP client (e.g., VSCode with Cline or Roo Code) by specifying the command and directory path in the configuration file.

couchdb.name: CouchDB MCP Server
couchdb.description: A Model Context Protocol server for interacting with CouchDB, enabling AI assistants to manage databases and documents.
couchdb.usageInstructions:
1. Install the server using the provided install command.
2. Set the COUCHDB_URL environment variable to point to your CouchDB instance.
3. Optionally set COUCHDB_VERSION if needed.
4. Configure the server in claude_desktop_config.json with the command path and environment variables.
5. Use the server to manage CouchDB databases and documents through the MCP interface.

image-gen.name: Image Generator MCP Server
image-gen.description: An MCP server that generates images using Replicate's Stable Diffusion model and saves them locally.
image-gen.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/rmcendarfer2017/MCP-image-gen.git && cd MCP-image-gen && python -m venv .venv && source .venv/bin/activate && pip install -r requirements.txt
image-gen.usageInstructions: 1. Create a .env file with REPLICATE_API_TOKEN. 2. Activate the virtual environment. 3. Use tools like 'generate-image', 'save-image', and 'list-saved-images'. For debugging, use 'npx @modelcontextprotocol/inspector uv --directory path/to/repo run image-generator'.

riza.name: Riza MCP Server
riza.description: Riza MCP server provides isolated code execution for LLM-generated code through various tools.
riza.usageInstructions: 1. Get a Riza API key from https://dashboard.riza.io. 2. Configure with Claude Desktop using the provided JSON config or adapt for your MCP client. 3. Run using: npx @riza-io/riza-mcp

gumroad.name: Gumroad MCP Server
gumroad.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for Gumroad, enabling MCP-compatible AI clients to interact with the Gumroad API for managing products, sales, and offer codes.
gumroad.usageInstructions: Once installed, configure the MCP server with your Gumroad access token. Use it in an MCP-compatible client like Claude Desktop to query sales data, manage products, and create or delete offer codes. For manual configuration, update the MCP config with the Gumroad server command and environment variables.

mock-data.name: Mock Data MCP
mock-data.description: MCP server for generating mock data
mock-data.usageInstructions: To use this MCP server, install globally using npm then run the appropriate commands as documented in the repository

python.name: Talk with Your Database Using MCP
python.description: An MCP server that allows interaction with PostgreSQL, MySQL, MariaDB, or SQLite databases using Claude Desktop, built on top of mcp-alchemy.
python.usageInstructions:
1. Copy `.env.example` to `.env` and update environment variables as needed.
2. Run `docker-compose up -d` to start the PostgreSQL database with dummy data.
3. Install `uv` if not already installed using the provided command.
4. Configure the MCP server with the provided JSON configuration, ensuring the `DB_URL` is correct.
5. Launch Claude Desktop to interact with your database via the MCP server.

kite.name: Kite MCP Server
kite.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides AI assistants with secure access to the Kite Connect trading API for portfolio management, order execution, and market data retrieval.
kite.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/zerodha/kite-mcp-server && cd kite-mcp-server && go build -o kite-mcp-server
kite.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and build the server using `go build -o kite-mcp-server`.
2. Create a `.env` file with your Kite Connect API credentials.
3. Run the server using `./kite-mcp-server` or `go run main.go`.
4. For client integration, configure your MCP client to connect to the server's HTTP or SSE endpoint (e.g., `http://localhost:8080/mcp`).
5. For hosted mode, use `https://mcp.kite.trade/mcp` directly in your client configuration.

quickvoice.name: QuickVoice MCP
quickvoice.description: An MCP server to communicate with QuickVoice AI Voice agents, enabling integration with Claude Desktop for making AI-powered phone calls.
quickvoice.usageInstructions:
1. Obtain your QuickVoice API credentials (Agent ID and API Key) from quickvoice.app.
2. Set the required environment variables (QUICKVOICE_AGENT_ID and QUICKVOICE_API_KEY).
3. Run the Docker container using the provided install command.
4. Configure Claude Desktop to use the QuickVoice MCP server by adding the MCP config to claude_desktop_config.json.
5. Use Claude Desktop to initiate AI phone calls with natural language prompts.

api-gateway.name: MCP API Gateway
api-gateway.description: A universal MCP server to integrate any API with Claude Desktop using Docker configurations.
api-gateway.usageInstructions: Add configuration to claude_desktop_config.json with Docker run command and required environment variables. Example: { "mcpServers": { "my-api": { "command": "docker", "args": [ "run", "--rm", "-i", "-e", "API_1_NAME=my-api", "-e", "API_1_SWAGGER_URL=https://api.example.com/swagger.json", "rflpazini/mcp-api-gateway:latest" ] } } }

rember.name: Rember MCP Server
rember.description: An MCP server that allows Claude to create flashcards for spaced repetition reviews using Rember's API.
rember.usageInstructions:
1. Replace YOUR_REMBER_API_KEY with your actual Rember API key from your settings page.
2. Run the install command to start the server.
3. Configure Claude Desktop by adding the MCP server configuration to claude_desktop_config.json as shown in the README.
4. Use commands like 'help me remember this' or 'create flashcards' in Claude to trigger the server.

ancestry.name: Ancestry MCP Server
ancestry.description: Python server implementing Model Context Protocol (MCP) for interacting with .ged files, allowing operations like reading, renaming, and searching within GEDCOM files.
ancestry.usageInstructions: 1. Install using: pip install mcp-server-ancestry. 2. Configure Claude Desktop by adding to claude_desktop_config.json: { "mcpServers": { "ancestry": { "command": "mcp-server-ancestry", "args": ["--gedcom-path", "path/to/your/gedcom/files"] } } }

send-email.name: Resend Email MCP Server
send-email.description: An MCP server that sends emails using Resend's API, allowing integration with Cursor and Claude Desktop.
send-email.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/resend/mcp-send-email.git && cd mcp-send-email && npm install && npm run build
send-email.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and build the project locally. 2. Set up a Resend account and create an API key. 3. Configure the MCP server in Cursor or Claude Desktop by providing the absolute path to the built index.js and your Resend API key. For Cursor, add the config to Cursor Settings > MCP. For Claude Desktop, add the config to the Developer tab in settings.

langchain.name: langchain-mcp
langchain.description: Model Context Protocol (MCP) tool calling support in LangChain, enabling integration with MCP-compatible services and tools.
langchain.usageInstructions: 1. Install the package using pip install langchain-mcp. 2. Set the GROQ_API_KEY environment variable with your Groq API key. 3. Run the demo script (e.g., tests/demo.py) to test MCP functionality. 4. Use the MCPToolkit class to integrate with LangChain and call MCP tools.

neo4j.name: Neo4j MCP Server
neo4j.description: Neo4j implementation of the Model Context Protocol (MCP) server with environment variable configuration and improved error handling.
neo4j.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/rebots-online/mcp-neo4j.git && cd mcp-neo4j && npm install && npm run build
neo4j.usageInstructions: After installation, configure the Neo4j connection by setting NEO4J_URL, NEO4J_USER, and NEO4J_PASSWORD environment variables. Then start the server with 'npm start'.

coin.name: Cryptocurrency Daemon MCP Server
coin.description: An MCP server for interacting with cryptocurrency daemon RPC interfaces, enabling AI assistants to manage cryptocurrency nodes.
coin.usageInstructions: 1. Install via npm. 2. Configure Claude Desktop by modifying claude_desktop_config.json. 3. Create a configuration file for cryptocurrency daemons. 4. Configure cryptocurrency daemon's RPC settings. 5. Restart Claude Desktop to use the MCP server.

git-repo-browser.name: MCP Git Repo Browser
git-repo-browser.description: A Node.js implementation of a Git repository browser using the Model Context Protocol (MCP) to provide directory structure and file content retrieval.
git-repo-browser.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/razorback16/mcp-git-repo-browser && cd mcp-git-repo-browser && npm install
git-repo-browser.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and install dependencies with 'npm install'.
2. Start the server using 'node src/index.js'.
3. Configure your MCP client to use the server by adding the configuration to your MCP settings file as shown in the README.
4. Use the provided tools 'git_directory_structure' and 'git_read_important_files' to interact with Git repositories.

razorpay.name: Razorpay MCP Server
razorpay.description: An MCP server providing seamless integration with Razorpay APIs for advanced payment processing
razorpay.usageInstructions:
1. Set RAZORPAY_KEY_ID and RAZORPAY_KEY_SECRET environment variables
2. Run the Docker container
3. Configure any additional parameters as needed

data-exploration.name: MCP Server for Data Exploration
data-exploration.description: A versatile tool for interactive data exploration, acting as a personal data scientist assistant to analyze datasets and generate actionable insights.
data-exploration.usageInstructions:
1. Download and install Claude Desktop from https://claude.ai/download.
2. Run the command 'python setup.py' to install and set up the server.
3. Wait for the prompt template and tools to load in Claude Desktop.
4. Select the 'explore-data' prompt template from MCP.
5. Provide the required inputs: 'csv_path' (local path to CSV file) and 'topic' (e.g., 'Weather patterns in New York').
6. Use the 'load-csv' and 'run-script' tools for data loading and analysis.

email-checker.name: Email Checker MCP Server
email-checker.description: Validates email addresses using a simple JSON response format without requiring an API key.
email-checker.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/ravinahp/email-checker-mcp.git && cd email-checker-mcp && uv sync
email-checker.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies using 'uv sync'. 2. Configure the MCP server in your Claude desktop configuration file by adding the required JSON configuration. 3. Use the 'validate_email' tool to check if an email address exists.

flights.name: Find Flights MCP Server
flights.description: MCP server for searching and retrieving flight information using Duffel API, supporting one-way, round-trip, and multi-city flights with flexible search parameters.
flights.usageInstructions:
1. Install via Smithery using the provided command.
2. Set the DUFFEL_API_KEY_LIVE environment variable with your live Duffel API key.
3. Modify the Claude desktop configuration file to include the MCP server configuration with the correct path and API key.
4. Use the tools to search for flights, get offer details, or search for multi-city flights using natural language queries.

deriv-api.name: Deriv API Server
deriv-api.description: An MCP server and OpenAI function calling service for interacting with the Deriv API, providing features like active symbols list and account balance retrieval.
deriv-api.usageInstructions: 1. Create a .env file with DERIV_API_TOKEN=your_api_key_here. 2. Configure Claude Desktop by adding the server configuration to claude_desktop_config.json. 3. Restart Claude Desktop.

ragie.name: Ragie Model Context Protocol Server
ragie.description: An MCP server that provides access to Ragie's knowledge base retrieval capabilities via a 'retrieve' tool.
ragie.usageInstructions: 1. Set your Ragie API key as the RAGIE_API_KEY environment variable. 2. Run the server using 'npx @ragieai/mcp-server' or configure it in Cursor or Claude desktop as described in the README. 3. Use the 'retrieve' tool with parameters like 'query', 'topK', 'rerank', and 'recencyBias' to search the knowledge base.

adobe-commerce-dev.name: Adobe Commerce Dev MCP Server
adobe-commerce-dev.description: An MCP server that interacts with Adobe Commerce GraphQL APIs, supporting various tools for schema introspection and GraphQL operations.
adobe-commerce-dev.usageInstructions: Configure your MCP client to use the NPM package by setting the command to 'npx' with args: ['-y', '@rafaelcg/adobe-commerce-dev-mcp@latest']. For local development: 1. Clone the repository. 2. Run 'npm install'. 3. Modify source files. 4. Run 'npm run build' to compile. 5. Configure MCP client to run 'node <project_path>/dist/index.js'.

stock-analysis.name: Alpha Vantage Stock MCP Server
stock-analysis.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides stock market data from Alpha Vantage API, allowing access to real-time and historical stock data for integration with Claude and other MCP clients.
stock-analysis.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/ranveer0323/stock-analysis-mcp && cd stock-analysis-mcp && npm install
stock-analysis.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and install dependencies with 'npm install'.
2. Create a .env file and add your Alpha Vantage API key.
3. Build the TypeScript code with 'npm run build'.
4. Run the server with 'npm start' or use 'npm run dev' for development with auto-reloading.
5. To use with Claude for Desktop, add the server configuration to 'claude_desktop_config.json' with the absolute path to the built index.js file and your API key.
6. Use the available tools like 'get-stock-data', 'get-daily-stock-data', and 'get-stock-alerts' with required and optional parameters.

youtube-watchlater.name: YouTube Watch Later MCP Server
youtube-watchlater.description: An MCP server that retrieves YouTube video URLs from a custom playlist within a specified timeframe using OAuth2 authentication.
youtube-watchlater.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/rados10/youtube-watchlater-mcp.git && cd youtube-watchlater-mcp && npm install && npm run build
youtube-watchlater.usageInstructions: 1. Create a Google Cloud project and enable the YouTube Data API v3. 2. Generate OAuth 2.0 credentials and obtain a refresh token using the provided script. 3. Configure the server in your MCP settings file with the credentials. 4. Use the `get_watch_later_urls` tool with an optional `daysBack` parameter to retrieve video URLs.

linkedinads.name: Radiate B2B LinkedIn Ads MCP Server
linkedinads.description: An MCP server implementation providing integration with LinkedIn Ads for campaign analysis and optimization recommendations.
linkedinads.installCommand: npm install -g npm@latest && npx -y mcp-remote https://mcp.radiateb2b.com/sse
requiredEnvVars: private access token for LinkedIn Ads account
linkedinads.usageInstructions: 1. Install Node.js and npm. 2. Obtain a Radiate B2B private access token. 3. Configure Claude Desktop by adding the MCP server configuration with your access token. 4. Restart Claude Desktop.

raccoonai.name: Raccoon AI MCP Server
raccoonai.description: Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables leveraging the LAM API for web browsing, data extraction, and complex web tasks automation.
raccoonai.usageInstructions:
1. Install using the provided install command
2. Set RACCOON_SECRET_KEY and RACCOON_PASSCODE environment variables with your credentials from https://platform.flyingraccoon.tech
3. Use with Claude Desktop or other MCP-compatible clients
4. Try example prompts like: 'Extract product information from Amazon.com for the top-rated gaming keyboards'

blastengine-mailer.name: Blastengine Mailer MCP Server
blastengine-mailer.description: An MCP server that enables LLM to send emails through Blastengine API
blastengine-mailer.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/r3-yamauchi/mcp-server-blastengine-mailer.git && cd mcp-server-blastengine-mailer && npm install
blastengine-mailer.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies using 'npm install'. 2. Configure Claude Desktop by adding server settings to claude_desktop_config.json. 3. Set BLASTENGINE_USER_ID and BLASTENGINE_API_KEY environment variables. 4. Run the server using 'node /path/to/server.js'

cdata-connect-cloud.name: CData Connect Cloud MCP Server
cdata-connect-cloud.description: MCP server implementation for CData Connect Cloud integration with Claude Desktop
cdata-connect-cloud.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/r3-yamauchi/cdata-connect-cloud-mcp-server && cd cdata-connect-cloud-mcp-server && npm i
cdata-connect-cloud.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and run 'npm i'. 2. Configure Claude Desktop by editing claude_desktop_config.json to include the server configuration. 3. Restart Claude Desktop application.

kintone.name: kintone MCP Server
kintone.description: This is a sample Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for integration with kintone, enabling access and manipulation of kintone data and application settings via MCP hosts like Claude Desktop.
kintone.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/r3-yamauchi/kintone-mcp-server && cd kintone-mcp-server && npm install
kintone.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies with 'npm install'. 2. Configure the Claude Desktop application by editing the 'claude_desktop_config.json' file and adding the server configuration with the required environment variables. 3. Restart the Claude Desktop application. 4. Use the MCP server to interact with kintone by querying or modifying records, managing apps, and handling space operations.

xcode.name: Xcode MCP Server
xcode.description: An MCP server providing comprehensive Xcode integration for AI assistants, enabling project management, file operations, build & testing, CocoaPods integration, Swift Package Manager support, iOS simulator tools, and Xcode utilities.
xcode.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/r-huijts/xcode-mcp-server.git && cd xcode-mcp-server && npm install && npm run build
xcode.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and navigate to the directory.
2. Run `npm install` to install dependencies.
3. Run `npm run build` to compile TypeScript code.
4. Create a `.env` file with `PROJECTS_BASE_DIR` set to your projects directory.
5. Start the server with `npm start` or run in development mode with `npm run dev`.
6. Connect AI assistants by configuring them to use the server URL (typically http://localhost:3000).

airbyte-list-sources.name: Airbyte Status Checker MCP Server
airbyte-list-sources.description: An MCP server that checks the status of Airbyte connections, integrating with Claude Desktop.
airbyte-list-sources.installCommand: uv venv && source .venv/bin/activate && pip install -r requirements.txt
airbyte-list-sources.usageInstructions: 1. Create a .env file with required Airbyte credentials. 2. Run 'uv run airbyte_status_checker.py'. 3. Configure Claude Desktop by setting absolute paths in claude_desktop_settings.json and adding the server.

ns.name: NS Travel Information MCP Server
ns.description: MCP server connecting Claude to real-time NS travel information, providing comprehensive train information and journey planning capabilities.
ns.usageInstructions:
1. Install using npx: 'npx -y ns-mcp-server'
2. Configure Claude Desktop by adding the server configuration to ~/Library/Application Support/Claude/claude_desktop_config.json
3. Obtain NS API key from https://apiportal.ns.nl/ and set as NS_API_KEY environment variable
4. Restart Claude Desktop after configuration changes

pty.name: pty-mcp
pty.description: An MCP tool server providing a stateful terminal.
pty.installCommand: python -m pip install --user pipx && pipx ensurepath && pipx install git+https://github.com/qodo-ai/pty-mcp.git
pty.usageInstructions: After installation, the server will be available as `pty-mcp` in your path. Ensure you have Python and pip installed before running the installation command.

communicator-telegram.name: MCP Communicator (Telegram)
communicator-telegram.description: An MCP server enabling communication with users through Telegram, providing tools to interact via a Telegram bot.
communicator-telegram.usageInstructions: 1. Create a Telegram bot using @BotFather. 2. Get your chat ID using the provided utility. 3. Configure environment variables TELEGRAM_TOKEN and CHAT_ID. 4. Add the server to your MCP settings file with the correct path to the installation.

deepwebresearch.name: MCP Deep Web Research Server
deepwebresearch.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for advanced web research with features like intelligent search queuing, enhanced content extraction, and deep research capabilities.
deepwebresearch.usageInstructions: After installation, add the server to your Claude Desktop config file. Use the `deep_research`, `parallel_search`, and `visit_page` tools for research. For first-time setup, run `npx playwright install chromium` to install required browser dependencies.

any-chat-completions.name: Any Chat Completions MCP Server
any-chat-completions.description: MCP server integrating OpenAI compatible chat completion APIs with Claude Desktop
any-chat-completions.usageInstructions: Configure in Claude Desktop by adding to ~/Library/Application Support/Claude/claude_desktop_config.json or %APPDATA%/Claude/claude_desktop_config.json. Can also be used with LibreChat.

security-audit.name: MCP Security Audit Tool
security-audit.description: A powerful MCP (Model Context Protocol) Server that audits npm package dependencies for security vulnerabilities with real-time checks and detailed reports.
security-audit.usageInstructions: 1. Install using the provided command or clone the repository and run `npm install && npm run build`. 2. Configure the MCP server in Cline/Cursor with the specified JSON configuration. 3. Use the tool to audit npm packages for vulnerabilities. Optional parameters like `--fix` and `--severity` can be used to customize behavior.

logfire.name: Logfire MCP Server
logfire.description: An MCP server that enables LLMs to retrieve and analyze OpenTelemetry traces and metrics from Logfire, providing tools for querying and exception analysis.
logfire.usageInstructions: 1. Install `uv` if not already installed. 2. Obtain a Logfire read token from the Logfire project settings. 3. Run the server using `uvx logfire-mcp@latest --read-token=YOUR_READ_TOKEN`. 4. Configure your MCP client (e.g., Cursor, Claude Desktop, Cline, or VS Code) to use the server. 5. Use the available tools like `find_exceptions_in_file` and `arbitrary_query` to analyze traces and metrics.

mattermost.name: Mattermost MCP Server
mattermost.description: MCP Server for interacting with Mattermost API, enabling tools like topic monitoring and message management.
mattermost.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/pvev/mattermost-mcp.git && cd mattermost-mcp && npm install && npm run build
mattermost.usageInstructions: 1. Create config.local.json with Mattermost credentials. 2. Run 'npm start'. 3. Use MCP tools or HTTP endpoints for monitoring and message management.

a11y.name: A11y MCP Server
a11y.description: An MCP server for performing accessibility audits on webpages using axe-core.
a11y.usageInstructions: To use this MCP server with Cline, add it to your MCP settings configuration file with the command 'npx a11y-mcp'. Available tools include 'audit_webpage' and 'get_summary'.

clarity.name: Clarity Mcp Server
clarity.description: An MCP server providing structured reasoning and thinking tools for AI assistants
clarity.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/pronitdas/clarity-mcp.git && cd clarity-mcp && pnpm install && pnpm run build

lighthouse.name: Lighthouse MCP Server
lighthouse.description: An MCP server that wraps Google's Lighthouse tool to measure performance metrics for web pages.
lighthouse.usageInstructions:
1. Install the package globally using `npm install -g lighthouse-mcp`.
2. Add the MCP server configuration to your MCP settings file as shown in the README.
3. Use the `run_audit` or `get_performance_score` tools with the required parameters to analyze web pages.
4. Example: Run `lighthouse-mcp` directly or integrate it with Claude for automated analysis.

pubnub.name: PubNub Model Context Protocol (MCP) Server
pubnub.description: A CLI-based Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that exposes PubNub SDK and API documentation, tools, and functionality to LLM-powered tools for improved AI agent interaction with PubNub services.
pubnub.usageInstructions: 1. Install Node.js (>= 18) and npm. 2. Use `npx -y @pubnub/mcp` to run the server. 3.
