Configure environment variables PUBNUB_PUBLISH_KEY and PUBNUB_SUBSCRIBE_KEY for API access. 4. Optionally, set HTTP_PORT for SSE mode. 5. Configure Cursor IDE with the MCP server command and environment variables in `~/.cursor/mcp.json` or `.cursor/mcp.json` in your project.

port.name: Port MCP Server
port.description: An MCP server enabling advanced automations and natural language interactions for developers and AI applications with Port IO.
port.installCommand: uvx mcp-server-port --client-id your_port_client_id --client-secret your_port_client_secret --region EU --log-level DEBUG
port.usageInstructions:
1. Create a Port Account at https://app.port.io/
2. Obtain Port Credentials from Settings > Credentials
3. Set required environment variables: PORT_CLIENT_ID, PORT_CLIENT_SECRET, PORT_REGION
4. Run using: uvx mcp-server-port --client-id your_port_client_id --client-secret your_port_client_secret --region EU --log-level DEBUG
5. For Docker: docker run -i --rm -e PORT_CLIENT_ID -e PORT_CLIENT_SECRET -e PORT_REGION -e PORT_LOG_LEVEL ghcr.io/port-labs/port-mcp-server:latest

substack-fetcher.name: Substack Reader
substack-fetcher.description: A tool to fetch and read articles from Trade Companion by Adam Mancini on Substack, designed to work with Claude AI assistant.
substack-fetcher.installCommand: curl -sSf https://install.ultraviolet.dev | sh && uv venv && source .venv/bin/activate && uv pip install -e .
substack-fetcher.usageInstructions: 1. Install uv package manager and create virtual environment. 2. Configure Substack authentication by creating substack_cookies.json with your Substack cookies. 3. Configure Claude to use this MCP server by adding the server configuration to Claude's config file.

chucknorris.name: ChuckNorris MCP Server
chucknorris.description: MCP gateway for specialized LLM enhancement prompts with dynamic schema adaptation.
chucknorris.usageInstructions: To use this server, add the following configuration to your mcp_config.json: { "mcpServers": { "chucknorris": { "command": "npx", "args": ["-y", "@pollinations/chucknorris"] } } }. The server uses a dynamic schema approach to bypass jailbreak detection and is designed for security research and evaluation purposes.

pollinations.name: Pollinations AI MCP Server
pollinations.description: An open-source Model Context Protocol (MCP) server enabling AI assistants to generate images, text, and audio directly from text prompts.
pollinations.usageInstructions:
1. Run the server using 'npx @pollinations/model-context-protocol'.
2. AI assistants can connect to the server to generate images, text, and audio.
3. Use the provided API endpoints for direct integration.
4. For advanced usage, refer to the API documentation at https://github.com/pollinations/pollinations.

webcrawl.name: mcp-server-webcrawl
webcrawl.description: Advanced search and retrieval for web crawler data, providing full-text search, filtering, and integration with multiple crawlers like WARC, wget, InterroBot, Katana, and SiteOne.
webcrawl.usageInstructions:
1. Install using pip: pip install mcp-server-webcrawl
2. Configure your web crawler (WARC, wget, etc.) and import the data.
3. Use the boolean search syntax to query the indexed data.
4. Optionally, use provided prompts like 'SEO Audit' or '404 Audit' for automated analysis.
5. Access the server via the command line or integrate with Claude Desktop for AI-powered search.

cli.name: PlanetScale CLI
cli.description: The `pscale` command line tool provides access to PlanetScale databases, including branching, deploy requests, and an MCP server for AI tools.
cli.usageInstructions: After installation, configure your PlanetScale service token credentials by setting the PLANETSCALE_SERVICE_TOKEN_ID and PLANETSCALE_SERVICE_TOKEN environment variables. Use the `pscale mcp install` command to integrate the MCP server with AI tools like Claude Desktop or Cursor. For GitHub Actions, use the setup-pscale-action to install and run commands.

project-hub.name: Project Hub MCP Server
project-hub.description: An MCP server providing comprehensive project management, local Git functionality, and GitHub integration capabilities.
project-hub.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/peterparker57/project-hub-mcp-server && cd project-hub-mcp-server && npm install
project-hub.usageInstructions: After installation, configure GITHUB_TOKEN environment variable. Start the server and use the provided CLI commands for project management, local Git operations, and GitHub integration.

mindbridge.name: MindBridge MCP Server
mindbridge.description: An AI command hub that unifies and orchestrates multiple LLM workflows through a single interface.
mindbridge.usageInstructions: 1. Install using 'npm install -g @pinkpixel/mindbridge'. 2. Configure environment variables in .env file. 3. Start server using 'mindbridge' command. 4. Use available tools like getSecondOpinion, listProviders, and listReasoningModels.

cribl.name: Cribl MCP Server
cribl.description: An MCP server enabling AI interactions with Cribl API for data operations and management
cribl.usageInstructions:
1. Set required environment variables (CRIBL_BASE_URL, CRIBL_AUTH_TYPE, CRIBL_CLIENT_ID, CRIBL_CLIENT_SECRET)
2. Run using: npx @pebbletek/cribl-mcp
3. For local development: git clone https://github.com/pebbletek/cribl-mcp.git && cd cribl-mcp && npm install
4. Configure MCP client to connect to the server

mermaid.name: Mermaid MCP Server
mermaid.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that converts Mermaid diagrams to PNG images or SVG files using Puppeteer for high-quality headless browser rendering.
mermaid.usageInstructions:
1. Install the server using the command: npx -y @peng-shawn/mermaid-mcp-server.
2. Set the environment variable CONTENT_IMAGE_SUPPORTED to control whether images are returned directly or saved to disk.
3. Use the generate tool with Mermaid diagram code and optional parameters like theme, background color, output format, name, and folder.
4. For Docker or Smithery environments, ensure Puppeteer dependencies are configured correctly.

mcpollinations.name: MCPollinations Multimodal MCP Server
mcpollinations.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables AI assistants to generate images, text, and audio through the Pollinations APIs
mcpollinations.usageInstructions:
1. Install via npx: 'npx -y @smithery/cli install @pinkpixel-dev/mcpollinations --client claude'
2. Run the server: 'npx @pinkpixel/mcpollinations'
3. Generate an MCP config file: 'npx @pinkpixel/mcpollinations generate-config'
4. Copy the generated 'mcp.json' file to your application's MCP settings
5. Use commands like 'Generate an image of a sunset over the ocean using MCPollinations'

taskflow.name: TaskFlow MCP
taskflow.description: A task management Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for planning and executing tasks with AI assistants, featuring task planning, subtasks, progress tracking, user approval steps, and export options.
taskflow.usageInstructions:
1. Install the package globally with `npm install -g @pinkpixel/taskflow-mcp`.
2. Start the server with `taskflow-mcp`.
3. Configure the task storage path using `TASK_MANAGER_FILE_PATH`.
4. Use the provided MCP tools to plan tasks, manage subtasks, track progress, and export results.
5. Configure your MCP client to use the server with an `mcp_config.json` file as described in the README.

blockchain-query.name: MCP Blockchain Query Server
blockchain-query.description: Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for querying Bitcoin blockchain data via Blockchain.com APIs.
blockchain-query.installCommand: python -m venv venv && source venv/bin/activate && pip install -r requirements.txt
blockchain-query.usageInstructions: Activate the virtual environment and run the server with 'python main.py' for stdio mode or 'python main.py --transport sse --port 8000' for SSE mode. Use the provided tools to query blockchain data.

redshift-js.name: Redshift MCP Server
redshift-js.description: An MCP server for Amazon Redshift implemented in TypeScript, providing rich contextual information about Redshift data warehouses to MCP-compatible clients.
redshift-js.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/paschmaria/redshift-js-mcp-server.git && cd redshift-js-mcp-server && npm install && npm run build
redshift-js.usageInstructions:
1. Configure DATABASE_URL with your Redshift connection details.
2. Run the server using 'npm start' or 'node dist/index.js'.
3. Configure your MCP client (e.g., Cursor IDE) to use the server.

servers.name: MCP-Servers
servers.package: Not available as a standalone package
servers.description: A collection of Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers for various use cases, integrated with CAMEL-AI. Includes servers for file system operations, SQL database interactions, and markdown document handling.
servers.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/parthshr370/MCP-Servers && cd MCP-Servers && pip install -r requirements.txt
servers.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository using the provided install command. 2. Navigate into the directory and install dependencies using pip. 3. Explore subdirectories for individual server implementations (e.g., filesystem_server, sql_server). 4. Follow each server's specific setup instructions for execution.

voyp.name: Voyp Model Context Protocol server
voyp.description: Enables AI assistants like Claude to integrate with VOYP's calling capabilities, allowing AI models to make phone calls and monitor their progress.
voyp.usageInstructions: 1. Install via Smithery using 'npx -y @smithery/cli install @paulotaylor/voyp-mcp --client claude'. 2. Configure Claude Desktop by editing claude_desktop_config.json to include Voyp server configuration with your VOYP_API_KEY. 3. Restart Claude Desktop to see the Voyp MCP server available.

cursor-apple-notes.name: Cursor MCP Apple Notes Plugin
cursor-apple-notes.description: A Cursor MCP plugin for interacting with Apple Notes directly from the editor, allowing search, creation, and reading of notes.
cursor-apple-notes.installCommand: Open Cursor, press Cmd/Ctrl + Shift + P, type 'MCP: Install Plugin', and enter 'packetnomad/cursor-mcp-apple-notes'
cursor-apple-notes.usageInstructions: After installation, use commands in Cursor: 'MCP: notes.search <query>' to search notes, 'MCP: notes.create' to create a new note, and 'MCP: notes.read <id>' to read a note. Requires macOS and Cursor with MCP support.

domaintools.name: mcp-domaintools
domaintools.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server providing comprehensive network and domain analysis capabilities including DNS lookups, WHOIS queries, TLS certificate analysis, and HTTP endpoint monitoring.
domaintools.usageInstructions: After installation, run `mcp-domaintools` in stdio mode for integration with editors or tools. For web-based integrations, run `mcp-domaintools --sse --sse-port=3000` to enable Server-Sent Events (SSE) mode. Configure additional options using command-line flags like `--remote-server-address`, `--custom-whois-server`, and `--timeout` as needed.

get-terminal-logs.name: MCP Get Terminal Logs
get-terminal-logs.description: A tool for retrieving terminal logs, likely integrated with Model Context Protocol (MCP) for structured log handling.
get-terminal-logs.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/ozgrozer/mcp-get-terminal-logs && cd mcp-get-terminal-logs && npm install
get-terminal-logs.usageInstructions: After cloning the repository and running 'npm install', additional setup steps may be required based on the project's configuration. Refer to the provided YouTube and X links for detailed setup instructions.

src-tree.name: MCP Source Tree Server
src-tree.description: An MCP server that generates a file tree of a specified directory, excluding files and directories based on .gitignore rules.
src-tree.installCommand: curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh && cd /path/to/mcp-src-tree && uv sync
src-tree.usageInstructions: 1. Install uv if not already installed. 2. Navigate to the project directory. 3. Run 'uv sync' to install dependencies. 4. Configure Claude for Desktop by adding the mcpServers configuration to claude_desktop_config.json. 5. Specify the directory to scan in Claude using a command like '/Users/xxx/GitHub/xxx/ '.

openapi-client-generator.name: OpenAPI Client Generator MCP Server
openapi-client-generator.description: An MCP server that generates API clients using TypeScript based on OpenAPI/Swagger specs.
openapi-client-generator.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/orhanveli/openapi-client-generator-mcp.git && cd openapi-client-generator-mcp && npm install && npm run build
openapi-client-generator.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies using 'npm install'. 2. Build the server using 'npm run build'. 3. Configure Claude Desktop by adding the server config to claude_desktop_config.json, specifying the path to the built index.js.

airbnb.name: Airbnb MCP Server
airbnb.description: MCP Server for searching Airbnb listings and retrieving listing details
airbnb.usageInstructions: 1. Ensure Node.js is installed. 2. Add the server configuration to claude_desktop_config.json. 3. Restart Claude Desktop.

source-relation.name: MCP Source Relation Server
source-relation.installCommand: curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh && cd /path/to/mcp-source-relation && uv sync

opslevel.name: OpsLevel MCP Server
opslevel.description: An MCP server that provides AIs with read-only access to OpsLevel account data including actions, campaigns, checks, components, documentation, domains, filters, infrastructure, repositories, systems, teams, and users.
optionalParams: MCP server configuration options for specific AI tools like Claude, VS Code, Cursor, Warp, and Windsurf
opslevel.usageInstructions: 1. Install the MCP Server using Homebrew, Docker, or manual download from GitHub releases. 2. Set the OPSLEVEL_API_TOKEN environment variable with your API token. 3. Configure the MCP server in your AI tool of choice (Claude, VS Code, Cursor, Warp, or Windsurf) using the provided JSON configuration examples. 4. Restart the AI tool to apply the configuration.

eagle.name: MCP Eagle Server
eagle.description: An MCP server for interfacing with the Eagle app, enabling integration with Claude Desktop.
eagle.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/olegshilin/mcp-eagle && cd mcp-eagle && npm install && npm run build
eagle.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and install dependencies.
2. Build the server using 'npm run build'.
3. Configure Claude Desktop by adding the MCP server configuration to '~/Library/Application Support/Claude/claude_desktop_config.json'.
4. Run the server using 'npm start' or configure Claude to run it automatically.

osp.name: Open Strategy Partners (OSP) Marketing Tools for LLMs
osp.description: A comprehensive suite of tools for technical marketing content creation, optimization, and product positioning based on Open Strategy Partners' methodologies.
osp.usageInstructions: 1. Install Claude Desktop or another MCP-enabled AI tool. 2. Install Python 3.10 or higher. 3. Install uv using 'pip install --user uv' (Windows) or 'brew install uv' (macOS). 4. Configure Claude Desktop by adding the OSP marketing tools server configuration to 'claude_desktop_config.json'.

nody.name: Nody
nody.description: Nody is a developer-first platform for managing and deploying Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers and toolsets, enabling customization, secure configuration storage, and centralized management of AI tool collections.

solana.name: Solana MCP Server
solana.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides comprehensive access to Solana blockchain data through Cline, implementing a wide range of Solana RPC methods for querying blockchain information via natural language conversations.
solana.installCommand: TEMP_DIR=$(mktemp -d) && cd "$TEMP_DIR" && git clone https://github.com/opensvm/solana-mcp-server.git . && cargo build --release && CONFIG_DIR="${XDG_CONFIG_HOME:-$HOME/.config}/claude" && mkdir -p "$CONFIG_DIR" && echo "{\"mcpServers\":{\"solana\":{\"command\":\"$PWD/target/release/solana-mcp-server\",\"env\":{\"SOLANA_RPC_URL\":\"https://api.mainnet-beta.solana.com\"}}}}" > "$CONFIG_DIR/config.json" || { rm -rf "$TEMP_DIR"; exit 1; }
solana.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and build the project using the provided script or download the appropriate binary from the releases page.
2. Configure the Solana RPC URL in the config.json file located in $HOME/.config/claude.
3. Start the server by running the binary or executing the built release.
4. Use the server to query Solana blockchain data via natural language conversations or programmatic RPC calls.
5. For deployment, use the provided deployment scripts (deploy-local.sh, deploy-docker.sh, etc.) for different environments.

zipic.name: Zipic MCP Server
zipic.description: An MCP server providing image compression capabilities through quick and advanced compression tools.
zipic.usageInstructions: After installation, configure for Claude.app or Cursor by adding the server command to their respective settings files. Use the 'quickCompress' or 'advancedCompress' tools by providing image URLs and optional parameters.

local-git.name: Local Git MCP Server
local-git.description: A Python-based Git repository management server using the MCP (Message-based Communication Protocol) framework for creating, managing, and interacting with local Git repositories.
local-git.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/okdshin/local-git-mcp-server && cd local-git-mcp-server && pip install -r requirements.txt
local-git.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies using the install command. 2. Run the server with 'python git_server.py' or specify a custom repositories directory with '--repositories-dir [path]'. 3. The server supports Git operations like repository creation, file addition, committing, pulling, pushing, and diff generation.

datetime.name: MCP DateTime
datetime.description: An MCP server providing datetime and timezone information to AI agents and chat interfaces.
datetime.usageInstructions: Run 'mcp-datetime' for standard I/O mode or 'mcp-datetime --sse' for Server-Sent Events mode. Use '--port' and '--prefix' options to customize SSE mode.

digitalocean-database.name: DigitalOcean Database MCP Server
digitalocean-database.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that connects AI-powered IDEs to DigitalOcean managed PostgreSQL and MySQL databases using an API token for secure access.
digitalocean-database.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/oladejibidmus/DigitalOcean-Database-MCP-Server.git && cd digitalocean-database-mcp && npm install && npm run build
digitalocean-database.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies. 2. Build the project with `npm run build`. 3. Set your DigitalOcean API token via `DO_API_TOKEN` or use the command `Set my DigitalOcean API token: [your_token]` in your IDE. 4. Configure your IDE to use the MCP server by pointing it to `dist/index.js`. 5. Use natural language commands to interact with your databases.

edit-file-lines.name: Edit File Lines MCP Server
edit-file-lines.description: A TypeScript-based MCP server that provides tools for making precise line-based edits to text files within allowed directories.
edit-file-lines.usageInstructions:
1. Set required environment variables: EDITOR_ACCESS_TOKEN and ALLOWED_EDIT_DIRS
2. Use the edit_file_lines endpoint with JSON payload containing path, edits, and dryRun flag
3. Approve changes using approve_edit with the returned state ID
4. Verify changes with get_file_lines
5. Optional: Configure MAX_EDIT_LINES and EDITOR_LOG_LEVEL for additional control

unity.name: Unity MCP Server
unity.description: A Model Context Protocol server for Unity, providing multimodal vision, powerful search, and superior code analysis capabilities.
unity.usageInstructions: 1. Install Node.js. 2. Configure mcp.json with Unity Editor and project paths. Example: { "mcpServers": { "unity": { "command": "npx", "args": ["-y", "@nurture-tech/unity-mcp-runner", "-unityPath", "<path to unity editor>", "-projectPath", "<path to unity project>"] } } }

smithery.name: Novu MCP Server
smithery.description: A TypeScript implementation of a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Novu, enabling AI agents to interact with Novu's notification infrastructure.
smithery.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/novuhq/smithery-mcp && cd smithery-mcp && npm install && npm run build
smithery.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies. 2. Configure Novu API key in smithery.yml. 3. Build the project using 'npm run build'. 4. Start the MCP server with 'npm start'. For development, use 'npm run dev'.

nx-console.name: Nx Console
nx-console.description: Nx Console is a UI tool for Nx and Lerna monorepos, providing visual workflows, AI enhancements, and deep insights into your workspace.
nx-console.usageInstructions: 1. Install the Nx Console extension for your editor (VSCode or JetBrains). 2. Ensure you are in an Nx or Lerna workspace. 3. Use the Nx Console UI to run generators, visualize project graphs, and manage tasks. 4. For AI enhancements, configure the AI provider and enable context sharing in the settings.

norman.name: Norman Finance MCP Server
norman.description: This Model Context Protocol (MCP) server enables AI to interact with the Norman Finance API, allowing access to accounting, invoices, companies, clients, taxes, and more through a standardized protocol.
norman.usageInstructions: 1. Create an account on Norman Finance (https://app.norman.finance/sign-up). 2. Use the remote MCP server at https://mcp.norman.finance/sse for OAuth-based authentication. 3. For local setup, install uv and run the server with environment variables for authentication. 4. Add the server to Claude Desktop or other MCP-compatible clients using the provided configuration.

gitee.name: Gitee MCP Server
gitee.description: MCP server for operating Gitee repositories, issues, and pull requests through AI
gitee.usageInstructions: 1. Install via Smithery using 'npx -y @smithery/cli install @normal-coder/gitee-mcp-server --client claude'. 2. Configure GITEE_PERSONAL_ACCESS_TOKEN environment variable. 3. Optionally set GITEE_API_BASE_URL and DEBUG if needed. 4. Run MCP server via NPX or Docker.

restart.name: MCP Server Restart
restart.description: An MCP server for restarting Claude Desktop on Mac

cursor-trivy.name: Trivy Security Scanner MCP Server
cursor-trivy.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides Trivy security scanning capabilities through a standardized interface.
cursor-trivy.installCommand: python -m venv .venv && source .venv/bin/activate && pip install -r requirements.txt
cursor-trivy.usageInstructions:
1. Start the server using the command: python server.py --transport sse --port 54321
2. Configure Cursor IDE by adding the server URL: http://127.0.0.1:54321/sse
3. Add a .cursorrules file with the provided configuration to automate security scans on dependency changes.
4. Use the prompt 'Please scan my project for security vulnerabilities' to manually trigger scans.

idb.name: MCP Server for Facebook's iOS Development Bridge
idb.description: MCP server integration for Facebook's iOS Development Bridge, enabling automated iOS device management and test execution through MCP.
idb.usageInstructions: 1. Install idb companion: 'brew tap facebook/fb && brew install idb-companion'. 2. Configure mcp-config.json with 'idb' server details. 3. Start the server using 'npx -y @noahlozevski/mcp-idb'.

render.name: Render MCP Server
render.description: An MCP server that allows AI assistants to interact with the Render API for deploying and managing services on Render.com.
render.usageInstructions: 1. Get your Render API key from the Render Dashboard. 2. Configure the MCP server with your key using `node bin/render-mcp.js configure --api-key=YOUR_API_KEY`. 3. Start the server with `node bin/render-mcp.js start`. 4. Use with AI assistants like Cline, Windsurf/Cursor, or custom Claude API integrations by configuring the MCP server connection.

myip.name: MyIP MCP Server
myip.description: An MCP server that retrieves your public IP address using ifconfig.me.
myip.usageInstructions: After installation, the server provides a `get_ip_info` tool to retrieve your public IP address. No additional configuration or environment variables are required.

nodit.name: Nodit MCP Server
nodit.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that connects AI agents and developers to structured, context-ready blockchain data across multiple networks through Nodit's Web3 infrastructure.
nodit.usageInstructions: 1. Install Node.js 18+. 2. Get a Nodit API key from https://nodit.lambda256.io/. 3. Run 'npx @noditlabs/nodit-mcp-server@latest' or set up locally by cloning the repo and running 'npm install && npm run build'. 4. Set your NODIT_API_KEY environment variable. 5. Communicate via JSON-RPC over stdio using commands like 'echo '{"method":"tools/list","params":{}}' | node build/index.js'.

nile.name: Nile MCP Server
nile.description: An MCP server implementation for Nile database platform, enabling LLM applications to interact with Nile through a standardized interface.
nile.usageInstructions:
1. Create a .env file with NILE_API_KEY and NILE_WORKSPACE_SLUG
2. Configure Claude Desktop/Cursor with the server command
3. Build the project using 'npm run build'
4. Start the server using 'node dist/index.js' or 'npm run dev'

mongodb-model-context-protocol-.name: MongoDB MCP Server
mongodb-model-context-protocol-.description: An MCP server enabling LLMs to interact with MongoDB databases through natural language queries.
mongodb-model-context-protocol-.usageInstructions:
1. Ensure Node.js 18+ is installed.
2. Configure Claude Desktop config file with 'npx mongo-mcp' command and MongoDB connection URL.
3. For local sandbox testing, use Docker Compose to start MongoDB and seed test data.

duckduckgo.name: DuckDuckGo Search MCP Server
duckduckgo.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides web search capabilities through DuckDuckGo, with additional features for content fetching and parsing.
duckduckgo.usageInstructions: 1. Install the server using `uv pip install duckduckgo-mcp-server`. 2. For local development, use the MCP CLI with `mcp dev server.py`. 3. To use with Claude Desktop, configure the `claude_desktop_config.json` file with the MCP server command. 4. The server provides two tools: `search` for querying DuckDuckGo and `fetch_content` for retrieving webpage content. 5. Ensure rate limits are respected (30 search requests and 20 content fetches per minute).

release-notes.name: Release Notes Server
release-notes.description: An MCP server that generates beautiful release notes from GitHub repositories by fetching and organizing commits.
release-notes.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/nickbaumann98/release-notes-server && cd release-notes-server && npm install && npm run build
release-notes.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies. 2. Configure the server in your MCP configuration with the path to the built index.js. 3. Set GITHUB_TOKEN environment variable with your GitHub personal access token. 4. Use the 'generate_release_notes' tool to create release notes for your repositories.

chrome-tools.name: Chrome Tools MCP Server
chrome-tools.description: An MCP server providing tools for interacting with Chrome through its DevTools Protocol, enabling remote control of Chrome tabs.
chrome-tools.usageInstructions: 1. Launch Chrome with remote debugging enabled. 2. Configure MCP settings with environment variables. 3. Use provided tools like list_tabs, execute_script, capture_screenshot.

everart-forge.name: EverArt Forge MCP
everart-forge.description: An advanced Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Cline that integrates with EverArt's AI models to generate both vector and raster images.
everart-forge.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/nickbaumann98/everart-forge-mcp.git && cd everart-forge-mcp && npm install && npm run build
everart-forge.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies. 2. Build the project using 'npm run build'. 3. Obtain an EverArt API key and add it to your Cline MCP settings file. 4. Restart Cline to load the new MCP server. Use the 'generate_image' tool with prompts to create images, specifying parameters like model, format, and output path.

libsql.name: LibSQL Model Context Protocol Server
libsql.description: A server application that interfaces with LibSQL databases to provide schema information and execute SQL queries using the Model Context Protocol (MCP).
libsql.installCommand: curl -fsSL https://deno.land/install.sh | sh && deno run build
libsql.usageInstructions: After installation, run the server with the LibSQL database URL. For unauthenticated access: `./mcp-server-libsql <database-url>`. For authenticated access: `./mcp-server-libsql --auth-token <token> <database-url>`. Ensure Deno 2.1+ is installed and the LibSQL database URL is accessible.

vercel.name: Vercel MCP Integration
vercel.description: An MCP server implementing Vercel's core API endpoints as tools for deployment management, environment variables, and team management.
vercel.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/nganiet/mcp-vercel.git && cd vercel-mcp && npm install
vercel.usageInstructions: 1. Create .env file with VERCEL_API_TOKEN. 2. Start server with 'npm start'. 3. Connect to AI Assistants like Claude or Cursor using MCP protocol.

stealth-browser.name: Stealth Browser MCP Server
stealth-browser.description: An MCP server providing stealth browser capabilities using Playwright with anti-detection techniques for website navigation and screenshot capture.
stealth-browser.usageInstructions:
1. Install dependencies: bun install
2. Run the MCP server: bun start
3. Use the 'screenshot' tool with parameters: url (required), fullPage (optional), selector (optional), headless (optional)

clipboard.name: MacOS Clipboard MCP Server
clipboard.description: An MCP server that provides access to the macOS clipboard via OSAScript, allowing AI assistants to retrieve clipboard content including text, images, and binary data.
clipboard.usageInstructions: To start the server, run: `bun run start`. For development with hot reloading, use: `bun run dev`. Additional development modes include `bun run dev2`, `bun run inspect`, and `bun run mcp-cli`. The server retrieves clipboard content on demand using AppleScript via the `osascript` command and supports text, images (PNG), and binary data with appropriate MIME types.

deepseek-thinking-claude-3.5-sonnet-clin.name: Deepseek-Thinking-Claude-3.5-Sonnet-CLINE-MCP
deepseek-thinking-claude-3.5-sonnet-clin.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server combining DeepSeek R1's reasoning with Claude 3.5 Sonnet's response generation via OpenRouter API.
deepseek-thinking-claude-3.5-sonnet-clin.usageInstructions:
1. Install via Smithery using the provided command.
2. Set the OPENROUTER_API_KEY in your environment.
3. Add the server to your Cline MCP settings with the correct paths and API key.
4. Use the 'generate_response' tool with required prompt and optional parameters.
5. Poll for response status using 'check_response_status' with the returned task ID.

neon.name: Neon MCP Server
neon.description: An open-source MCP server for interacting with Neon Postgres databases using natural language.
neon.usageInstructions: 1. Install using 'npx -y @smithery/cli@latest install neon --client <client_name>'. 2. Configure Neon API key when prompted. 3. Restart MCP client. For manual configuration, add the Neon MCP server details to your client's mcp_config file.

needle.name: Needle MCP Server
needle.description: MCP server for document management and search using Needle through Claude's Desktop Application
needle.usageInstructions: 1. Install via Smithery using 'npx -y @smithery/cli install needle-mcp --client claude'. 2. For manual installation: clone the repository, install UV, create claude_desktop_config.json with NEEDLE_API_KEY, and configure Claude Desktop. 3. Verify installation by checking Claude Desktop integration.

calc-tools.name: MCP Calc Tools
calc-tools.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server providing advanced mathematical and financial calculation tools for integration with AI code assistants.
calc-tools.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/nbiish/mcp-calc-tools.git && cd mcp-calc-tools && npm install
calc-tools.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and install dependencies using 'npm install'.
2. Start the server with 'npm start' or 'node index.js'.
3. Configure your AI assistant (e.g., Cline/Roo Code) to connect to the running server instance.
4. Use the available mathematical and financial tools by sending appropriate requests to the server.

nefino.name: Nefino MCP Server
nefino.description: The Nefino MCP Server provides Large Language Models with access to news and information about renewable energy projects, planning, and announcements in Germany by integrating with the Nefino API.
nefino.usageInstructions:
1. Install the server using the provided install command.
2. Set the required environment variables (NEFINO_USERNAME, NEFINO_PASSWORD, NEFINO_JWT_SECRET, NEFINO_BASE_URL).
3. Run the server using 'python -m mcp_nefino'.
4. For use with Claude Desktop, add the server configuration to the Claude Desktop config file as described in the README.
5. Use the 'retrieve_news_items_for_place' tool with parameters like place_id, place_type, and optional filters for date ranges or topics.

ctgov.name: AACT Clinical Trials MCP Server
ctgov.description: An MCP server providing access to the AACT (Aggregate Analysis of ClinicalTrials.gov) database using FastMCP framework.
ctgov.usageInstructions:
1. Create a free account at https://aact.ctti-clinicaltrials.org/users/sign_up
2. Set DB_USER and DB_PASSWORD environment variables
3. Configure Claude Desktop by adding the server configuration to claude_desktop_config.json

livecode.name: MCP server for io.livecode.ch
livecode.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for the io.livecode.ch domain, enabling integration with live coding environments.
livecode.installCommand: mcp install server.py && mcp dev server.py --with requests
livecode.usageInstructions: After installation, set the required environment variables (MCP_SERVICE_URL and LIVECODE_API_KEY). Start the server using the provided commands. Ensure the 'requests' dependency is available for API integration. Customize optional parameters like PORT and LOG_LEVEL for configuration.

code-research.name: Code Research MCP Server
code-research.description: An MCP server providing tools for searching programming resources across multiple platforms including Stack Overflow, MDN, GitHub, npm, and PyPI.
code-research.usageInstructions: 1. Install via Smithery using the provided command. For manual installation: git clone https://github.com/nahmanmate/code-research-mcp-server.git, cd code-research-mcp-server, npm install, npm run build. Configure MCP settings with the server path and optionally set GITHUB_TOKEN environment variable.

bazel.name: Bazel MCP Server
bazel.description: A local MCP server that exposes Bazel build system functionality to MCP-enabled AI agents, allowing them to build, query, test, and manage Bazel targets.
bazel.usageInstructions:
1. Install using the command: npx -y github:nacgarg/bazel-mcp-server
2. Configure the server by providing command line arguments, environment variables, or a configuration file.
3. Use the provided tools (bazel_build_target, bazel_query_target, etc.) to interact with Bazel targets.
4. For Cursor integration, add the server configuration to .cursor/mcp.json as shown in the README.
5. Set DEBUG=true for verbose logging during debugging.

webresearch.name: MCP Web Research Server
webresearch.description: An MCP server for web research integration with Claude Desktop
webresearch.usageInstructions: 1. Install Claude Desktop app. 2. Add configuration to claude_desktop_config.json. 3. Start chat with Claude and use web research features.

todo.name: mcp-todo-server
todo.description: Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for managing TODO.md and CHANGELOG.md files with line-based editing, version tracking, and semantic task handling.
optionalParams: File paths for importing TODO.md or CHANGELOG.md
Version numbers for task or changelog filtering
Line ranges for partial file access
todo.usageInstructions: After installation, use the server to perform TODO.md and CHANGELOG.md operations via MCP tools like `get-todo-tasks`, `add-todo-task`, `get-changelog`, and `generate-changelog-from-todo`. Import existing TODO.md or CHANGELOG.md files using `import-todo` or `import-changelog`. Specify line ranges, versions, or file paths as needed for precise content manipulation.

web-search.name: Web Search MCP Server
web-search.description: MCP server for web searches using Serper API
web-search.usageInstructions:
1. Create a .env file with SERPER_API_KEY from serper.dev
2. Optionally set PORT to specify listening port
3. Run using 'docker compose up'

google-tasks.name: Google Tasks MCP Server
google-tasks.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for managing Google Tasks, enabling integration with LLMs or other applications via MCP.
google-tasks.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/mstfe/mcp-google-tasks && cd mcp-google-tasks && npm install
google-tasks.usageInstructions: 1. Set required environment variables (GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID, GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET, GOOGLE_REFRESH_TOKEN) for Google API authentication. 2. Run the server using `node build/index.js`. 3. Use MCP tools to interact with the server via commands like `create_task`, `list_tasks`, `delete_task`, `update_task`, and `complete_task`. 4. For debugging, run `npm run inspector` and use the provided URL to access the MCP Inspector.

ledger.name: ledger-service MCP server
ledger.description: MCP Server for accessing and managing ledger files through Claude, providing tools for listing accounts, checking balances, and viewing transaction registers.
ledger.usageInstructions: After installation, configure the server by setting the LEDGER_BASE_PATH environment variable to the directory containing your ledger files. Use the MCP Inspector or integrate with Claude Desktop to interact with the server. For development, clone the repository, create a virtual environment, and install dependencies.

django-migrations.name: Django Migrations MCP Service
django-migrations.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) service for managing Django migrations in distributed environments, exposing migration commands as MCP endpoints for integration with CI/CD pipelines.
django-migrations.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/mrrobotke/django-migrations-mcp.git && cd django-migrations-mcp && pip install -r requirements.txt
django-migrations.usageInstructions: 1. Set DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE to your Django project's settings module. 2. Optionally set MCP_SERVICE_PORT (default 8000) and REDIS_URL for Redis integration. 3. Run the service using `python -m migrations_mcp.service` or via Docker with the provided commands. 4. Use MCP client calls to interact with migration endpoints like show_migrations, make_migrations, and migrate.

contentful-delivery.name: Contentful Delivery MCP Server
contentful-delivery.description: An MCP server providing access to Contentful's Delivery API through AI assistants, enabling natural language queries for content entries, assets, and content types.
contentful-delivery.usageInstructions: After installation, set up your Contentful credentials by exporting CONTENTFUL_SPACE_ID and CONTENTFUL_ACCESS_TOKEN. Optionally, restrict content to specific types by setting CONTENTFUL_CONTENT_TYPE_IDS. The server can be integrated with Mastra AI using the provided TypeScript example.

tailscale.name: Tailscale MCP Server
tailscale.description: MCP server that allows querying Tailscale status using the Tailscale CLI on macOS.
tailscale.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/mrnugget/tailscale-mcp && cd tailscale-mcp && uv pip install -r requirements.txt
tailscale.usageInstructions: 1. Ensure Tailscale is installed at /Applications/Tailscale.app/Contents/MacOS/Tailscale. 2. Install uv from https://github.com/astral/uv. 3. Run the server using 'python tailscale.py' for stdio transport or 'python tailscale.py --transport http --port 4001' for HTTP/SSE transport.

doris.name: Apache Doris MCP Server
doris.description: An MCP server for Apache Doris, enabling integration with the Model Context Protocol for data querying and management.
doris.installCommand: uv pip install mcp-doris && uv sync
doris.usageInstructions: 1. Install uv and set up a virtual environment. 2. Clone the repository and navigate to its directory. 3. Run 'uv sync' to install dependencies. 4. Set the required environment variables (DORIS_HOST, DORIS_PORT, DORIS_USER, DORIS_PASSWORD). 5. Start the server using 'mcp dev mcp_doris/mcp_server.py'. 6. Visit http://localhost:5173 in your browser to interact with the server.

motherduck.name: MotherDuck's DuckDB MCP Server
motherduck.description: An MCP server implementation that interacts with DuckDB and MotherDuck databases, providing SQL analytics capabilities to AI Assistants and IDEs.
motherduck.usageInstructions: 1. Install uv using 'pip install uv' or 'brew install uv'. 2. For MotherDuck, sign up for an account, generate an access token, and store it securely. 3. Run the server using 'uvx mcp-server-motherduck' with appropriate parameters. For example: 'uvx mcp-server-motherduck --transport stream --db-path md: --motherduck-token YOUR_TOKEN'.

mongodb-atlas.name: MongoDB Atlas MCP Server
mongodb-atlas.description: An MCP server for managing MongoDB Atlas projects, including cluster creation, user setup, network access, and connection string retrieval.
mongodb-atlas.usageInstructions: To use the server, set the ATLAS_PUBLIC_KEY and ATLAS_PRIVATE_KEY environment variables and run 'npx mcp-mongodb-atlas'. Alternatively, pass the keys as arguments. For integration with tools like Cline, Cursor, or Claude Desktop, configure the server in the respective settings file with the command 'npx mcp-mongodb-atlas' and the required environment variables.

bigquery.name: MCP BigQuery Server
bigquery.description: A server that allows querying BigQuery tables using MCP, written in Go.
bigquery.installCommand: brew tap monochromegane/tap && brew install monochromegane/tap/mcp-bigquery-server
bigquery.usageInstructions: 1. Install using brew. 2. Configure .cursor/mcp.json with server details including project and dataset(s). 3. Start using available tools like list_allowed_datasets, list_tables, get_table_schema, dry_run_query.

youtube-music.name: YouTube Music MCP Server
youtube-music.description: An MCP server enabling AI models to control YouTube Music playback through Google Chrome.
youtube-music.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/mondweep/youtube-music-mcp-server && cd youtube-music-mcp-server && npm install && npm run build
youtube-music.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies using 'npm install'. 2. Build the server using 'npm run build'. 3. Configure Claude Desktop by adding the server path to '~/Library/Application Support/Claude/claude_desktop_config.json' or '%APPDATA%/Claude/claude_desktop_config.json'.

mobile.name: Mobile MCP Server
mobile.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables scalable mobile automation and development through a platform-agnostic interface for iOS and Android devices, simulators, and emulators.
mobile.usageInstructions: 1. Ensure prerequisites are installed: Xcode command line tools, Android Platform Tools, Node.js v22+. 2. Run the install command. 3. Connect your iOS or Android device/emulator/simulator. 4. Use an MCP-compatible agent (e.g., Claude Code, Cline) to interact with the server and execute mobile workflows.

asset-price.name: Asset Price MCP Server
asset-price.description: An MCP server for retrieving and displaying current asset price information, including precious metals and cryptocurrencies.
asset-price.usageInstructions: To use this server, configure it in your code editor or AI client configuration file. For Claude Desktop, add the configuration as shown in the README. The server can be run directly using 'npx -y asset-price-mcp'.

strapi.name: Strapi MCP Server
strapi.description: A Model Context Protocol server for interacting with Strapi CMS, enabling AI assistants to perform content operations through a standardized interface.
strapi.usageInstructions:
1. Create a configuration file at `~/.mcp/strapi-mcp-server.config.json` with your Strapi API URL and JWT token.
2. Use the provided JavaScript functions like `strapi_rest()` and `strapi_upload_media()` to interact with your Strapi instance.
3. Ensure you handle authentication and version compatibility in your configuration.
4. Refer to the documentation for filtering, sorting, and pagination parameters in REST API operations.

todoist.name: Todoist MCP
todoist.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates with Todoist, allowing interaction with Todoist's API to manage tasks, projects, sections, comments, labels, and collaboration features.
todoist.usageInstructions:
1. Install the Claude desktop app and ensure it supports MCP.
2. Get your Todoist API key from Todoist's Developer settings.
3. Clone the repository and build the server using 'npm install' and 'npm run build'.
4. Configure the 'claude_desktop_config.json' file with the MCP server command and environment variables.
5. Launch the Claude desktop app and interact with Todoist via natural language commands.

task.name: Task API Server - MCP TypeScript Implementation
task.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) implementation for Task Management API written in TypeScript, providing both STDIO and HTTP+SSE interfaces for task management operations.
task.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/milkosten/task-mcp-server.git && cd task-mcp-server && npm install
task.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and install dependencies using 'npm install'.
2. Create an .env file with your Task API credentials.
3. Build the project using 'npm run build'.
4. Run the server in STDIO mode with 'npm start' or HTTP mode with 'npm run start:http'.
5. Use the provided client examples for integration with CLI/AI or web interfaces.

ddg.name: DuckDuckGo MCP Server
ddg.description: A server providing DuckDuckGo search capabilities through the Model Context Protocol.
ddg.usageInstructions: After installation, configure the server for Claude Desktop by modifying claude_desktop_config.json. Use 'uvx ddg-mcp' for published servers or 'uv run ddg-mcp' for development. The server provides various search tools (text, image, news, video) and AI chat capabilities through DuckDuckGo.

aistor.name: AIStor MCP Server
aistor.description: An MCP server for interacting with AIStor object stores, providing various operations like listing buckets, managing objects, and administrative functions.
aistor.installCommand: podman run -d --name aistor-mcp-server -v /Users/YOUR_USERNAME/Downloads:/Downloads -e MINIO_ENDPOINT=REPLACE_WITH_ENDPOINT -e MINIO_ACCESS_KEY=REPLACE_WITH_ACCESS_KEY -e MINIO_SECRET_KEY=REPLACE_WITH_SECRET_KEY -e MINIO_USE_SSL=true -p8090:8090 quay.io/minio/aistor/mcp-server-aistor:latest --allowed-directories /Downloads --allow-admin --allow-delete --allow-write --http --http-port 8090
aistor.usageInstructions: 1. Ensure Docker or Podman is installed. 2. Run the installCommand with your actual MINIO_ENDPOINT, MINIO_ACCESS_KEY, and MINIO_SECRET_KEY. 3. Configure your MCP client with the server URL http://localhost:8090/mcp. 4. Use commands like 'List all buckets on my AIStor server' or 'Upload document.pdf from Downloads to bucket my-bucket'.

biodiversity.name: Biodiversity Model Context Protocol Server
biodiversity.description: MCP server for biodiversity data integration with Claude Desktop
biodiversity.installCommand: powershell -ExecutionPolicy ByPass -c "irm https://astral.sh/uv/install.ps1 | iex" && uv pip install mcp && mcp install server.py
biodiversity.usageInstructions:
1. Install Python and uv using the provided commands
2. Activate virtual environment: .venv\Scripts\activate
3. Install server: mcp install server.py
4. Run server: mcp run server.py or python -m uvicorn server:mcp --reload for development
5. For development with Inspector: mcp dev server.py (requires Node & npx)

ai-image-gen.name: Image Generation MCP Server
ai-image-gen.description: An MCP server that generates images using Replicate's black-forest-labs/flux-schnell model, supporting configurable parameters like resolution, aspect ratio, and quality.
ai-image-gen.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/mikeyny/ai-image-gen-mcp && cd ai-image-gen-mcp && npm install
ai-image-gen.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies with `npm install`. 2. Set your Replicate API token in `src/imageService.ts` or via a `.env` file. 3. Build the project with `npm run build`. 4. Run the server with `node ./dist/server.js`. 5. Use an MCP client to send image generation requests with required parameters like `prompt` and `output_dir`.

home-assistant.name: Home Assistant MCP Server
home-assistant.description: An MCP server integrating with Home Assistant for smart home control
home-assistant.usageInstructions: 1. Install using 'uvx home-assistant-server'. 2. Create a .env file with HOMEASSISTANT_TOKEN and HOMEASSISTANT_BASE_URL. 3. Configure Claude Desktop by adding the server configuration to claude_desktop_config.json.

substack.name: MCP Substack Server
substack.description: An MCP server for downloading and parsing Substack posts, integrating with Claude.ai desktop app.
substack.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/michalnaka/mcp-substack.git && cd mcp-substack && npm install
substack.usageInstructions: 1. Configure Claude desktop app by adding mcp-substack configuration to ~/Library/Application Support/Claude/claude_desktop_config.json. 2. Start the server using 'npm start'. 3. In Claude desktop app, use the command: 'Could you download and summarize this Substack post: [URL]'

semanticworkbench.name: Semantic Workbench
semanticworkbench.description: A versatile tool for prototyping intelligent assistants with a user-friendly interface for creating conversations, configuring settings, and integrating various assistant services.
semanticworkbench.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/microsoft/semanticworkbench.git && cd semanticworkbench && docker run -i --rm -p 4000:4000 -v ${PWD}:/app -w /app python:3.10 bash -c 'pip install -r workbench-service/requirements.txt && pip install -r workbench-app/requirements.txt'
semanticworkbench.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and navigate to the directory. 2. Start the workbench service using Docker with the provided command. 3. Open your browser and navigate to https://localhost:4000. 4. Create an assistant using the dashboard and start a conversation. 5. Optional: configure additional assistant services from the examples directory.

metricool.name: Metricool MCP Server
metricool.description: An MCP server that connects AI agents to the Metricool API for social media metrics analysis, campaign data access, and post scheduling.
metricool.usageInstructions: 1. Create a Metricool account and obtain API access (Advanced Tier). 2. Install uv and git. 3. Configure Claude Desktop by creating a claude_desktop_config.json file with the required environment variables. 4. Run the server using 'uvx mcp-metricool'. 5. Use the available tools to access social media metrics, analyze data, and schedule posts.

metamcp.name: MetaMCP MCP Server
metamcp.description: A proxy server that joins multiple MCP servers into one, fetching configurations from MetaMCP App and routing requests to the correct underlying server.
metamcp.usageInstructions: After installation, run 'mcp-server-metamcp --metamcp-api-key <your-api-key>' for stdio server, or use '--transport sse' or '--transport streamable-http' for different transport options. Configure stderr handling with '--stderr' or 'METAMCP_STDERR' environment variable.

sqlite.name: SQLite MCP Server
sqlite.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides comprehensive SQLite database management and analysis capabilities for LLMs.
sqlite.usageInstructions: 1. Install Python 3.8+ and SQLite. 2. Run the install command to get the server script. 3. Set the DB_PATH environment variable to your SQLite database file. 4. For Claude Desktop integration, add the server configuration to claude_desktop_config.json with the correct paths. 5. Use the server to explore schemas, execute queries, and perform data analysis.

meilisearch.name: Meilisearch MCP Server
meilisearch.description: A Model Context Protocol server enabling MCP-compatible clients to interact with Meilisearch, managing search indices and performing searches through natural conversation.
meilisearch.usageInstructions: 1. Install using 'pip install meilisearch-mcp' or 'uvx -n meilisearch-mcp'. 2. Configure Claude Desktop by adding the server configuration to 'claude_desktop_config.json'. 3. Start Meilisearch using Docker or Homebrew. Environment variables MEILI_HTTP_ADDR and optionally MEILI_MASTER_KEY can be set for default connection settings.

mcp2tavily.name: MCP2Tavily
mcp2tavily.description: MCP protocol server implementing web search functionality using Tavily API
mcp2tavily.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/mcp2everything/mcp2tavily.git && cd mcp2tavily && uv venv && source .venv/bin/activate && uv sync
mcp2tavily.usageInstructions:
1. Create .env file with TAVILY_API_KEY
2. Run 'fastmcp install mcp2tavily.py' for Claude extension
3. Use 'fastmcp dev mcp2tavily.py' for development mode

gitlab-code-review.name: GitLab MCP for Code Review
gitlab-code-review.description: An MCP server for integrating AI assistants like Claude with GitLab's merge requests, enabling code review through the GitLab API.
gitlab-code-review.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/mehmetakinn/gitlab-mcp-code-review.git && cd gitlab-mcp-code-review && python -m venv .venv && source .venv/bin/activate && pip install -r requirements.txt
gitlab-code-review.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and create a virtual environment. 2. Install dependencies using pip. 3. Create a .env file with your GitLab personal access token and optional settings. 4. Configure the MCP server in Cursor IDE or Claude Desktop App using the provided JSON configuration. 5. Use the available tools to interact with GitLab merge requests, such as fetching diffs, adding comments, and approving merge requests.

mcp2brave.name: MCP2Brave Server
mcp2brave.description: An MCP protocol server using Brave API for web search functionality
mcp2brave.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/mcp2everything/mcp2brave.git && cd mcp2brave && uv venv && .venv/bin/activate && uv sync
mcp2brave.usageInstructions:
1. Create .env file with Brave_API_KEY
2. Run 'fastmcp install mcp2brave.py' to install as Claude extension
3. Use 'fastmcp dev mcp2brave.py' for development mode

honk.name: Minimal MCP Server in Nix
honk.description: A simple MCP server demo providing stub location and current time functionality
honk.usageInstructions: To use this MCP server, add the following to your Claude config: 'minimal-mcp-in-nix': { 'command': 'nix', 'args': [ 'run', 'github:mccartykim/minimal-mcp-in-nix' ] }

community-servers.name: MCP Get Community Servers
community-servers.description: A collection of community-maintained Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers providing tools for LLM.txt file search, HTTP requests, and macOS system operations.
community-servers.usageInstructions: 1. Install a server using the MCP Get CLI with the command: npx @michaellatman/mcp-get@latest install <server-name>. 2. For development, run 'npm install' followed by 'npm run watch' for automatic recompilation. 3. Use the installed server according to its specific functionality (e.g., for HTTP requests or macOS operations).

goose.name: Goose FM
goose.description: A simple MCP server demonstration using an RTL-SDR dongle and antenna to tune into radio stations and play them via speakers.
goose.usageInstructions:
1. Ensure you have a compatible RTL-SDR dongle connected.
2. Run the server using the provided install command.
3. Configure your AI assistant (e.g., Claude desktop) to use the server with the specified JSON configuration.
4. Known issue: Nix flake may not properly encapsulate dependencies like sox and rtl_fm.

mcp2serial.name: MCP2Serial
mcp2serial.usageInstructions: 1.  config.yaml 2.  MCP  Claude Desktop  Cline mcp2serial 3.

thinking.name: MCP Thinking Server
thinking.description: Extracts the reasoning process of the Deepseek R1 model and integrates it with MCP clients like Claude Desktop.
thinking.usageInstructions: After installation, run `bun setup` and input your Deepseek API key. Open Claude Desktop to use the reasoning model. For testing, copy `.env.test.example` to `.env.test` and run `bun test`.

arc.name: ARC Model Context Protocol (MCP) Server
arc.description: An MCP server that bridges AI models with ARC's enterprise application framework, enabling AI assistants to leverage ARC capabilities.
arc.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/sourcefuse/arc-mcp-server.git && cd arc-mcp-server && npm install && npm run build && npm start
arc.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and cd into it. 2. Run 'npm install' to install dependencies. 3. Run 'npm run build' to build the project. 4. Run 'npm start' to start the server. 5. Configure Claude Desktop to connect to the MCP server by editing its configuration file.

aqicn.name: AQICN MCP Server
aqicn.description: MCP server providing real-time air quality data from the World Air Quality Index project
aqicn.usageInstructions:
1. Create .env file with AQICN_API_KEY=your_api_key_here
2. Run server using 'mcp dev aqicn_server.py' for development or 'python aqicn_server.py' for direct execution
3. Use available tools: city_aqi, geo_aqi, search_station

brightsy.name: Brightsy MCP Server
brightsy.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that connects to a Brightsy AI agent, allowing it to be used as a tool in an MCP client.
brightsy.usageInstructions: 1. Set the required environment variables BRIGHTSY_AGENT_ID and BRIGHTSY_API_KEY, or pass them as command-line arguments. 2. Start the server using `npm start` with the agent ID and API key as arguments. 3. Optionally, customize the tool name using `--tool-name` or the `BRIGHTSY_TOOL_NAME` environment variable. 4. Use the MCP client to call the registered tool with a message array.

senechal.name: Senechal MCP Server
senechal.description: An MCP server providing health data from the Senechal API to LLM applications.
senechal.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/mattjoyce/senechal-mcp.git && cd senechal-mcp && python -m venv venv && source venv/bin/activate && pip install -r requirements.txt
senechal.usageInstructions:
1. Copy .env.example to .env and configure SENECHAL_API_KEY and SENECHAL_API_BASE_URL.
2. Run the server using 'python senechal_mcp_server.py'.
3. Test with 'python example_client.py' in another terminal.
4. For Claude Desktop integration, use 'mcp install senechal_mcp_server.py'.

cursor-installer.name: Cursor MCP Installer
cursor-installer.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for installing and configuring other MCP servers within Cursor IDE.
optionalParams: local directory paths for MCP servers
cursor-installer.usageInstructions:
1. Install using 'npm install -g cursor-mcp-installer-free@0.1.3'.
2. Add the MCP Installer to your Cursor configuration by editing the ~/.cursor/mcp.json file with the provided JSON configuration.
3. Restart Cursor IDE.
4. Use Claude to install MCP servers by prompting with commands like 'Install the web search MCP server' or 'Install the MCP server for OpenAPI schema exploration with my-schema.yaml'.

govee.name: Govee MCP Server
govee.description: An MCP server for controlling Govee LED devices through the Govee API.
govee.usageInstructions: Create a .env file with GOVEE_API_KEY, GOVEE_DEVICE_ID, and GOVEE_SKU. Use 'govee-cli' for direct device control or integrate with MCP clients like Cline.

bun-s3.name: Bun S3 MCP Service
bun-s3.description: An MCP service using Bun's S3 bindings to save and load code snippets to S3 as markdown files, integrating with Claude Desktop.
bun-s3.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/mattbarlow-sg/bun-s3-mcp && cd bun-s3-mcp && bun install
bun-s3.usageInstructions: After installation, configure your AWS credentials and bucket name. Start the server with 'bun run start'. Ensure Bun is installed (curl -fsSL https://bun.sh/install | bash). For production, configure appropriate AWS permissions.

taboola.name: Taboola MCP Connector
taboola.description: An MCP tool that connects Taboola Advertising API with AI assistants like Claude, enabling natural language querying of campaign data.
taboola.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/matlafu/taboola && cd taboola && pip install -r requirements.txt
taboola.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and install dependencies using pip.
2. Create a .env file with your Taboola API credentials.
3. Add the connector to Cursor's MCP configuration by editing .cursor/mcp.json.
4. Restart Cursor and verify the connection by asking a simple question like 'List my Taboola accounts'.
5. Use natural language queries to analyze campaign data, such as 'Show me my campaign performance for the last 30 days'.

thoughtful-claude.name: Thoughtful Claude - DeepSeek R1 Reasoning Server
thoughtful-claude.description: An MCP server integrating DeepSeek R1's advanced reasoning engine with Claude's thought process.
thoughtful-claude.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/martinbowling/thoughtful-claude.git && cd thoughtful-claude && pip install "mcp[cli]" httpx python-dotenv && echo "DEEPSEEK_API_KEY=your_key_here" > .env && mcp install server.py -f .env
thoughtful-claude.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and install dependencies.
2. Create a .env file with your DeepSeek API key.
3. Run 'mcp install server.py -f .env' to register the server with Claude Desktop.
4. Start using Claude with the integrated DeepSeek R1 reasoning capabilities.

scaflog-zoho.name: scaflog-zoho-mcp-server
scaflog-zoho.description: An MCP server for managing a simple note storage system with integration into Zoho Creator, supporting note:// URIs, note summarization, and adding notes as a tool.
scaflog-zoho.usageInstructions:
1. Install the server using the command: uvx scaflog-zoho-mcp-server.
2. Configure the server in Claude Desktop by adding the MCP server configuration under 'mcpServers'.
3. Use the 'add-note' tool to add new notes with 'name' and 'content' parameters.
4. Use the 'summarize-notes' prompt with an optional 'style' argument (brief/detailed) to generate summaries of all stored notes.
5. For development, clone the repository and run the server locally using the provided configuration.

serper.name: Serper Search and Scrape MCP Server
serper.description: An MCP server providing web search and webpage scraping capabilities using Serper API, integrating with Claude Desktop.
serper.usageInstructions:
1. Set SERPER_API_KEY environment variable with your Serper API key.
2. Configure the server in Claude Desktop by adding the server config to claude_desktop_config.json.
3. For other clients like Cline and Cursor, follow their respective configuration instructions.

podman.name: Podman MCP Server
podman.description: A powerful and flexible MCP server for container runtimes supporting Podman and Docker.
podman.usageInstructions: To use the Podman MCP server, configure it in your application or IDE by specifying the command as `npx podman-mcp-server@latest` or run it directly using the installed binary. For advanced configuration, use the `--sse-port` flag to specify a custom port for Server-Sent Events.

freeagent.name: FreeAgent MCP Server
freeagent.description: A Claude MCP server for managing FreeAgent timeslips and timers, allowing Claude to interact with your FreeAgent account to track time, manage timers, and handle timeslip operations.
freeagent.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/markpitt/freeagent-mcp.git && cd freeagent-mcp && npm install
freeagent.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies using the install command. 2. Set your FreeAgent OAuth credentials as environment variables. 3. Add the server to your MCP settings with the provided JSON configuration. 4. Use the server to manage timeslips and timers via the specified JSON commands.

verge-news.name: The Verge News MCP Server
verge-news.description: An MCP server that provides tools to fetch and search news from The Verge's RSS feed.
verge-news.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/manimohans/verge-news-mcp.git && cd verge-news-mcp && npm install && npm run build
verge-news.usageInstructions: 1. Run the server using 'npm start'. 2. Configure Claude for Desktop by adding the server configuration to claude_desktop_config.json. 3. Alternatively, use with Smithery by running 'smithery use https://github.com/manimohans/verge-news-mcp'.

together.name: Image Generation MCP Server
together.description: An MCP server for generating high-quality images using the Flux.1 Schnell model via Together AI.
together.usageInstructions: 1. Install using 'npm install together-mcp'. 2. Configure MCP server with TOGETHER_API_KEY. 3. Use 'generate_image' tool with required 'prompt' parameter.

farcaster.name: Farcaster MCP Server
farcaster.description: An MCP server that provides tools to interact with the Farcaster network, allowing AI models to fetch casts, search channels, and analyze content.
farcaster.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/manimohans/farcaster-mcp.git && cd farcaster-mcp && npm install && npm run build
farcaster.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies using the install command. 2. Run the server with 'npm start'. 3. For integration with Claude for Desktop, add the server configuration to the 'claude_desktop_config.json' file. 4. Use the available tools 'get-user-casts', 'get-username-casts', and 'get-channel-casts' with appropriate parameters to fetch Farcaster data.

n8n-workflow-builder.name: n8n Workflow Builder MCP Server
n8n-workflow-builder.description: An MCP server for managing n8n workflows, providing tools to list, create, update, delete, activate, and deactivate workflows.
n8n-workflow-builder.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/makafeli/n8n-workflow-builder.git && cd n8n-workflow-builder && npm install
n8n-workflow-builder.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and navigate to the project directory. 2. Install dependencies using 'npm install'. 3. Build the project with 'npm run build'. 4. Start the server using 'npm start'. 5. Configure the 'cline_mcp_settings.json' file with the required environment variables (N8N_HOST and N8N_API_KEY). 6. Use the provided tools and resources to manage workflows and executions.

elevenlabs.name: ElevenLabs MCP Server
elevenlabs.description: An MCP server integrating ElevenLabs text-to-speech API with features for audio generation, voice management, and history tracking.
elevenlabs.usageInstructions:
1. Configure MCP settings in cline_mcp_settings.json
2. Set required environment variables: ELEVENLABS_API_KEY and ELEVENLABS_VOICE_ID
3. For development: clone repository, create .env file with credentials, and run with uv

everything-search.name: Everything Search MCP Server
everything-search.description: An MCP server that provides fast file searching capabilities across Windows, macOS, and Linux using platform-specific tools like Everything SDK, mdfind, and locate.
everything-search.usageInstructions: 1. Install the required platform-specific prerequisites (Everything SDK on Windows, locate/plocate on Linux, or mdfind on macOS). 2. Set the EVERYTHING_SDK_PATH environment variable on Windows to the path of the Everything64.dll file. 3. Run the server using the command specified in your claude_desktop_config.json. 4. Use the 'search' tool with query parameters to search for files and folders.

ayd.name: MCP Ayd Server
ayd.description: MCP server for Ayd, enabling integration with AI assistants like Claude Desktop.
ayd.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/macrat/mcp-ayd-server && cd mcp-ayd-server && go build
ayd.usageInstructions: 1. Download the latest binary from the release page. 2. Configure your client's configuration file with the command path and arguments. 3. Run the client app and interact with the assistant.

ragrabbit.name: RagRabbit MCP Server
ragrabbit.description: Self-hosted AI search and MCP server for documentation retrieval using semantic search
ragrabbit.installCommand: npx @ragrabbit/mcp http://<RagRabbit install>/ <name of your documentation>
ragrabbit.usageInstructions: 1. Deploy on Vercel with required environment variables. 2. Configure Claude Desktop or Cursor IDE to use the MCP server with 'npx @ragrabbit/mcp'. 3. Use the chat widget or search input in your application.

searxng.name: SearXNG MCP Server
searxng.description: An MCP server for SearXNG, enabling AI assistants to search the web through SearXNG instances.
searxng.installCommand: uv sync && uv run server.py --url https://searxng.example.com
searxng.usageInstructions: 1. Install using 'uv sync'. 2. Run with 'uv run server.py --url <your-searxng-url>'. 3. Configure in MCP using the provided JSON configuration. Alternatively, use Docker: 'docker build -t searxng-mcp-server . && docker run -p8080:8080 searxng-mcp-server'

fathom-analytics.name: MCP Fathom Analytics
fathom-analytics.description: An MCP server for accessing Fathom Analytics data through an AI assistant
fathom-analytics.usageInstructions: Configure in Claude Desktop using JSON config with FATHOM_API_KEY environment variable

websearch-tools.name: WebSearch
websearch-tools.description: A powerful web search and content extraction tool built with Python, leveraging the Firecrawl API for advanced web scraping, searching, and content analysis capabilities.
websearch-tools.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/m4s1t4/webSearch-Tools && cd webSearch-Tools && uv venv && uv sync
websearch-tools.usageInstructions: 1. Install uv and set up a virtual environment. 2. Clone the repository and install dependencies. 3. Create a .env file with your API keys. 4. Configure the server for use with Claude for Desktop by adding the 'websearch' server configuration to the 'mcpServers' section in the configuration file. 5. Restart Claude for Desktop to access the WebSearch tools. Available tools include Search, Extract Information, Crawl Websites, and Scrape Content.

yapi.name: Yapi Auto MCP Server
yapi.description: Model Context Protocol  YApi  MCP  AI  YApi
yapi.usageInstructions:
1.  YApi Token 
2.  MCP  AI  Cursor MCP  npx 
3.  AI  YApi

claude-repl.name: Claude REPL Server
claude-repl.description: A Python-based REPL server enhancing Claude with Python execution, shell commands, and file manipulation capabilities.
claude-repl.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/lyuhau/claude-mcp-repl.git && cd claude-mcp-repl && poetry install
claude-repl.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies using 'poetry install' or 'uv pip install -r pyproject.toml'. 2. Configure Claude Desktop by adding the MCP server configuration to the config file located at %APPDATA%/Roaming/Claude/claude_desktop_config.json (Windows) or respective OS-specific path. 3. Start using the REPL server with Python, shell commands, and file manipulation tools.

brightdata.name: Bright Data MCP
brightdata.description: Enables LLMs, agents, and apps to access, discover, and extract real-time web data seamlessly, with features like web unlocking and browser automation.
brightdata.usageInstructions: 1. Install Node.js and ensure `npx` is available. 2. Set the `API_TOKEN` environment variable with your Bright Data API token. 3. Optionally configure `WEB_UNLOCKER_ZONE`, `BROWSER_ZONE`, and `RATE_LIMIT` for advanced settings. 4. Run `npx @brightdata/mcp` to start the server.

voice-call.name: Voice Call MCP Server
voice-call.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables AI assistants like Claude to initiate and manage voice calls using Twilio and OpenAI's GPT-4o Realtime model.
voice-call.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/lukaskai/voice-call-mcp-server.git && cd voice-call-mcp-server && npm install && npm run build
voice-call.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies. 2. Set required environment variables (Twilio credentials, OpenAI API key, ngrok authtoken). 3. Configure Claude Desktop with the MCP server command and environment variables. 4. Use Claude to initiate voice calls by specifying phone numbers and conversation context. Ensure all phone numbers are in E.164 format and be mindful of Twilio and OpenAI rate limits.

mitmproxy.name: mitmproxy-mcp
mitmproxy.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that implements a simple note storage system with custom URI scheme, prompts for summarizing notes, and a tool for adding new notes.
mitmproxy.usageInstructions: 1. Install using the provided install command. 2. Configure the server in the Claude Desktop configuration file under 'mcpServers'. 3. Use the 'add-note' tool to add notes with 'name' and 'content' arguments. 4. Use the 'summarize-notes' prompt with an optional 'style' argument for note summaries. 5. Debug using the MCP Inspector with the command: npx @modelcontextprotocol/inspector uv --directory [project-path] run mitmproxy-mcp.

digitalocean.name: MCP DigitalOcean Server
digitalocean.description: A Model Context Protocol implementation that integrates with DigitalOcean for server management.
digitalocean.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/luc-io/mcp-digitalocean-server && cd mcp-digitalocean-server && pip install -r requirements.txt
digitalocean.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and navigate into the directory. 2. Copy `.env.example` to `.env` and fill in your DigitalOcean API token. 3. Install dependencies using `pip install -r requirements.txt`. 4. Run the server with `python src/server.py`. Ensure the required environment variables are set in the `.env` file.

ddgs.name: MCP DuckDuckGo Search Server
ddgs.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables searching via DuckDuckGo, based on Open-WebUI's built-in Web Search feature and using Server-Sent Events (SSE) for transport.
ddgs.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/lowlyocean/mcp-ddgs && cd mcp-ddgs && pip install -r requirements.txt
ddgs.usageInstructions: After installation, set the DDGS_API_KEY environment variable with your DuckDuckGo API key. Start the server using the provided script. By default, it runs on localhost at port 8000. You can customize the host and port using the HOST and PORT environment variables.

wecom-bot.name: WeCom Bot MCP Server
wecom-bot.description: An MCP-compliant server for sending messages to WeCom (WeChat Work) groups via bot integrations, supporting text, markdown, images, and files.
wecom-bot.usageInstructions: 1. Install the package using pip. 2. Set the WECOM_WEBHOOK_URL environment variable with your WeCom bot webhook URL. 3. Run the server using 'wecom-bot-mcp-server'. 4. Use the provided Python API to send messages, files, or images to WeCom groups. Optional: configure logging with MCP_LOG_LEVEL and MCP_LOG_FILE.

vikunja.name: Vikunja MCP Server
vikunja.description: Simple Model Context Protocol server for setting Vikunja reminders
vikunja.usageInstructions: Create a .env file with required environment variables (VIKUNJA_API_TOKEN, VIKUNJA_API_URL). Configure PORT and LOG_LEVEL if needed. Run the server using the installation command's resulting CLI tool

lumbretravel.name: LumbreTravel MCP Server
lumbretravel.description: An MCP server providing access to LumbreTravel API for managing travel programs and activities.
lumbretravel.usageInstructions: 1. Get LumbreTravel Client ID and Client Secret from https://developers.mercadolibre.com/. 2. Configure Claude Desktop with the MCP server details. 3. For local installation: clone the repository, run 'npm install', and 'npm run build'.

kube.name: Kubernetes MCP Server
kube.description: An MCP server that integrates with Kubernetes using Minikube and interacts with Codename Goose AI agent
kube.usageInstructions:
1. Get a Gemini API Key from https://aistudio.google.com/
2. Install Codename Goose and configure it using `goose configure`
3. Clone this repository and test using `mcp dev server.py`
4. Install Minikube and configure cluster access
5. Start a Goose session with `goose session --with-builtin developer --with-extension "uvx kube-mcp"`

stocks.name: YFinance Trader MCP Tool
stocks.description: An MCP tool providing stock market data and trading capabilities using yfinance library.
stocks.usageInstructions: 1. Ensure Python3.10+ is installed. 2. Clone the repository and install dependencies using 'pip install -r requirements.txt' or 'pip install .'. 3. In Cursor, go to Settings > MCP, add new server with command 'python3 /path/to/yfinance-trader/main.py'.

devdocs.name: DevDocs MCP Implementation
devdocs.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) implementation for documentation management and integration, providing a structured framework for documentation processing, resource templates, and testing.
devdocs.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/llmian-space/devdocs-mcp && cd devdocs-mcp && pip install -r src/requirements.txt
devdocs.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and install dependencies using pip install -r src/requirements.txt.
2. Run tests with pytest tests/property/test_templates.py.
3. Implement new features following the TDD approach and update documentation accordingly.
4. Use the resource template system for URI-based documentation access and parameter validation.

arango.name: ArangoDB MCP Server
arango.description: An implementation of the Model Context Protocol for ArangoDB, enabling interaction with ArangoDB databases through MCP tools and resources.

simple-files-vectorstore.name: Simple Files Vectorstore
simple-files-vectorstore.description: An MCP server that provides semantic search capabilities across files by creating vector embeddings of file contents and watching specified directories.
simple-files-vectorstore.usageInstructions: Add the server to your MCP settings file with the command 'npx -y @lishenxydlgzs/simple-files-vectorstore' and specify the directories to watch using WATCH_DIRECTORIES or WATCH_CONFIG_FILE. Optional parameters like CHUNK_SIZE, CHUNK_OVERLAP, and IGNORE_FILE can be configured for customization.

git-tools.name: MCP Git Tools
git-tools.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides Git operations as tools, including status, branches, commit history, and more.
git-tools.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/lileeei/mcp-git-tools.git && cd mcp-git-tools && cargo build
git-tools.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and build it using `cargo build`. 2. Run the server with `cargo run --bin mcp-git-server`. 3.
