Use the provided Rust client code to call Git tools via the MCP protocol. 4. Integrate into your own MCP server by registering the Git tools using `register_git_tools`.

emotion.name: mcp-emotions
emotion.description: A JavaScript-based MCP server project for emotion-related functionality, built using Bun runtime.
emotion.usageInstructions: After installing dependencies with 'bun install', run the server using 'bun run index.ts'. This project was initialized with Bun v1.2.4 and requires the Bun runtime to execute.

bluesky-context.name: Bluesky Context Server
bluesky-context.description: A simple MCP server that enables MCP clients to query Bluesky instances for context.
bluesky-context.usageInstructions:
1. Install the server using the provided command or manually place the code on your system.
2. Configure the Claude Desktop app to use the server by editing the config.json file with the correct command path and environment variables.
3. Set the required environment variables: BLUESKY_APP_KEY and BLUESKY_IDENTIFIER.

playwright-cdp.name: MCP Playwright CDP
playwright-cdp.description: A Model Context Protocol server that provides browser automation capabilities using Playwright with Chrome DevTools Protocol (CDP) support, enabling LLMs to interact with web pages, take screenshots, and execute JavaScript in a real browser environment.
playwright-cdp.usageInstructions: 1. Install via the provided command. 2. Configure your Claude Desktop with the server command and path. 3. Launch Chrome with remote debugging enabled using `--remote-debugging-port=9222`. 4. The server will connect to the running Chrome instance or launch a new one. 5. Use the server to automate browser interactions, take screenshots, and execute JavaScript.

liveblocks.name: Liveblocks MCP Server
liveblocks.description: MCP server allowing AI to interact with Liveblocks REST API for managing rooms, threads, comments, and more.
liveblocks.usageInstructions: 1. Get your Liveblocks secret key from https://liveblocks.io/dashboard. 2. Run installation command with your secret key. 3. Configure client settings (Cursor, Claude Desktop, or VS Code) by adding server details with your secret key.

rust-docs.name: Rust Docs MCP Server
rust-docs.description: An MCP server providing access to Rust documentation from docs.rs for AI tools.
rust-docs.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/laptou/rust-docs-mcp-server.git && cd rust-docs-mcp-server && bun install && bun run build
rust-docs.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and cd into it. 2. Run 'bun install' to install dependencies. 3. Run 'bun run build' to build the server. 4. Run 'bun run start' to start the server. Configure an MCP client to connect to this server.

last9.name: Last9 MCP Server
last9.description: An MCP server implementation for Last9 that enables AI agents to access real-time production context.
last9.usageInstructions: Configure the MCP server with required environment variables (LAST9_BASE_URL, LAST9_AUTH_TOKEN, LAST9_REFRESH_TOKEN) and integrate with supported IDEs (Claude, Cursor, Windsurf, VS Code) by modifying their respective configuration files.

ssh-tools.name: SSH Tools MCP
ssh-tools.description: An MCP server for SSH tools that allows connecting to remote servers and executing commands.
ssh-tools.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/lightfate/ssh-tools-mcp && cd ssh-tools-mcp && pip install -r requirements.txt && python ssh_server.py
ssh-tools.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and install dependencies.
2. Run the server using 'python ssh_server.py'.
3. Use the provided tools: connect_ssh, run_command, disconnect_ssh.
Ensure the target server allows SSH password authentication.

xcode-diagnostics.name: Xcode Diagnostics MCP Plugin
xcode-diagnostics.description: An MCP plugin for extracting and viewing errors and warnings from Xcode build logs, providing diagnostics functionality to AI assistants.
xcode-diagnostics.usageInstructions: After installation, use the plugin with any MCP-compatible client. The plugin requires macOS, Xcode installed, and Python 3.6+. It lists Xcode projects with build logs and extracts diagnostics from the latest build log.

telegram.name: Telegram MCP Server
telegram.description: An MCP server providing Telegram integration for sending messages and secure chat ID validation.
telegram.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/lane83/mcp-telegram.git && cd mcp-telegram && npm install && npm run build
telegram.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and follow setup instructions in userInstructions/telegram_server_setup.md
2. Configure your Telegram bot token and chat ID
3. Run: npm start

langfuse.name: Langfuse Prompt Management MCP Server
langfuse.description: MCP server for Langfuse Prompt Management, enabling access and management of Langfuse prompts through the Model Context Protocol.
langfuse.usageInstructions: 1. Install dependencies with `npm install`. 2. Build the server with `npm run build`. 3. Add the server to your MCP clients (e.g., Claude Desktop or Cursor) by specifying the command `node build/index.js` with the required environment variables: LANGFUSE_PUBLIC_KEY, LANGFUSE_SECRET_KEY, and LANGFUSE_BASEURL. 4. Use the MCP server to list and retrieve Langfuse prompts via the MCP Prompts specification.

client-configuration.name: MCP Client Configuration Server
client-configuration.description: Manages configurations for different MCP clients by retrieving, listing, adding, and removing server configurations from client configuration files.
client-configuration.usageInstructions:
1. Install the server using 'npm install -g @landicefu/mcp-client-configuration-server'.
2. Add it to your MCP settings configuration as shown in the README.
3. Use the provided tools (get_configuration_path, get_configuration, list_servers, get_server_configuration, add_server_configuration, remove_server_configuration) to manage server configurations.
4. Example: Copy an MCP server configuration from one client to another by retrieving and adding the configuration with the same settings.

divide-and-conquer.name: Divide and Conquer MCP Server
divide-and-conquer.description: An MCP server that enables AI agents to break down complex tasks into manageable pieces using a structured JSON format for task tracking and context preservation.
divide-and-conquer.usageInstructions: 1. Add the server to your MCP configuration using the provided JSON format. 2. Initialize a new task with `initialize_task` and add checklist items using `add_checklist_item`. 3. Use tools like `get_checklist_summary` and `get_current_task_details` to monitor progress and retrieve task details. 4. For local development, clone the repository, install dependencies, and build the server.

comfy.name: Comfy MCP Server
comfy.description: A server using FastMCP framework to generate images based on prompts via a remote Comfy server.
comfy.usageInstructions:
1. Set required environment variables: COMFY_URL, COMFY_WORKFLOW_JSON_FILE, PROMPT_NODE_ID, OUTPUT_NODE_ID, and OUTPUT_MODE.
2. Optionally set OLLAMA_API_BASE and PROMPT_LLM if using Ollama for prompt generation.
3. Run the server using: uvx comfy-mcp-server
4. Use the generate_image function to create images from prompts or generate_prompt to create prompts from topics.

cryptopanic.name: cryptopanic-mcp-server
cryptopanic.description: Provides the latest cryptocurrency news to AI agents using the CryptoPanic API.
cryptopanic.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/kukapay/cryptopanic-mcp-server && cd cryptopanic-mcp-server && uv pip install -r requirements.txt
cryptopanic.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies. 2. Obtain a CryptoPanic API plan and key from https://cryptopanic.com/developers/api/. 3. Add the server entry to your configuration file with the correct API credentials and server path. 4. Run the server using the provided command in the configuration.

paypal-java.name: PayPal Java MCP Server
paypal-java.description: A Java implementation of a PayPal MCP (Merchant Capability Platform) server that provides tools for analyzing and improving payment processing.
paypal-java.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and navigate to the project directory.
2. Build the application using `mvn clean package`.
3. Run the server in web mode with `java -jar target/paypal-java-mcp-server-0.0.1-SNAPSHOT.jar`.
4. For JSON-RPC over stdio mode, use `java -Dspring.profiles.active=stdio -Dspring.main.web-application-type=NONE -Djsonrpc.stdio.interactive=true -jar target/paypal-java-mcp-server-0.0.1-SNAPSHOT-stdio.jar`.
5. Use the provided `test-stdio.sh` script to test the stdio interface.
6. For non-interactive environments, use the `start-non-interactive.sh` script.
7. For Docker deployment, run `./run-docker.sh`.
8. Configure the server using `application.properties` for settings like server port and logging levels.

ephor.name: LLM Responses MCP Server
ephor.description: An MCP server that allows multiple AI agents to share and read each other's responses to the same prompt.
ephor.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/kstrikis/ephor-mcp && cd ephor-mcp && bun install
ephor.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and install dependencies using 'bun install'.
2. Build the TypeScript code with 'bun run build'.
3. Start the server in development mode with 'bun run dev'.
4. Use the 'submit-response' and 'get-responses' tools to interact with the server.
5. For deployment, run the 'deploy.sh' script on an EC2 instance or use Docker with 'docker-compose up -d'.

duckdb.name: MCP Server for DuckDB
duckdb.description: An MCP server implementation for interacting with DuckDB databases, enabling database operations like querying and schema inspection.
duckdb.usageInstructions: To use this server, first install it using 'uvx mcp-server-duckdb'. Then configure it in Claude Desktop's configuration file with the db-path parameter. For example: 'uvx mcp-server-duckdb --db-path ~/mcp-server-duckdb/data/data.db'. The --readonly flag can be used to prevent write operations.

file-finder.name: File Finder MCP Server
file-finder.description: A Python-based MCP server that integrates with Cline in VSCode to search files in the file system.
file-finder.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/kyan9400/file-finder-mcp.git && cd file-finder-mcp && pip install mcp
file-finder.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install the mcp package. 2. Configure Cline by editing cline_config.json. 3. Run the server manually using 'python file_finder_server.py' or let Cline start it automatically. Requires Python3.9+, mcp package, and VSCode with Cline extension.

whale-tracker.name: Whale Tracker MCP Server
whale-tracker.description: An MCP server for tracking cryptocurrency whale transactions using the Whale Alert API.
whale-tracker.usageInstructions: 1. Install via Smithery or clone the repository and install dependencies using 'uv add "mcp[cli]" httpx python-dotenv' or 'pip install mcp httpx python-dotenv'. 2. Create a .env file with WHALE_ALERT_API_KEY. 3. Run 'mcp dev whale_tracker.py --with-editable .' for development or 'mcp install whale_tracker.py --name "WhaleTracker" -f .env' for Claude Desktop integration.

devrev.name: DevRev MCP Server
devrev.description: A Model Context Protocol server for DevRev that enables searching and retrieving information using the DevRev APIs.
devrev.usageInstructions:
1. Create a DevRev account at https://app.devrev.ai/signup.
2. Import data from sources like Salesforce or Zendesk.
3. Generate an API access token from https://developer.devrev.ai/public/about/authentication#personal-access-token-usage.
4. Set the DEVREV_API_KEY environment variable with your access token.
5. Configure the server in the Claude Desktop app by adding the MCP server configuration as shown in the README.

discord-chat.name: mcp-discord-chat
discord-chat.description: An MCP server that implements a note storage system with a custom note:// URI scheme, a 'summarize-notes' prompt, and an 'add-note' tool for managing notes.
discord-chat.usageInstructions:
1. Install the server using `uvx mcp-discord-chat`.
2. Configure the server in Claude Desktop by adding the `mcpServers` configuration with the appropriate command and arguments.
3. Use the 'add-note' tool to add new notes with 'name' and 'content' parameters.
4. Use the 'summarize-notes' prompt with an optional 'style' argument (brief/detailed) to generate summaries.
5. For debugging, use the MCP Inspector with the command: `npx @modelcontextprotocol/inspector uv --directory /Users/speakeasy-projects/mcp-discord-chat run mcp-discord-chat`.

ynab.name: MCP YNAB Server
ynab.description: An MCP server implementation that provides access to YNAB (You Need A Budget) functionality through the Model Context Protocol, allowing users to view account balances, create transactions, and access YNAB data.
ynab.usageInstructions:
1. Obtain a YNAB API key from your YNAB Developer Settings and set it as an environment variable (e.g., `YNAB_API_KEY=your_api_key`).
2. Run the server in development mode with `task dev` or install for production with `task install`.
3. Use the provided tools and resources to interact with YNAB data, such as `ynab://accounts` for listing accounts or `create_transaction` for creating new transactions.

remote.name: MCP Remote Server
remote.description: Node.js implementation of MCP server providing React Native coding standards and examples
remote.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/lallen30/mcp-remote-server.git && cd mcp-remote-server && npm install && npm run build
remote.usageInstructions: Start the server with 'npm start'. Configure MCP clients like Windsurf IDE by updating mcp_config.json with the server command and args.

anthropic-code-analyzer.name: Anthropic MCP Code Analyzer
anthropic-code-analyzer.description: MCP server that analyzes open source projects and generates intelligent merge strategies using Claude
anthropic-code-analyzer.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/kivo360/anthropic-mcp-code-analyzer.git && cd anthropic-mcp-code-analyzer && npm install
anthropic-code-analyzer.usageInstructions:
1. Start the server: npm start
2. Analyze repositories using: curl -X POST http://localhost:3000/analyze -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"sourceRepo": "https://github.com/user/source-repo.git", "targetRepo": "https://github.com/user/target-repo.git"}'

kibela.name: Kibela MCP Server
kibela.description: MCP server implementation for Kibela API integration, enabling LLMs to interact with Kibela content
kibela.usageInstructions:
1. Set KIBELA_TEAM and KIBELA_TOKEN environment variables with your Kibela credentials
2. Add the server configuration to your ~/.cursor/mcp.json file
3. Use the available tools like kibela_search_notes, kibela_get_my_notes, etc. to interact with Kibela content
4. For Docker usage, build the image with 'docker build -t mcp-kibela-server .' and configure accordingly

shopify-py.name: Shopify Python MCP Server
shopify-py.usageInstructions:
1.  `SHOPIFY_SHOP_URL`, `SHOPIFY_API_KEY`, `SHOPIFY_API_PASSWORD` 
2. `uv sync --dev --all-extras` 
3. Claude DesktopMCP
4.  `npx @modelcontextprotocol/inspector uv --directory [path] run shopify-py-mcp`

book-fetch.name: Book Fetch MCP
book-fetch.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that allows users to interact with any published book directly within Claude or other MCP clients.
book-fetch.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/kinshukk/book-fetch-mcp && cd book-fetch-mcp && uv pip install -r requirements.txt
book-fetch.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and navigate to the project directory. 2. Install dependencies using uv. 3. Add the server configuration to your `claude_desktop_config.json` as specified in the README. 4. Run the server using the provided command in the configuration.

weather.name: Weather MCP Server
weather.description: An MCP server that provides weather data integration
weather.usageInstructions:
1. Set WEATHER_API_KEY environment variable
2. Run 'weather-mcp-server' command
3. Configure PORT if needed (default: 8080)

for-sensor-device.name: MCP Server for sensor device
for-sensor-device.description: A Node.js MCP server that simulates a CO2 sensor device and interacts with Raspberry Pi Pico via USB.
for-sensor-device.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/kmwebnet/MCP-Server-for-sensor-device.git && cd MCP-Server-for-sensor-device && npm install
for-sensor-device.usageInstructions: 1. Configure claude_desktop_config.json correctly. 2. Run 'node index.js' to start the server. Ensure Node.js is installed and dependencies are installed via 'npm install'.

mongo.name: MCP MongoDB Server
mongo.description: A Model Context Protocol server that enables LLMs to interact with MongoDB databases, providing capabilities for inspecting collection schemas and executing MongoDB operations through a standardized interface.
mongo.usageInstructions: Start the server by providing a MongoDB connection URI. Use environment variables for configuration, especially for CI/CD pipelines or Docker. For read-only mode, set MCP_MONGODB_READONLY to 'true' or use the --read-only flag. Integration with tools like Claude Desktop, Windsurf, and Cursor is supported via configuration files.

mysql-java.name: MySQL MCP Server
mysql-java.description: Spring Boot server implementing Model Context Protocol (MCP) for MySQL database operations, allowing query execution, table listing, and schema retrieval.
mysql-java.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/kioyong/mysql-mcp-server-java.git && cd mysql-mcp-server-java && mvn install
mysql-java.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and build using Maven. 2. Configure the MCP server config file with the correct Java command and environment variables. 3. Set SPRING_DATASOURCE_URL environment variable with your MySQL connection string.

trinity.name: Trinity-MCP Server
trinity.description: An MCP server implementation providing JSON-RPC interface for various tools and capabilities
trinity.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository: git clone https://github.com/kklab-com/trinity-mcp
2. Navigate to the directory: cd trinity-mcp
3. Start the server with a token: ./trinity-mcp -t <your_token>
4. Use JSON-RPC methods like initialize, tools/list, and tools/call

yt-dlp.name: yt-dlp-mcp
yt-dlp.description: An MCP server that integrates with yt-dlp to provide video, audio, and subtitle download capabilities for LLMs.
yt-dlp.usageInstructions:
1. Install yt-dlp for your OS (Windows: winget install yt-dlp, macOS: brew install yt-dlp, Linux: pip install yt-dlp).
2. Add the server to Dive Desktop using the provided JSON configuration.
3. Use the server to download videos, audio, subtitles, or transcripts by providing video URLs and optional parameters like resolution or language.
4. For manual use, run 'npx @kevinwatt/yt-dlp-mcp'.

webhook.name: MCP Webhook Server
webhook.description: An MCP server implementation that integrates with webhooks, providing message sending capabilities.
webhook.usageInstructions: 1. Install via Smithery using the provided command. 2. Configure in Dive Desktop by adding MCP Server with the given JSON configuration. 3. Set WEBHOOK_URL environment variable. 4. Use LLM commands like 'Send a message to webhook: Hello World!'

choose.name: Choose MCP Server
choose.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for integrating with Google Cloud and dbt, allowing users to query datasets and models via the Claude Desktop Client.
choose.usageInstructions:
1. Download and install the Claude Desktop Client from https://claude.ai/download.
2. Install uv via Homebrew with `brew install uv`.
3. Install the MCP server using `uvx choose-mcp-server`.
4. Edit the `claude_desktop_config.json` file in `~/Library/Application Support/Claude` to include the MCP server configuration with the required environment variables.
5. Log into Google Cloud with `gcloud auth login --update-adc`.
6. Open Claude Desktop and start asking questions.

applemusic.name: MCP-AppleMusic
applemusic.description: A FastMCP server implementation for controlling Apple Music (formerly iTunes) on macOS through AppleScript commands.
applemusic.usageInstructions:
1. Ensure Python 3.13+ is installed.
2. Install Apple Music on macOS.
3. Add the server configuration to `claude_desktop_config.json` as described in the README.
4. Start the server using `python server.py`.
5. Use the provided commands like `itunes_play()`, `itunes_pause()`, etc., to interact with Apple Music.

gmail-gas.name: MCP Gmail Server
gmail-gas.description: Model Context Protocol server for Gmail integration via Google Apps Script, enabling MCP clients like Claude Desktop to interact with Gmail accounts.
gmail-gas.usageInstructions: 1. Deploy the Google Apps Script with the provided `code.gs` file and obtain the deployment URL. 2. Generate a random API key for security. 3. Configure Claude Desktop by adding the `GAS_ENDPOINT` and `VALID_API_KEY` environment variables to its configuration file. 4. Use available tools like `gmail_search_messages`, `gmail_get_message`, and `gmail_download_attachment` to interact with Gmail.

docs-rag.name: mcp-docs-rag
docs-rag.description: A TypeScript-based MCP server implementing a RAG system for querying documents stored in a local directory, including Git repositories and text files, using Google's Gemini API for indexing and querying.
docs-rag.usageInstructions: 1. Set the GEMINI_API_KEY environment variable with your Google Gemini API key. 2. Set the DOCS_PATH environment variable to the directory where documents will be stored. 3. Add the server configuration to your Claude Desktop config file as shown in the README. 4. Use Claude to add documents (GitHub repos or text files) and query them using RAG.

backlog.name: mcp-backlog-server
backlog.description: This is a TypeScript-based server that integrates Backlog with the Model Context Protocol (MCP), providing access to Backlog projects, issues, and wiki pages through MCP resources, tools, and prompts.
backlog.usageInstructions:
1. Install dependencies using 'npm install'.
2. Set the required environment variables BACKLOG_API_KEY and BACKLOG_SPACE_URL.
3. Build the server with 'npm run build' or use 'npm run watch' for development with auto-rebuild.
4. Add the server configuration to Claude Desktop's config file as specified in the '' section.
5. Use MCP tools and prompts to access Backlog projects, issues, and wiki pages.

taskmanager.name: MCP TaskManager
taskmanager.description: Model Context Protocol server for task management, allowing Claude Desktop to manage and execute tasks in a queue-based system.
taskmanager.usageInstructions: 1. Install Node.js18+ and Claude Desktop. 2. Configure Claude Desktop by adding the MCP TaskManager to the configuration file at ~/Library/Application Support/Claude/claude_desktop_config.json. 3. Use the TaskManager with actions: plan, execute, or complete.

github-pera1.name: GitHub MCP Server for Pera1
github-pera1.description: An MCP server connecting GitHub code to Claude.ai using Pera1 service
github-pera1.usageInstructions: Add the server to your MCP config file at ~/Library/Application Support/Claude/claude_desktop_config.json with 'npx' command and '-y @kazuph/mcp-github-pera1' args, then ask Claude about GitHub repositories using supported parameters

cairo-coder.name: Cairo Coder MCP Server
cairo-coder.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Cairo and Starknet development assistance via the Cairo Coder API.
cairo-coder.usageInstructions:
1. Install using the command: npx -y @kasarlabs/cairo-coder-mcp.
2. Set the required environment variable CAIRO_CODER_API_KEY with your API key.
3. Optionally, use CAIRO_CODER_API_ENDPOINT to connect to a local or custom Cairo Coder API endpoint.
4. Use the MCP client to interact with the server by sending JSON requests with queries and optional context.

hoverfly.name: Hoverfly MCP Server
hoverfly.description: A Spring Boot-based Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that exposes Hoverfly as a programmable tool for AI assistants, enabling dynamic mocking of third-party APIs for development and testing.
hoverfly.usageInstructions:
1. Ensure Docker is installed and running.
2. Mount a volume at /path/to/your/data for simulation persistence.
3. Run the Docker command to start the server.
4. Add the server configuration to your .mcp.json or mcp.config.json file as shown in the README.
5. Use the exposed MCP tools to manage Hoverfly simulations and mocks.

fred.name: FRED MCP Server
fred.description: An MCP server implementation for accessing Federal Reserve Economic Data (FRED) API, providing tools to search and retrieve economic data series.
fred.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/kablewy/fred-mcp-server && cd fred-mcp-server && npm install
fred.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and install dependencies.
2. Copy `.env.example` to `.env` and add your FRED API key.
3. For development: `npm run dev`.
4. For production: `npm run build && npm start`.

splunk.name: Splunk MCP Tool
splunk.description: A FastMCP-based tool for interacting with Splunk Enterprise/Cloud through natural language, providing search, index management, user management, and KV store operations.
splunk.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/livehybrid/splunk-mcp.git && cd splunk-mcp && poetry install
splunk.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies with Poetry. 2. Copy and configure the .env file with your Splunk credentials. 3. Run the server in SSE mode (default), API mode, or STDIO mode using the appropriate command. For Docker usage, pull the image and run with environment variables configured.

azuredevops-bridge.name: MCP Azure DevOps Bridge
azuredevops-bridge.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) integration server for Azure DevOps, enabling work item management, wiki documentation, sprint planning, and handling attachments and discussions.
azuredevops-bridge.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/krishh-amilineni/mcp-azuredevops-bridge.git && cd mcp-azuredevops-bridge && go build
azuredevops-bridge.usageInstructions: 1. Install Go 1.23 or later. 2. Clone the repository and build the project. 3. Set the required environment variables: AZURE_DEVOPS_ORG, AZDO_PAT, and AZURE_DEVOPS_PROJECT. 4. Add the server to your Windsurf/Cursor configuration with the full path to the binary and the required environment variables. 5. Use the server to manage work items, wiki pages, sprints, and attachments in Azure DevOps.

coder-toolbox.name: Coder Toolbox MCP Server
coder-toolbox.description: A utility toolkit for enhancing interaction between Claude and code, providing tools for code analysis, manipulation, and testing workflows.
coder-toolbox.usageInstructions: After installation, configure the server by setting any desired optional parameters. Start the server and use the provided API endpoints for various code manipulation tasks.

imcp.name: iMCP
imcp.description: A macOS app that connects personal data with AI through Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers.
imcp.usageInstructions: 1. Download and install iMCP using the provided command. 2. Open the app and activate required services through the menu bar icon. 3. Configure Claude Desktop by going to Settings > Developer > Edit Config. 4. Connect iMCP to Claude Desktop through the app menu or manual configuration. 5. Approve the connection when prompted in Claude Desktop.

generate-pr.name: Generate PR MCP
generate-pr.description: A Model Context Protocol server that automatically generates detailed Pull Request descriptions from code changes.
generate-pr.usageInstructions: Run 'mcp-server' if installed globally, or 'npx generate-pr-mcp' to use with npx. The tool must be run in a git repository directory.

youtube-transcript.name: YouTube Transcript Server
youtube-transcript.description: A Model Context Protocol server that enables retrieval of transcripts from YouTube videos through a simple interface.
youtube-transcript.usageInstructions: To use the server, call the `get_transcript` tool with a YouTube video URL or video ID. Optionally specify a language code (e.g., 'en', 'ko'). Example: `await server.callTool('get_transcript', { url: 'https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VIDEO_ID', lang: 'en' });`.

mamp-mysql.name: MySQL MCP Server
mamp-mysql.description: An MCP server providing MySQL database access functionality with features like listing database tables and executing read-only SQL queries.
mamp-mysql.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/kerongon/mcp-server-mamp-mysql && cd mcp-server-mamp-mysql && npm install && npm run build
mamp-mysql.usageInstructions: After installation, configure the required MySQL environment variables. The server will start automatically when initialized by the MCP system. Ensure you have MySQL server accessible with the provided credentials.

browser-tabs.name: MCP Browser Tabs
browser-tabs.description: Model Context Protocol server for retrieving and managing Chrome browser tabs information, allowing MCP clients like Claude Desktop to fetch and control open Chrome tabs.

lichess.name: Lichess MCP
lichess.description: An MCP server that enables natural language interaction with the Lichess chess platform for game play, analysis, account management, and tournament participation.
lichess.usageInstructions: 1. Install the server using the provided command. 2. Set your Lichess API token via environment variables or the `set_token` tool. 3. Use the available tools for account management, game play, analysis, and tournaments. 4. For Claude Desktop integration, configure the server in the `claude_desktop_config.json` file with the `lichess-mcp` command and your API token.

kagimcp.name: Kagi MCP Server
kagimcp.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates with Kagi's search and summarization APIs, enabling tools like Claude Desktop to perform search and summarization tasks.
kagimcp.usageInstructions: 1. Install uv for your system. 2. Use the install command provided. 3. Configure the server in claude_desktop_config.json with the KAGI_API_KEY and optional KAGI_SUMMARIZER_ENGINE. 4. Pose a query requiring search or summarization in Claude Desktop.

webflow.name: Webflow MCP Server
webflow.description: MCP server enabling Claude to interact with Webflow's APIs
webflow.usageInstructions: 1. Create a Webflow API Token. 2. Configure Claude Desktop configuration file with server details. 3. Set WEBFLOW_API_TOKEN environment variable. 4. Restart Claude Desktop.

snak.name: Snak Agent Engine
snak.description: A powerful AI Agent engine for Starknet, available as NPM package and backend server
snak.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/kasarlabs/snak.git && cd snak && pnpm install
snak.usageInstructions:
1. Create .env file from .env.example and fill required values
2. Configure AI models in config/models/default.models.json
3. Create agent configuration in config/agents/default.agent.json
4. Run with 'pnpm run start' for prompt mode or 'pnpm run start:server' for server mode

qrcode.name: MCP QR Code Server
qrcode.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that generates QR codes for various content types including URLs, WiFi credentials, contact information, and calendar events.
qrcode.usageInstructions: After installation, the server can be used with MCP clients like Claude Desktop or Emacs with mcp.el. For example, in Emacs, use `mcp-call-tool` with the `generate-qrcode` method and specify content and format. For direct CLI usage, use `npx -y @jwalsh/mcp-server-qrcode` and send JSON-RPC commands to generate QR codes.

biomart.name: Biomart MCP Server
biomart.description: An MCP server that interfaces with Biomart databases using pybiomart, providing tools for mart and dataset discovery, attribute and filter exploration, data retrieval, and ID translation.
biomart.usageInstructions: To use the Biomart MCP server, first install it via Smithery using the provided command. For development, clone the repository, create a virtual environment using 'uv venv', activate it, and run 'uv sync' or 'uv add mcp[cli] pybiomart'. The server can be run in dev mode using 'mcp dev biomart-mcp.py'. Configuration for Cursor involves adding an MCP server entry in either the global config or a project-specific '.cursor/mcp.json' file.

api-expert.name: MCP API Connect
api-expert.description: An MCP server that connects to any REST API by using provided API documentation and API keys in a message.
api-expert.usageInstructions:
1. Install the package globally using 'npm i -g mcp-api-connect'.
2. Run the setup command with 'mcpapiconnect install'.
3. Restart Claude Desktop to apply changes.
4. Provide API documentation and API keys in a message to connect to the desired REST API.

untappd.name: Untappd Model Context Protocol Server
untappd.description: A simple MCP server written in Node.js to query the Untappd API for beer information and user check-ins.
untappd.usageInstructions: 1. Install dependencies and build the server using `npm install && npm run build`. 2. Configure the server in your Claude Desktop config file by specifying the path to `build/index.js`. 3. Set optional environment variables `UNTAPPD_CLIENT_ID` and `UNTAPPD_CLIENT_SECRET` for API authentication. 4. Use the server to query Untappd via the supported tools: `search_beer`, `get_beer_info`, and `get_user_checkins`.

scrape-copilot.name: Puppeteer MCP Server
scrape-copilot.description: An MCP server providing browser automation capabilities using Puppeteer for LLM interactions.
scrape-copilot.usageInstructions: Configure using Claude Desktop configuration. For Docker: { "mcpServers": { "puppeteer": { "command": "docker", "args": ["run", "-i", "--rm", "--init", "-e", "DOCKER_CONTAINER=true", "mcp/puppeteer"] } } }. For NPX: { "mcpServers": { "puppeteer": { "command": "npx", "args": ["-y", "@modelcontextprotocol/server-puppeteer"] } } }

laravel.name: Laravel Helpers MCP
laravel.description: A collection of Laravel helper tools for Cursor IDE integration, enhancing development workflow and debugging capabilities.
laravel.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/jsonallen/laravel-mcp.git && cd laravel-mcp && uv pip install -r requirements.txt
laravel.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install requirements. 2. Create a shell script wrapper at ~/bin/run-laravel-mcp. 3. Make the script executable. 4. Ensure ~/bin is in your PATH. 5. Set LARAVEL_PATH to your Laravel project path in the wrapper script.

mcpunk.name: MCPunk
mcpunk.description: MCPunk is an MCP server that lets you explore and understand codebases through conversation by breaking files into logical chunks and giving the LLM tools to search and query these chunks.
mcpunk.usageInstructions:
1. Install uv from https://docs.astral.sh/uv/getting-started/installation/
2. Configure Claude Desktop by adding 'mcpunk' to claude_desktop_config.json
3. Restart Claude Desktop
4. Use commands like 'configure_project', 'list_all_files_in_project', 'find_files_by_chunk_content' in chat

sketch-context.name: Sketch Context MCP
sketch-context.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates Sketch designs with IDEs like Cursor, enabling design-to-code workflows through real-time communication and component access.
sketch-context.usageInstructions:
1. Install the server globally with `npm install -g sketch-context-mcp`.
2. Start the server with `sketch-context-mcp --local-file=/path/to/your/file.sketch` or use `npx sketch-context-mcp`.
3. Install the Sketch plugin from the releases page and connect it to the server via the plugin interface.
4. In Cursor IDE, add the MCP server URL `http://localhost:3333/sse` to enable design-to-code interactions.
5. Use commands like `get_file`, `list_components`, and `create_rectangle` to interact with Sketch files from Cursor.

file-modifier.name: MCP Server File Modifier
file-modifier.description: A Model Context Protocol server for file modifications, allowing operations like adding, replacing, and deleting content in files using AI assistants.
file-modifier.usageInstructions: After installation, run `mcp-server-file-modifier` to start the server. By default, it will listen on port 3000. You can customize the port by setting the PORT environment variable if needed.

globalping.name: Globalping MCP Server
globalping.description: Enables AI models to interact with Globalping's global network measurement platform through natural language.
globalping.usageInstructions: To use the Globalping MCP Server, configure it with compatible AI tools like Claude Desktop, Anthropic Console, or Cursor by adding the remote MCP server URL. For development, add Globalping OAuth credentials using 'npx wrangler secret put GLOBALPING_CLIENT_ID'.

tmux.name: Tmux MCP Server
tmux.description: A proof-of-concept Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides programmatic control over tmux sessions.

browser-use.name: MCP Browser Automation Server
browser-use.description: An MCP server that provides browser automation capabilities through a simple API using natural language commands.
browser-use.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/jonnyhoff/mcp-browser-use && cd mcp-browser-use && poetry install
browser-use.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and navigate to the project directory. 2. Install dependencies using Poetry. 3. Create a `.env` file with your OpenAI API key. 4. Run the server using `poetry run python main.py`. 5. Use the `/run_browser_task` endpoint to execute browser automation tasks via natural language commands.

timeplus.name: Timeplus MCP Server
timeplus.description: An MCP server for Timeplus that enables SQL queries, database listing, and Kafka topic management.
timeplus.usageInstructions: 1. Install using 'uvx mcp-timeplus'. 2. Configure environment variables in Claude Desktop config or .env file. 3. Restart Claude Desktop. For development: 1. Run 'docker compose up -d' in test-services directory. 2. Create .env file with required variables. 3. Run 'uv sync' and 'source .venv/bin/activate'. 4. Start server with 'mcp dev mcp_timeplus/mcp_server.py'.

comfy-ui.name: Comfy UI MCP Server
comfy-ui.description: An MCP server for connecting to a local Comfy UI, providing note storage and summarization features.
comfy-ui.usageInstructions: To use this server, configure it in Claude Desktop by adding an entry to the claude_desktop_config.json file. For development, use 'uv sync' to sync dependencies, 'uv build' to build distributions, and 'uv publish' to publish to PyPI. Debugging can be done using the MCP Inspector via 'npx @modelcontextprotocol/inspector uv --directory <path> run comfy-ui-mcp-server'.

juliadoc.name: Julia Documentation MCP Server
juliadoc.description: An MCP server that serves Julia documentation and source code to Claude Desktop, supporting functions, types, modules, and packages.
juliadoc.usageInstructions:
1. Install Node.js 16+ and Julia 1.9+.
2. Add the server to your Claude Desktop config (`~/Library/Application Support/Claude/claude_desktop_config.json`) with the `JULIA_PROJECT` environment variable set to your Julia project path.
3. Start the server using `npx -y @jonathanfischer97/server-juliadoc` or run it locally with `npm start` after cloning the repository.

mongodb.name: MongoDB MCP Server
mongodb.description: An MCP server providing read-only access to MongoDB databases through standardized MCP tools and resources.
mongodb.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/jonfreeland/mongodb-mcp.git && cd mongodb-mcp && npm install && npm run build
mongodb.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and install dependencies.
2. Build the server using 'npm run build'.
3. Configure environment variables MONGODB_URI and optionally MONGODB_DEFAULT_DATABASE.
4. Integrate with Claude Desktop, Claude Web, or Claude Code as described in the README.

sqlite-npx.name: MCP SQLite Server
sqlite-npx.description: A Node.js implementation of the Model Context Protocol SQLite server for Claude Desktop integration
sqlite-npx.usageInstructions: To use with Claude Desktop, add configuration to claude_desktop_config.json with npx command and database path. For manual testing, use 'npx @modelcontextprotocol/inspector node dist/index.js /absolute/path/to/database.db'

netskope.name: Netskope NPA MCP Server
netskope.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for managing Netskope Network Private Access (NPA) infrastructure through Large Language Models (LLMs).
netskope.usageInstructions:
1. Install the package using `npm install @johnneerdael/netskope-mcp`.
2. Set the required environment variables: `NETSKOPE_BASE_URL` and `NETSKOPE_API_KEY`.
3. Add the MCP server configuration to your MCP settings file with the appropriate command and environment variables.
4. Use the provided tools like `getAlertConfig`, `updateAlertConfig`, `listLocalBrokers`, and `createLocalBroker` to manage your Netskope NPA infrastructure.

joesandboxmcp.name: Joe Sandbox MCP Server
joesandboxmcp.description: An MCP server for interacting with Joe Sandbox Cloud, providing analysis and IOC extraction capabilities.
joesandboxmcp.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/joesecurity/joesandboxMCP.git && cd joesandboxMCP && uv venv && uv pip install -e .
joesandboxmcp.usageInstructions: After installation, configure the MCP server by setting up the environment variables JBXAPIKEY and ACCEPTTAC. Then, launch the server using the command 'uv run main.py'. Refer to the example configuration for details on integrating with MCP-compatible applications.

md-webcrawl.name: MD Webcrawler MCP Server
md-webcrawl.description: A Python-based MCP web crawler for extracting and saving website content in markdown format.
md-webcrawl.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/jmh108/md-webcrawl-mcp && cd md-webcrawl-mcp && uv pip install fastmcp && pip install -r requirements.txt
md-webcrawl.usageInstructions: 1. Set the `OUTPUT_PATH` environment variable to your preferred output directory. 2. Run the server using `fastmcp run server.py`. 3. Use `mcp call` commands like `extract_content` or `scan_linked_content` to interact with the server. 4. For development, use `fastmcp dev server.py --with-editable .`.

dart.name: Dart MCP Server
dart.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for Dart, providing task management, document handling, and workspace organization capabilities through MCP tools.
dart.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository: git clone https://github.com/jmanhype/dart-mcp-server && cd dart-mcp-server
2. Install dependencies: npm install
3. Set up Python environment: python -m venv .venv && source .venv/bin/activate && pip install dart-sdk
4. Configure environment variables: cp .env.example .env && edit .env with your DART_TOKEN
5. Build TypeScript code: npm run build
6. Start the server: npm start

readability-python.name: MCP Server Readability Parser
readability-python.description: A Python MCP server that extracts webpage content into clean Markdown using Readability algorithm.
readability-python.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/jmh108/MCP-server-readability-python.git && cd MCP-server-readability-python && python -m venv venv && source venv/bin/activate && pip install -r requirements.txt
readability-python.usageInstructions: 1. Start the server: 'fastmcp run server.py'. 2. Example request: 'curl -X POST http://localhost:8000/tools/extract_content -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"url": "https://example.com/article"}''. Configure MCP server settings as described in the README.

sanity.name: Sanity MCP Server
sanity.description: MCP server for interacting with Sanity.io content from Claude Desktop
sanity.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/jlmelis/sanity-mcp-server.git && cd sanity-mcp-server && npm install
sanity.usageInstructions: 1. Create .env file with Sanity credentials. 2. Configure Claude Desktop: Settings > MCP Servers > Add server with command: node src/sanity-mcp-server.ts

florence2.name: Florence-2 MCP Server
florence2.description: An MCP server for processing images using Florence-2 to extract text via OCR or generate descriptive captions.
florence2.usageInstructions: 1. Install using the provided command. 2. Use the 'ocr' tool to extract text from an image or URL with the 'src' argument. 3. Use the 'caption' tool to generate captions for an image or URL with the 'src' argument.

webscrapemcpserver.name: Web Crawler MCP Server
webscrapemcpserver.description: An MCP server that provides web crawling functionality through a configurable API.
webscrapemcpserver.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/jitsmaster/web-crawler-mcp.git && cd web-crawler-mcp && npm install && npm run build
webscrapemcpserver.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies. 2. Create a .env file with configuration options. 3. Run 'npm start' to start the server. 4. Configure MCP settings to use the server.

json-db-collection.name: MCP JSON Document Collection Server
json-db-collection.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that allows creation and management of multiple JSON document databases using Fireproof, with support for CRUD operations, querying, and cloud synchronization.
json-db-collection.usageInstructions:
1. Clone or download the repository.
2. Run `npm install` to install dependencies.
3. Run `npm run build` to build the server.
4. Configure the server by adding it to the Claude Desktop config file as described in the README.
5. Use the MCP interface to create and manage JSON document databases, and optionally sync them to the Fireproof Cloud.

elastic-semantic-search.name: Elasticsearch Semantic Search MCP Server
elastic-semantic-search.description: A Python-based MCP server for semantic search of Search Labs blog posts indexed in Elasticsearch.
elastic-semantic-search.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/jedrazb/elastic-semantic-search-mcp-server && cd elastic-semantic-search-mcp-server && pip install -r requirements.txt
elastic-semantic-search.usageInstructions: 1. Set up Elasticsearch and generate an API key with crawler permissions. 2. Create a `.env` file with `ES_URL` and `ES_AP_KEY`. 3. Run the server using `make dev`. 4. Access the MCP Inspector at http://localhost:5173. 5. Optionally, integrate with Claude Desktop using `make install-claude-config`. 6. Follow the crawler setup instructions to index Search Labs blog posts.

jentic-tools.name: Jentic MCP Server
jentic-tools.description: Jentic MCP empowers AI agent builders to discover and integrate external APIs and workflows rapidly without writing or maintaining API-specific code.
jentic-tools.usageInstructions: 1. Obtain Jentic UUID using 'pip install jentic' and 'jentic register --email <your_email>'. 2. Configure MCP client with Jentic MCP server using 'uvx'. 3. Set JENTIC_UUID in mcp_config.json. 4. Use MCP tools like search_apis, load_execution_info, and execute.

pure-model-context-protocol.name: Pure Storage Model Context Protocol Server
pure-model-context-protocol.description: A simple MCP server to interact with Pure Storage FlashBlade arrays, retrieving real-time information such as array details, volumes, and hosts.
pure-model-context-protocol.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/jboothomas/pure-model-context-protocol && cd pure-model-context-protocol && uv pip install -r requirements.txt
pure-model-context-protocol.usageInstructions: After installation, configure the server by setting the required environment variables (PURE_API_TOKEN and PURE_ARRAY_ENDPOINT). Run the server using the command: `uv run pure-mcp-server`. For development, update the claude_desktop_config.json file to include the server configuration as shown in the README.

smartlead-local.name: Smartlead Simplified MCP Server
smartlead-local.description: A simplified interface to the Smartlead API for AI assistants and automation tools to interact with email marketing features.
smartlead-local.usageInstructions: 1. Install using 'npm install smartlead-mcp-server@1.2.1'. 2. For Claude: 'npx smartlead-mcp-server start'. 3. For n8n: 'npx smartlead-mcp-server sse'. First run will prompt for Smartlead API Key. Use 'npx smartlead-mcp-server config' to set up credentials non-interactively with '--api-key' option.

document-reader.name: MCP Document Reader
document-reader.description: An MCP server for interacting with PDF and EPUB documents, primarily used with Windsurf IDE by Codeium.
document-reader.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/jbchouinard/mcp-document-reader.git && cd mcp-document-reader && poetry install
document-reader.usageInstructions: After installation, configure the MCP server by running 'poetry run mcp-document-reader' or build and install with pipx. Configure Windsurf IDE with the appropriate command and args.

clanki.name: Clanki - Claude's Anki Integration
clanki.description: An MCP server enabling AI assistants like Claude to interact with Anki flashcard decks through the Model Context Protocol.
clanki.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/jasperket/clanki.git && cd clanki && npm install && npm run build
clanki.usageInstructions:
1. Ensure Anki is installed and running with AnkiConnect plugin enabled.
2. Configure Claude for Desktop by editing claude_desktop_config.json with the server path.
3. Run the server using 'node build/index.js'.

vibe-worldbuilding.name: Vibe Worldbuilding MCP
vibe-worldbuilding.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables detailed fictional world creation with Claude, including taxonomies, interconnected entries, AI-generated images, and navigable websites.
vibe-worldbuilding.usageInstructions:
1. Install dependencies using 'pip install -e . && npm install'.
2. Set the FAL_KEY environment variable for image generation.
3. Configure the MCP server in your Claude Desktop configuration with the command 'python3 ./vibe_worldbuilding_server.py' and the FAL_KEY environment variable.
4. Ask Claude to create a world, e.g., 'Create a fantasy world about floating islands'.
5. Explore the generated world with interconnected entries, images, and a navigable website.

webmcp.name: WebMCP
webmcp.description: A tool that allows websites to act as MCP servers, enabling client-side LLMs to access tools, resources, and prompts from websites without sharing API keys.
webmcp.usageInstructions:
1. Install using `npx -y @jason.today/webmcp@latest --config [mcp_client]`.
2. Generate an MCP token using your model and paste it on a WebMCP-enabled website.
3. The website will register and provide a session for tool interaction.
4. Disconnect by closing the browser tab, clicking 'disconnect', or shutting down the server with `npx @jason.today/webmcp -q`.
5. Configuration files are stored in `~/.webmcp`.

image-generation-cloudflare.name: image-generation-mcp-cloudflare
image-generation-cloudflare.description: An MCP server for image generation that integrates with Cloudflare services.
image-generation-cloudflare.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/janwilmake/image-generation-mcp-cloudflare.git && cd image-generation-mcp-cloudflare && npm install
image-generation-cloudflare.usageInstructions: After installation, set the required environment variables (CLOUDFLARE_API_TOKEN, CLOUDFLARE_ACCOUNT_ID, and MCP_SERVER_PORT). Start the server using 'npm start'. Optionally configure advanced settings like the image generation model or cache TTL for performance tuning.

draw-things-cursor.name: Draw Things MCP
draw-things-cursor.description: Draw Things API integration for Cursor using Model Context Protocol (MCP)
requiredEnvVars: Draw Things API running on http://127.0.0.1:7888
draw-things-cursor.usageInstructions: 1. Install using 'npm install -g draw-things-mcp-cursor' or run directly with 'npx draw-things-mcp-cursor'. 2. Configure Cursor by editing ~/.cursor/claude_desktop_config.json. 3. Use in Cursor: 'generateImage({"prompt": "a cute cat"})'. Ensure Draw Things API is running before use.

forevervm.name: foreverVM
forevervm.description: foreverVM provides an API for running arbitrary, stateful Python code securely using machines and instructions.
forevervm.usageInstructions:
1. Log in using 'npx forevervm login'.
2. Start a REPL with 'npx forevervm repl'.
3. Reconnect to a machine with 'npx forevervm repl [machine_name]'.
4. List machines with 'npx forevervm machine list'.
5. Use the SDK to create and manage machines programmatically with tags and memory limits.

hitchcode.name: MCP Server Template for Cursor IDE
hitchcode.description: A template for creating custom tools for Cursor IDE using Model Context Protocol (MCP)
hitchcode.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/kirill-markin/weaviate-mcp-server.git && cd weaviate-mcp-server && uv pip install -e ".[dev]"
hitchcode.usageInstructions: After installation, run the server using 'uv run mcp-hitchcode'. To connect to Cursor IDE: open Cursor Settings, go to Features, add new MCP server, and use the appropriate command or URL (http://localhost:8000/sse for SSE transport).

gatherer.name: Magic: The Gathering MCP Tool Server
gatherer.description: A Model Context Protocol server for accessing Magic: The Gathering card data, rules, and set information.
gatherer.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/james2037/mcp-gatherer.git && cd mcp-gatherer && composer install
gatherer.usageInstructions:
1. Ensure PHP 8.1+ and Composer are installed.
2. Clone the repository and install dependencies with `composer install`.
3. Run the server with `php mcp_server.php`.
4. Configure your MCP client (e.g., Claude Desktop) to use the server by specifying the command and path to `mcp_server.php` in the configuration file.

statsource.name: Statsource MCP Server
statsource.description: A Model Context Protocol server providing statistical analysis capabilities for LLMs.
statsource.usageInstructions: After installation, configure environment variables (API_KEY, DB_CONNECTION_STRING, DB_SOURCE_TYPE) and run using 'mcp-server-stats' or 'python -m mcp_server_stats'. For Docker, use 'docker run -i --rm -e API_KEY=your_key -e DB_CONNECTION_STRING=your_connection_string jamie78933/statsource-mcp'.

claude.name: Claude-MCP Servers
claude.description: A collection of Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers for various capabilities including filesystem access, GitHub interaction, web search, and more.
claude.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/jamcam-me/Claude-MCP.git && cd Claude-MCP && npm install
claude.usageInstructions: To start all servers: npm start. To start individual servers: npm run start:<server-name>. Configure Claude Desktop by modifying claude_desktop_config.json with the appropriate server commands and args.

umami.name: Umami Analytics MCP Server
umami.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that connects Claude to Umami analytics data, enabling analysis of website performance, user behavior, and real-time visitor activity.
umami.installCommand: pip install uv && git clone https://github.com/jakeyShakey/umami && cd umami && uv pip install -r requirements.txt
umami.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and install dependencies with 'pip install uv && git clone https://github.com/jakeyShakey/umami && cd umami && uv pip install -r requirements.txt'.
2. Configure the MCP server in Claude Desktop by adding the 'analytics_service' entry to your config file with the correct path and environment variables.
3. Enable the 'Analysis tool' in Feature Preview within Claude Desktop for enhanced dashboard capabilities.
4. Use the 'Create Dashboard Prompt' or interact naturally with Claude to request specific analytics insights.

json-schema.name: JSON Schema MCP Server
json-schema.description: An MCP server that manages JSON schemas and creates instances from them.
json-schema.usageInstructions:
1. Run the server: python server.py
2. Use tools like create_schema and create_instance to manage schemas and create instances

cli-exec.name: mcp-cli-exec
cli-exec.description: A CLI command execution MCP server that runs shell commands with structured output, supporting single or multiple commands in a specified working directory.
cli-exec.usageInstructions:
1. Install the package globally using 'npm install -g mcp-cli-exec'.
2. For VSCode Cline extension, add the server configuration to the appropriate settings file as described in the README.
3. For Claude Desktop, add the server configuration to the appropriate config file as described in the README.
4. Execute commands using the 'cli-exec' or 'cli-exec-raw' tools with structured JSON input.
5. For development, run 'pnpm install', 'pnpm run build', and use 'pnpm run inspector' for debugging.

solarwinds.name: SolarWinds Logs MCP Server
solarwinds.description: An MCP server for accessing and visualizing SolarWinds Observability logs
solarwinds.usageInstructions: Configure SOLARWINDS_API_TOKEN either through MCP settings file or as an environment variable. Use 'npx mcp-solarwinds' for running without global installation. For local testing, create a .env file with your API token and run 'node examples/local-test.js'

obsidian-tools.name: Obsidian MCP Tools
obsidian-tools.description: Enables AI applications like Claude Desktop to securely access and work with your Obsidian vault through the Model Context Protocol (MCP).
obsidian-tools.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/jacksteamdev/obsidian-mcp-tools && cd obsidian-mcp-tools && bun install && bun run build
obsidian-tools.usageInstructions:
1. Install the plugin from Obsidian's Community Plugins.
2. Enable the plugin in Obsidian settings.
3. Open plugin settings and click 'Install Server' to download and configure the MCP server.
4. Ensure the Local REST API plugin is configured with an API key.
5. Start the MCP server and verify Claude Desktop is configured to use it.
6. Use the logs in {vault}/.obsidian/plugins/obsidian-mcp-tools/logs for troubleshooting.

codechecker.name: CodeChecker MCP
codechecker.description: A code review tool for Cursor IDE using OpenAI's GPT models for intelligent code analysis
codechecker.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/jacklandis29/codechecker-mcp.git && cd codechecker-mcp && python -m venv venv && source venv/bin/activate && pip install -e .
codechecker.usageInstructions:
1. Create .env file with OPENAI_API_KEY
2. Start server: python main.py --transport sse --port 8000
3. Configure Cursor IDE with endpoint http://127.0.0.1:8000/sse

elastic-memory.name: MCP Memory
elastic-memory.description: A persistent memory system for AI conversations using Elasticsearch, providing long-term context retention for LLMs.
elastic-memory.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/mcp-servers/mcp-servers.git && cd mcp-servers/memory && npm install
elastic-memory.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies. 2. Start Elasticsearch using Docker (npm run es:start) or set ES_NODE to your Elasticsearch instance. 3. Build the project (npm run build). 4. Configure the launch.sh script with your Groq API key. 5. Add the command to Claude Desktop for integration. Use the admin CLI for memory management tasks like search, entity details, and backups.

claude-pytorch-treehugger.name: PyTorch HUD API MCP Server
claude-pytorch-treehugger.description: A Python library and MCP server for interacting with PyTorch HUD API, providing CI/CD data, job logs, and analytics.
optionalParams: MCP configuration parameters as described in CLAUDE.md and mcp-guide.md
claude-pytorch-treehugger.usageInstructions:
1. Install using: pip install git+https://github.com/izaitsevfb/claude-pytorch-treehugger.git
2. Configure MCP server: claude mcp add hud pytorch-hud
3. Start server: python -m pytorch_hud
For development: pip install -r requirements.txt, then python -m unittest discover test for tests

alchemy-sdk.name: Alchemy MCP Plugin
alchemy-sdk.description: MCP plugin providing integration with Alchemy SDK for blockchain and NFT operations
alchemy-sdk.usageInstructions: 1. Install via Smithery using the install command. 2. For manual installation: npm install, npm run build, configure ALCHEMY_API_KEY in settings.json, then npm start

contentful.name: Contentful MCP Server
contentful.description: An MCP server implementation that integrates with Contentful's Content Management API, providing comprehensive content management capabilities including CRUD operations, space management, content types, and bulk operations.
contentful.usageInstructions:
1. Create a Contentful account and generate a Content Management API token.
2. Set the `CONTENTFUL_MANAGEMENT_ACCESS_TOKEN` environment variable with your token.
3. Optionally configure additional environment variables like `SPACE_ID` and `ENVIRONMENT_ID` for scoping operations.
4. Use the MCP server to perform content management operations such as entry and asset management, space and environment management, and bulk operations.
5. For advanced use with Claude Desktop, add the server to your `claude_desktop_config.json` with the appropriate command and environment variables.

litellm.name: LiteLLM MCP Server
litellm.description: An MCP server that integrates LiteLLM to handle text completions using OpenAI models.
litellm.usageInstructions: After installation, set the required environment variable OPENAI_API_KEY with your OpenAI API key. Optionally configure LITELLM_MODEL (default: gpt-3.5-turbo), LITELLM_TEMPERATURE (default: 0.7), and LITELLM_MAX_TOKENS (default: 1000). Start the server and send text completion requests via the MCP protocol.

langchain-ts-client.name: LangChain.js MCP Client
langchain-ts-client.description: A LangChain.js client for Model Context Protocol, enabling integration with LangChain.js tools and MCP APIs.
langchain-ts-client.usageInstructions: Initialize the MCPToolkit with serverParams, then extract and use LangChain.js compatible tools. Ensure @modelcontextprotocol/server-everything is available via npx.

memory-bank.name: Memory Bank MCP Server
memory-bank.description: An MCP server that implements the Cline's Memory Bank pattern for structured documentation in AI assistant environments.
memory-bank.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/ipospelov/mcp-memory-bank && cd mcp-memory-bank && python -m venv venv && source venv/bin/activate && pip install -r requirements.txt
memory-bank.usageInstructions: After installation, configure the server in your mcp.json file by specifying the command and arguments. Use the server to generate Memory Bank templates, analyze projects, or retrieve structure details. For example, run 'python src/mcp_memory_bank/main.py' to start the server locally.

ip2location-io.name: IP2Location.io MCP Server
ip2location-io.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides geolocation data for IPv4 and IPv6 addresses using the IP2Location.io API.
ip2location-io.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/ip2location/mcp-ip2location-io && cd mcp-ip2location-io && uv pip install -r requirements.txt
ip2location-io.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and navigate into the directory. 2. Install dependencies using uv. 3. Set the IP2LOCATION_API_KEY environment variable with your API key. 4. Add the server configuration to claude_desktop_config.json as described in the README. 5. Restart Claude Desktop to use the server. Query geolocation data by asking questions like 'Where is the location of (IP)?' in a chat.

instant.name: Instant
instant.description: Instant is a modern Firebase alternative that provides a real-time database for frontend applications, handling data fetching, permissions, offline caching, and multiplayer features automatically.
instant.usageInstructions: 1. Sign up at https://instantdb.com to create an app and get your `NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_ID`. 2. Install the SDK using `npm install @instantdb/react`. 3. Initialize the database with `init({ appId: process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_ID })`. 4. Use `db.useQuery` to read data and `db.transact` to write data. 5. Refer to the documentation at https://instantdb.com/docs for advanced features like permissions, presence, and offline support.

textin.name: TextIn OCR MCP Server
textin.description: TextIn OCR MCP Server is a tool for extracting text and performing OCR on documents, including document text recognition, ID recognition, and invoice recognition.
textin.usageInstructions: 1. Register for a TextIn account at https://www.textin.com/user/login?from=github_mcp. 2. Get APP_ID and APP_SECRET following https://www.textin.com/doc/guide/account/%E5%A6%82%E4%BD%95%E8%8E%B7%E5%8F%96app%20id?status=first. 3. Set APP_ID and APP_SECRET as environment variables. 4. Run the server using 'npx -y @intsig/server-textin'.

iplocate.name: IPLocate MCP Server
iplocate.description: MCP server providing comprehensive IP address intelligence including geolocation, network information, privacy detection, and abuse contacts through IPLocate.io API.
iplocate.usageInstructions:
1. Configure your MCP client (Cursor, Claude Desktop, or VS Code) with the provided configuration examples.
2. Set IPLOCATE_API_KEY environment variable with your API key from IPLocate.io.
3. For manual running: use 'npx -y @iplocate/mcp-server' or install globally with 'npm install -g @iplocate/mcp-server'.

elasticsearch7.name: Elasticsearch 7.x MCP Server
elasticsearch7.description: An MCP server for Elasticsearch 7.x, providing compatibility with Elasticsearch 7.x versions.
elasticsearch7.usageInstructions: 1. Set environment variables ELASTIC_HOST, ELASTIC_USERNAME, and ELASTIC_PASSWORD. 2. Start the server using the install command. 3. Use an MCP client to connect to the server at localhost:9999 (or the specified MCP_PORT). 4. Use supported MCP methods like es-ping, es-info, and es-search to interact with Elasticsearch.

ytrnscrpt.name: YouTube Transcript MCP Server
ytrnscrpt.description: MCP server that enables Claude to fetch and analyze YouTube video transcripts
ytrnscrpt.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/index01d/ytrnscrpt-mcp-server && cd ytrnscrpt-mcp-server && npm install && npm run build
ytrnscrpt.usageInstructions: 1. Configure Claude Desktop by editing ~/Library/Application Support/Claude/claude_desktop_config.json with the server configuration. 2. Restart Claude Desktop. 3. Ask Claude to fetch a YouTube transcript by saying 'Get me the transcript for [YouTube URL]'

serpapi.name: SerpApi MCP Server
serpapi.description: An MCP server that integrates with SerpApi to perform searches across various search engines and retrieve live and archived results.
serpapi.usageInstructions: 1. Save server code in server.py. 2. Create .env with SERPAPI_API_KEY. 3. Run 'python server.py'. 4. Configure Claude_desktop_config.json to integrate with MCP client.

party-time.name: Party Time MCP Server
party-time.description: A simple MCP server that responds with 'It's Party Time' when asked about the current time, implementing the Machine Conversation Protocol (MCP) for tool integration.
party-time.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/idyll/party-time-mcp && cd party-time-mcp && mix deps.get && mix escript.build && chmod +x ./party_time_mcp
party-time.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and build the executable using 'mix deps.get' and 'mix escript.build'.
2. Configure Claude Desktop by adding the server's executable path to 'claude_desktop_config.json'.
3. Restart Claude Desktop and ask 'What time is it?' to test the server.
4. Ensure the executable has execute permissions with 'chmod +x ./party_time_mcp'.

iaptic.name: MCP Server for Iaptic
iaptic.description: A Model Context Protocol server for interacting with the Iaptic API, allowing AIs like Claude to access customer, purchase, transaction, and statistical data.
iaptic.usageInstructions: To use this server, install it via the provided command or manually using npm. Configure it with your Iaptic API key and app name. Add it to your Claude Desktop configuration file for integration with AI tools. Use the available tools to query customers, purchases, transactions, statistics, and events.

opensearch.name: OpenSearch MCP Server
opensearch.description: An MCP server for OpenSearch, acting as a semantic memory layer on top of OpenSearch database.
opensearch.usageInstructions: To use with Claude Desktop, configure 'claude_desktop_config.json' with appropriate command and args. Alternatively, use 'uv run fastmcp install demo.py' for FastMCP UI installation.

fileforge.name: FileForge
fileforge.description: An MCP server that provides advanced file and code operations with vector embeddings support, including file management, code analysis, and intelligent path handling.
fileforge.usageInstructions: 1. Add the provided JSON configuration to your MCP client. 2. Use the available tools for file operations, code analysis, and vector embeddings. 3. For local installation, clone the repository, install dependencies, and configure the MCP client to point to the local server.

excalidraw.name: Excalidraw MCP Server
excalidraw.description: An MCP server providing API functionality for operating on Excalidraw drawings, including CRUD operations and export to various formats.
excalidraw.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/i-tozer/excalidraw-mcp.git && cd excalidraw-mcp && npm install && npm run build
excalidraw.usageInstructions: After installation, start the server using 'npm start'. The server provides various API endpoints for managing Excalidraw drawings and exporting them to different formats. Ensure you have Node.js installed.

nodejs-debugger.name: MCP Node.js Debugger
nodejs-debugger.description: An MCP server that provides Cursor or Claude Code access to Node.js at runtime for debugging purposes
nodejs-debugger.usageInstructions:
1. Add to Cursor by editing ~/.cursor/mcp.json with the specified configuration
2. For Claude Code, use 'claude mcp add nodejs-debugger npx @hyperdrive-eng/mcp-nodejs-debugger'
3. Run Node.js server in debug mode with 'node --inspect {file.js}'
4. Use Cursor or Claude Code to debug runtime errors

hasura.name: Advanced Hasura GraphQL MCP Server
hasura.description: This Model Context Protocol (MCP) server provides an interface for AI agents to interact with a Hasura GraphQL endpoint, enabling them to discover API structure, execute queries and mutations, preview data, perform aggregations, and check service health.
hasura.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/husamabusafa/hasura && cd hasura && pnpm install && pnpm run build
hasura.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and navigate to the directory.
2. Install dependencies using pnpm install.
3. Build the server with pnpm run build.
4. Run the server using pnpm start <HASURA_GRAPHQL_ENDPOINT> [ADMIN_SECRET] or node dist/index.js <HASURA_GRAPHQL_ENDPOINT> [ADMIN_SECRET].
5. Configure MCP clients like Cursor or Claude Desktop with the server command, arguments, and working directory.

brave.name: Brave MCP Server
brave.description: An MCP server implementation for Brave browser integration
brave.usageInstructions: After installation, configure BRAVE_API_KEY environment variable. Run 'mcp-server-brave start' to begin serving. Use '--help' for additional configuration options.

wordware.name: Wordware MCP Server
wordware.description: The Wordware MCP server allows you to run Wordware apps locally, enabling integration of Wordware's AI flows into your local development environment for testing and development.
wordware.usageInstructions: 1. Run `npx wordware-mcp` to start the interactive setup and enter your Wordware API key. 2. Start the server with `npx wordware-mcp start`. 3. Access your Wordware apps via `http://localhost:3000/api/run/{app_id}`. 4. For global installation, use `npm install -g wordware-mcp` and run `wordware-mcp` with optional parameters like `--api-key` and `--port`.

metabase.name: Metabase MCP Server
metabase.description: An MCP server integrating AI assistants with Metabase analytics platform.
metabase.usageInstructions: 1. Set required environment variables (METABASE_URL and either METABASE_API_KEY or METABASE_USER_EMAIL/METABASE_PASSWORD). 2. Configure Claude Desktop by editing claude_desktop_config.json. 3. Use npx command or Docker: 'docker run -e METABASE_URL=https://your-metabase.com -e METABASE_API_KEY=your_api_key metabase-mcp-server'

arxiv.name: ArXiv MCP Server
arxiv.description: Enables AI assistants to search and access arXiv papers through a simple MCP interface.
arxiv.usageInstructions: Configure storage path by setting ARXIV_STORAGE_PATH environment variable (defaults to ~/.arxiv-mcp-server/papers). Add server configuration to MCP client config file as shown in README.

claude-trello.name: Claude MCP Trello
claude-trello.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides tools for interacting with Trello boards, including card and list management, activity tracking, and rate-limited API access.
claude-trello.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/hrs-asano/claude-mcp-trello.git && cd claude-mcp-trello && npm install
claude-trello.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and install dependencies with `npm install`.
2. Build the project with `npm run build`.
3. Set the required environment variables: TRELLO_API_KEY, TRELLO_TOKEN, and TRELLO_BOARD_ID.
4. Integrate with Claude Desktop by configuring the MCP server in the claude_desktop_config.json file as described in the README.
5. Run the server and use the provided tools to interact with Trello boards.

tts-say.name: MCP TTS Say
tts-say.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/hirokidaichi/mcp-tts-say.git && cd mcp-tts-say && npm install
tts-say.usageInstructions:
1. `.env``OPENAI_API_KEY`
2. `npm run dev`
3. `npm test``npm run lint`
4. `npm run inspect`MCP Inspector

highlight-youtube.name: YouTube MCP Server
highlight-youtube.description: An MCP server that extracts transcripts from YouTube videos using the Highlight AI MCP SDK.
highlight-youtube.usageInstructions: After installation, run the server. It will start listening for requests on stdio. Provide a YouTube video URL to the get_youtube_transcript method to retrieve the transcript. Ensure Node.js >=18.0.0 is installed.

conductor-tasks.name: Conductor Tasks
conductor-tasks.description: AI-powered task manager for development workflows, integrating with multiple LLMs and providing task generation, expansion, and visualization features.
conductor-tasks.usageInstructions: 1. Install globally using 'npm install -g conductor-tasks'. 2. Set required environment variables (e.g., OPENAI_API_KEY) in a .env file or export them. 3. Initialize with 'conductor-tasks init'. 4. Use commands like 'conductor-tasks parse-prd', 'conductor-tasks list', 'conductor-tasks get', 'conductor-tasks update', 'conductor-tasks generate-steps', and 'conductor-tasks visualize' to manage tasks.

box.name: Box MCP Server
box.description: An MCP server for Box file management and search capabilities
box.usageInstructions: To use this server, first set up a Box developer account and create an application. Configure JWT or Developer Token authorization. For development, clone the repository, install dependencies with 'npm install', and run 'npm run watch'. Use 'dotenv npx @modelcontextprotocol/inspector node dist/index.js' to start the development server.

honeycomb.name: Honeycomb MCP
honeycomb.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with Honeycomb observability data, enabling LLMs to analyze and query datasets across multiple environments.
honeycomb.usageInstructions: 1. Install using `pnpm install && pnpm run build`. 2. Configure the MCP server by setting the `HONEYCOMB_API_KEY` in the `env` block of your MCP config. 3. For multiple environments, set environment-specific keys like `HONEYCOMB_ENV_PROD_API_KEY`. 4. EU customers must set `HONEYCOMB_API_ENDPOINT` to `https://api.eu1.honeycomb.io/`. 5. Caching can be configured using optional environment variables like `HONEYCOMB_CACHE_ENABLED` and `HONEYCOMB_CACHE_DEFAULT_TTL`. 6. Use the server with compatible clients like Claude Desktop, Cursor, or Windsurf.

highlight-github.name: GitHub MCP Server
highlight-github.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that retrieves diff content from GitHub Pull Requests using the GitHub REST API.
highlight-github.usageInstructions: 1. Set the GITHUB_TOKEN environment variable with a GitHub Personal Access Token. 2. Use the get_diff_pr tool by providing the repository owner, repository name, and pull request number as parameters. 3. The server returns an object containing the diff content from the specified PR.

tripadvisor.name: TripAdvisor Vacation Planner MCP Server
tripadvisor.description: MCP server providing access to TripAdvisor data for vacation planning, finding attractions, restaurants, and hotels.
tripadvisor.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/hhw67865/tripadvisor-mcp-server.git && cd tripadvisor-mcp-server && uv venv && .venv/bin/activate && uv add "mcp[cli]"
tripadvisor.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and set up the virtual environment. 2. Set TRIPADVISOR_API_KEY environment variable. 3. Run the server using 'mcp run server.py'. 4. Configure Claude Desktop with the provided JSON configuration, replacing 'PATH_TO_YOUR_PROJECT' with the actual project path and 'YOUR_API_KEY_HERE' with your TripAdvisor API key.

isitdown.name: mcp-server-isitdown
isitdown.description: An MCP server that checks if a website is currently down by querying www.isitdownrightnow.com.
isitdown.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/hesreallyhim/mcp-server-isitdown.git && cd mcp-server-isitdown && uv pip install -e .
isitdown.usageInstructions: Run the server using `mcp-server-isitdown` or `python -m mcp_server_isitdown`. Use the `get_website_status` tool by providing a `root_domain` input to check if a website is up or down. Example: `get_website_status('example.com')`.

windsurf-supabase.name: Windsurf Supabase MCP Server
windsurf-supabase.description: A Windsurf-optimized MCP server for Supabase integration, enhancing error handling, response formatting, and SQL query processing.
windsurf-supabase.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/hertzfelt/windsurf-supabase-mcp.git && cd windsurf-supabase-mcp && npm install
windsurf-supabase.usageInstructions: After installation, configure your Supabase connection by setting SUPABASE_URL and SUPABASE_KEY environment variables. Use the provided tools like postgrestRequest and sqlToRest for database interactions.

heroku.name: Heroku MCP Server
heroku.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables large language models to interact with the Heroku Platform, providing tools for application management and API access.
heroku.usageInstructions: 1. Install the Heroku CLI (v10.8.1+). 2. Set the HEROKU_API_KEY environment variable with your Heroku authorization token. 3. Configure your MCP client (e.g., Cursor, Zed, or VSCode) to use the command `heroku mcp:start` or `npx -y @heroku/mcp-server`. 4. Launch the server and interact with Heroku Platform resources through your MCP-enabled client.

onesies.name: onesies
onesies.description: A collection of small-sized personal projects
onesies.usageInstructions: Clone the repository and explore the collection of small projects. No specific setup or configuration is mentioned in the README.

simple.name: MCP Manager
simple.description: Modern web interface and CLI tool for managing MCP (Model Context Protocol) server configurations with features like server browsing, installation, configuration editing, and environment variable management.
