argocd.description: An implementation of the Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Argo CD, enabling AI assistants to interact with Argo CD applications through natural language.
argocd.usageInstructions:
1. Set the required environment variables: ARGOCD_BASE_URL and ARGOCD_API_TOKEN.
2. Optionally set NODE_TLS_REJECT_UNAUTHORIZED=0 if using self-signed certificates.
3. Run the server using the install command.
4. Integrate with MCP clients like VS Code, Cursor, or Claude Desktop by configuring the appropriate JSON configuration files.

solana-docs.name: solana-docs-mcp-server
solana-docs.description: A TypeScript-based MCP server implementing a simple notes system with resources, tools for creating notes, and prompts for generating summaries.
optionalParams: command path for server config in claude_desktop_config.json
solana-docs.usageInstructions: 1. Install dependencies with `npm install`. 2. Build the server with `npm run build`. 3. For development, use `npm run watch`. 4. Add the server config to `claude_desktop_config.json` with the path to `build/index.js`. 5. Use `npm run inspector` for debugging via the MCP Inspector.

codex-keeper.name: Aindreyway MCP Codex Keeper
codex-keeper.description: An intelligent MCP server providing AI assistants with curated access to latest documentation and best practices.
codex-keeper.usageInstructions:
1. Ensure Node.js (version 18 or higher) is installed.
2. Verify/update npm and npx.
3. Add the server configuration to your Cline/Sonnet configuration as shown in the README.

ipfs.name: MCP IPFS Server
ipfs.description: A Node.js server implementing the Model Context Protocol (MCP) for interacting with the storacha.network platform via the w3 command-line interface.
ipfs.usageInstructions:
1. Ensure Node.js 22.0.0+ and @web3-storage/w3cli are installed and configured.
2. Set the W3_LOGIN_EMAIL environment variable to the email used for w3 login.
3. Run the server using `npx -y mcp-ipfs` or via Docker with `docker run -i --rm -e W3_LOGIN_EMAIL=your-email@example.com alexbakers/mcp-ipfs`.
4. Configure your MCP client to connect to this server using the provided JSON configuration examples.

docs-service.name: MCP Documentation Service
docs-service.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) implementation for managing markdown documentation with frontmatter metadata, optimized for integration with AI assistants like Claude in Cursor or Claude Desktop.
docs-service.usageInstructions:
1. Install using `npm install -g mcp-docs-service` or use directly with `npx mcp-docs-service /path/to/docs`.
2. For Cursor integration, create a `.cursor/mcp.json` file with the MCP server configuration.
3. For Claude Desktop integration, add the server configuration to the `claude_desktop_config.json` file.
4. Use natural language commands or direct tool syntax to interact with the server.
5. Common commands include reading, writing, editing, and searching documents, as well as generating navigation and checking documentation health.
6. Run health checks with `npx mcp-docs-service --health-check /path/to/docs`.
7. Generate consolidated documentation for LLMs with `npx mcp-docs-service --single-doc /path/to/docs`.

email.name: MCP Email Server
email.description: IMAP and SMTP server via MCP protocol for email integration
email.usageInstructions:
1. Run 'uvx mcp-email-server@latest ui' to configure email server
2. Configure email settings through the UI
3. Integrate with Claude Desktop or other MCP clients using the generated configuration

harvest.name: Harvest Natural Language Time Entry MCP Server
harvest.description: An MCP server for logging Harvest time entries using natural language with special handling for leave requests.
harvest.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/adrian-dotco/harvest-mcp-server.git && cd harvest-mcp-server && npm install && npm run build && node build/setup.js
harvest.usageInstructions: After installation, restart Claude desktop app. Use natural language to log time entries, get time reports, list projects, tasks, and view recent time entries. Configure environment variables HARVEST_ACCESS_TOKEN, HARVEST_ACCOUNT_ID, STANDARD_WORK_DAY_HOURS, and TIMEZONE as needed.

agentrpc.name: AgentRPC
agentrpc.description: Universal RPC layer for AI agents across network boundaries and languages

lance.name: LanceDB MCP Server for LLMS
lance.description: An MCP server enabling LLMs to interact with documents through RAG and hybrid search in LanceDB.
lance.usageInstructions:
1. Create a local directory for the index.
2. Configure Claude Desktop config file with 'lancedb' MCP server settings.
3. Ensure Node.js18+ and npx are installed.
4. Pull required models: 'ollama pull snowflake-arctic-embed2' and 'ollama pull llama3.1:8b'.
5. Use 'npm run seed' to initialize the database with documents.

git-ingest.name: MCP Git Ingest
git-ingest.description: An MCP server that reads GitHub repository structure and important files
git-ingest.usageInstructions: Using mcp-client-cli: 'llm read https://github.com/adhikasp/mcp-git-ingest' to analyze repository structure and files. Requires Python3.8+ and uvx for installation.

resource-hub.name: resource-hub-server
resource-hub.description: An MCP server that connects to the Resource Hub for centralized configuration and management of MCP servers.
resource-hub.usageInstructions: To run the server, set the RESOURCE_HUB_TOKEN environment variable with your Resource Hub token and execute the server using `npx @adamwattis/resource-hub-server`. For development, install dependencies with `npm install`, build with `npm run build`, and start with `npm start`. To use with Claude Desktop, add the server configuration to the appropriate config file as described in the README.

scholarly.name: mcp-scholarly
scholarly.description: An MCP server to search for accurate academic articles, currently supporting arXiv.
scholarly.usageInstructions: 1. Install via the provided command or configure manually using uvx or Docker. 2. Use the 'search-arxiv' tool by providing a 'keyword' argument to search for academic articles. 3. For development, build and publish the package using uv commands. 4. Debug using the MCP Inspector for detailed server inspection.

tenki.name: Tenki MCP Server
tenki.description: An MCP server providing weather information for Japan
tenki.usageInstructions: To run the server without cloning, use the provided JSON configuration. To run with clone, clone the repository and use 'uv run main.py' in the repository directory.

twikit.name: MCP-Twikit
twikit.description: An MCP server that enables interaction with Twitter, allowing users to search tweets, analyze sentiment, and retrieve timelines.
twikit.usageInstructions: After installation, use the `llm` command-line interface to interact with the server. For example, use `llm compare 20 latest tweet directed @IndiHomeCare, @di_cbn, @BiznetHome, @ID_MyRepublic` to analyze sentiment across Twitter accounts. Ensure Twitter credentials are set in environment variables for authentication.

datahub.name: MCP Server for DataHub
datahub.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for DataHub, enabling metadata search, lineage traversal, and SQL query listing.
datahub.usageInstructions: After installation, set the required environment variables DATAHUB_API_TOKEN and DATAHUB_GRAPHQL_URL. Start the server using the provided command in the DataHub MCP server documentation. For development, refer to DEVELOPING.md for setup instructions.

gsc.name: Google Search Console MCP Server
gsc.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server providing access to Google Search Console for retrieving search analytics data with customizable reporting periods.
gsc.usageInstructions: 1. Create a Google Cloud Project and enable the Search Console API. 2. Generate Service Account credentials and grant access in Search Console. 3. Set the GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS environment variable to the path of your credentials file. 4. Configure the server in your application using the provided JSON configuration format.

configurable-puppeteer.name: Configurable Puppeteer MCP Server
configurable-puppeteer.description: A Model Context Protocol server that provides browser automation capabilities using Puppeteer with configurable options. This server enables LLMs to interact with web pages, take screenshots, and execute JavaScript in a real browser environment.
configurable-puppeteer.usageInstructions:
1. Install using the provided command
2. Configure Puppeteer options using the PUPPETEER_ARGS environment variable with a JSON string
3. Use the available tools (navigate, screenshot, click, hover, fill, select, evaluate) to interact with web pages
4. Access resources like console logs (console://logs) and screenshots (screenshot://<name>)
5. For advanced configuration, see the examples in the README for browser selection, viewport size, and other Puppeteer options

servers-kagi.name: Kagi MCP Server
servers-kagi.description: MCP server for Kagi API integration, providing tools for web searches and other operations
servers-kagi.usageInstructions: 1. Install using Smithery CLI. 2. Configure Claude Desktop by adding server config to claude_desktop_config.json. 3. Use with Claude to perform web searches.

alfresco-poc.name: Alfresco MCP Proof of Concept
alfresco-poc.description: A Node.js-based MCP server integrating Alfresco Content Services with AI capabilities
alfresco-poc.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/aborroy/alfresco-mcp-poc.git && cd alfresco-mcp-poc/alfresco && docker-compose up --build --force-recreate
alfresco-poc.usageInstructions:
1. Clone repository and navigate to project directory
2. Start Alfresco using Docker Compose: cd alfresco && docker-compose up --build --force-recreate
3. Verify Alfresco deployment at http://localhost:8080/share
4. Start Ollama server: ollama serve
5. Navigate to client directory and run MCP client: cd ../alfresco-mcp-client && mvn clean package && java -jar target/alfresco-mcp-client-0.8.0.jar

arithmetic.name: Arithmetic MCP Server
arithmetic.description: An MCP server providing basic arithmetic operations (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division).
arithmetic.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/YuheiNakasaka/arithmetic-mcp-server.git && cd arithmetic-mcp-server && npm install && npm run build
arithmetic.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies using npm. 2. Configure Claude Desktop App by editing claude_desktop_config.json. 3. Use arithmetic operations through Cline prompts.

kusto.name: Kusto MCP Server
kusto.description: An MCP server providing access to Azure Data Explorer (ADX) clusters with various query and schema operations.
kusto.usageInstructions: 1. Install using 'uv pip install mcp-server-kusto'. 2. Configure claude_desktop_config.json with the appropriate command and args. For local ADX emulator, use cluster URL like https://localhost:8082. For production ADX, provide --authority_id, --client_id, and --client_secret.

dify.name: Dify MCP Server
dify.description: An MCP server implementation for invoking Dify workflows through MCP tools.
dify.usageInstructions: 1. Install using 'uvx --from git+https://github.com/YanxingLiu/dify-mcp-server dify_mcp_server'. 2. Configure using either environment variables (DIFY_BASE_URL, DIFY_APP_SKS) or a config.yaml file (specified via CONFIG_PATH). 3. Run the server.

literature-memory-fastmcp.name: Literature Memory Server
literature-memory-fastmcp.description: A flexible system for managing various types of sources and integrating them with knowledge graphs.
literature-memory-fastmcp.installCommand: fastmcp install source-manager-server.py --name "Source Manager" -e SQLITE_DB_PATH=/path/to/sources.db && sqlite3 sources.db < create_sources_db.sql
literature-memory-fastmcp.usageInstructions: 1. Create a SQLite database using the provided schema. 2. Install the source management server using fastmcp with the SQLITE_DB_PATH environment variable set to your database path.

scrapbox.name: scrapbox-mcp
scrapbox.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides a simple notes system with tools for creating notes and prompts for summarizing them.
scrapbox.usageInstructions: 1. Clone or download the repository. 2. Run `npm install` to install dependencies. 3. Run `npm run build` to build the server. 4. Configure the server in the Claude Desktop config file as described in the README. 5. Use the `npm run inspector` command for debugging via the MCP Inspector.

metasearch.name: metasearch MCP server
metasearch.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that uses the Tavily API to perform searches and return results in text format, including AI responses, URIs, and titles.
metasearch.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/YeonwooSung/metasearch-mcp.git && cd metasearch-mcp && docker compose up -d
metasearch.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and navigate to the directory. 2. Set the TAVILY_API_KEY environment variable with your API key. 3. Use Docker Compose to run the server. 4. In Claude Desktop or Cursor, ask for searches like 'Please search for something' to get results. Logs are stored in the specified directories depending on the OS.

memory-manager.name: Memory MCP Manager
memory-manager.description: A tool to manage and switch between different memory paths for Claude clients using the mcp-knowledge-graph server.
memory-manager.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/YUZongmin/memory-mcp-manager.git && cd memory-mcp-manager && chmod +x memory.sh
memory-manager.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and make the script executable. 2. Initialize with `./memory.sh init`. 3. Add a Claude client with `./memory.sh add-client <name> <config_path>`. 4. Add memory paths with `./memory.sh add <name> <path>`. 5. Switch memory paths with `./memory.sh switch <name>`. Configuration is stored in `config.json`.

gatherings-python.name: Gatherings MCP Server
gatherings-python.description: A Model Context Protocol server for managing gatherings and expense sharing between participants
gatherings-python.installCommand: git clone https://your-repository.git && cd accel && pip install -r requirements.txt
gatherings-python.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and install dependencies
2. Set optional environment variables for custom paths
3. Start the server with: python gatherings_mcp_server.py
4. Use the exposed API tools to create gatherings, add expenses, calculate reimbursements, and manage payments

onesignal.name: OneSignal MCP Server
onesignal.description: A comprehensive Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with the OneSignal API, providing 57 tools for managing push notifications, emails, SMS, users, devices, segments, templates, analytics, and more.
onesignal.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/weirdbrains/onesignal-mcp.git && cd onesignal-mcp && pip install -r requirements.txt
onesignal.usageInstructions: 1. Create a .env file with required OneSignal credentials. 2. Run 'python onesignal_server.py' to start the server. The server will register itself with the MCP system, making all 57 tools available for use.

opendal.name: Model Context Protocol Server for Apache OpenDAL
opendal.description: An MCP server implementation that provides access to various storage services via Apache OpenDAL, including S3, Azure Blob Storage, and Google Cloud Storage.
opendal.usageInstructions:
1. Install the package using pip install mcp-server-opendal.
2. Configure storage services by setting environment variables with the appropriate prefix and service-specific options.
3. Add the server to your claude_desktop_config.json with the command uvx mcp-server-opendal and any required environment variables.
4. Use the configured storage service with tools like 'read' and 'list' by referencing the alias and path (e.g., mys3://path/to/file).
5. For development, use npx @modelcontextprotocol/inspector uv run mcp-server-opendal.

apptio-target-process.name: Targetprocess MCP Server
apptio-target-process.description: Enables AI assistants to interact with Targetprocess data through intelligent semantic operations, workflow-aware tools, and role-based filtering.
apptio-target-process.usageInstructions:
1. Set the required environment variables: TP_DOMAIN, TP_USERNAME, TP_PASSWORD.
2. Optionally set TP_USER_ROLE, TP_USER_ID, TP_USER_EMAIL for semantic operations.
3. Enable MCP_STRICT_MODE for MCP clients requiring clean JSON-RPC on stdio.
4. Run the server using npx or Docker as shown in the installation command.
5. Integrate with tools like Claude Code or MCP clients for full functionality.

api-tester.name: API Tester MCP Server
api-tester.description: An MCP server for testing APIs, including OpenAI's GPT models and DALL-E image generation.
api-tester.usageInstructions: 1. Set OPENAI_API_KEY using 'export OPENAI_API_KEY=your-api-key' (or equivalent for your OS). Alternatively, create a .env file with OPENAI_API_KEY=your_openai_api_key_here. 2. Run the server using 'python main.py'. 3. Configure Claude Desktop to connect to this server.

dbmcp.name: DBMCP (Database MCP Server)
dbmcp.description: MCP server for executing database queries through SSE
dbmcp.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/Verssae/dbmcp && cd dbmcp && uv sync && python server.py
dbmcp.usageInstructions:
1. Set environment variables in .env file
2. Run with Docker using 'docker-compose up -d' or locally with 'python server.py'
3. Configure MCP client with 'http://localhost:8080/sse'

uns.name: Unstructured API MCP Server
uns.description: An MCP server implementation for interacting with the Unstructured API, providing tools to list sources and workflows.
uns.usageInstructions: Create a .env file with required credentials for connectors, then run the server. Refer to documentation for specific connector configurations.

google-ads-js.name: Google Ads MCP (Node.js)
google-ads-js.description: Unofficial Google Ads MCP integration that enables AI to access Google Ads account data using GAQL.app as backend.
google-ads-js.usageInstructions: 1. Install Node.js. 2. Get GPT Token from GAQL.app. 3. Configure Claude by editing claude_desktop_config.json with the token. 4. Restart Claude.

chatgpt.name: ChatGPT MCP Server
chatgpt.description: An MCP server providing Docker management through natural language interface
chatgpt.usageInstructions: 1. Install via Smithery or manually clone the repository and run 'npm install'. 2. Create .env file from env.example. 3. Configure environment variables. 4. Build with 'npm run build'. 5. Run using Docker or 'npm run start'.

sandbox.name: Sandbox MCP Server
sandbox.description: An MCP server that provides isolated Docker environments for code execution, allowing users to create containers, write and execute code in multiple languages, and manage development environments.
sandbox.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/Tsuchijo/sandbox-mcp && cd sandbox-mcp && uv venv && source .venv/bin/activate && uv pip install .
sandbox.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies using the provided install command. 2. Configure the server in Claude Desktop by adding the sandbox server configuration to the claude_desktop_config.json file. 3. Use Claude Desktop to create containers, run code, install packages, and manage environments. 4. Save and reproduce environments by creating persistent containers, saving container states as Docker images, or generating Dockerfiles.

triplewhale.name: Triplewhale MCP Server
triplewhale.description: An MCP Server for Triplewhale that allows natural language queries to be executed against Triplewhale data using tools like Claude Desktop.
triplewhale.usageInstructions:
1. Install the server using the provided install command.
2. Generate a Triplewhale API key from the Triplewhale console.
3. Initialize the server with `npx -y @triplewhale/mcp-server-triplewhale init $TRIPLEWHALE_API_KEY`.
4. Restart Claude Desktop to use the server for natural language queries against Triplewhale data.

weatherxm-pro.name: WeatherXM PRO MCP Server
weatherxm-pro.description: An MCP server implementation exposing the WeatherXM PRO APIs as MCP tools, allowing clients to access weather station data, observations, and forecasts through the MCP protocol.
weatherxm-pro.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/WeatherXM/weatherxm-pro-mcp.git && cd weatherxm-pro-mcp && npm install && npm run build
weatherxm-pro.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and install dependencies with 'npm install'.
2. Build the project with 'npm run build'.
3. Configure the MCP client (e.g., Claude Desktop, Cursor, Windsurf Editor) with the provided JSON configuration, ensuring the 'WEATHERXMPRO_API_KEY' is set.
4. For Docker usage, build the image with 'docker build -t weatherxm-pro-mcp .' and run it with 'docker run -d -p 3000:3000 -e WEATHERXMPRO_API_KEY="your-api-key" -e PORT=3000 weatherxm-pro-mcp'.

twitch.name: Twitch MCP Server
twitch.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that integrates with Twitch chat, allowing interaction with Claude and other AI tools.
twitch.usageInstructions: 1. Build the project locally with `mvn install`. 2. Install JBang if not already installed. 3. Run the server using the provided command with your Twitch channel name and API key. 4. Use the MCP Inspector or integrate with Claude Desktop as described in the configuration examples.

memgpt.name: MemGPT MCP Server
memgpt.description: A TypeScript-based MCP server that implements a memory system for LLMs, allowing chat with multiple LLM providers while maintaining conversation history.
memgpt.usageInstructions: 1. Install dependencies with `npm install`. 2. Build the server with `npm run build`. 3. Set required environment variables (OPENAI_API_KEY, ANTHROPIC_API_KEY, OPENROUTER_API_KEY). 4. Configure the server in `claude_desktop_config.json` for use with Claude Desktop. 5. Use tools like `chat`, `get_memory`, `clear_memory`, `use_provider`, and `use_model` to interact with the server.

clickhouse.name: ClickHouse MCP Server
clickhouse.description: An MCP server for ClickHouse, enabling integration with LLMs and AI applications.
clickhouse.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/ThomAub/clickhouse_mcp_server.git && cd clickhouse_mcp_server && uv sync --all-extras
clickhouse.usageInstructions: 1. Set ClickHouse connection details in environment variables or update get_clickhouse_client in server.py. 2. Run: python clickhouse_mcp_server/server.py

verodat.name: Verodat MCP Server
verodat.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for Verodat, enabling AI systems like Claude Desktop to interact with Verodat's data management capabilities through well-defined tools for data consumption, design, and management.
verodat.usageInstructions: 1. Install via Smithery using the command: `npx -y @smithery/cli install @Verodat/verodat-mcp-server --client claude`. 2. Alternatively, clone the repository and run `npm install && npm run build`. 3. Configure Claude Desktop by adding the server configuration to the appropriate JSON file (MacOS: `~/Library/Application Support/Claude/claude_desktop_config.json`, Windows: `%APPDATA%/Claude/claude_desktop_config.json`). 4. Set the required environment variable `VERODAT_AI_API_KEY` with your Verodat API key. 5. Optionally set `VERODAT_API_BASE_URL` if using a custom API endpoint. 6. Select the appropriate server configuration (`consume.js`, `design.js`, or `manage.js`) based on your required tool category.

devops-bridge.name: MCP Server Multi Tools
devops-bridge.description: A powerful MCP server that integrates AI agents with DevOps and communication tools through a standardized interface.
devops-bridge.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/theapemachine/mcp-server-multi-tools.git && cd mcp-server-devops-bridge && go build -o mcp-server-multi-tools .
devops-bridge.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and build the server. 2. Configure environment variables in start.sh. 3. Configure MCP client in Claude Desktop configuration.

axiom-js.name: MCP Server for Axiom
axiom-js.description: A JavaScript MCP server enabling AI agents to query Axiom data using APL
axiom-js.usageInstructions: 1. Install using 'npm install -g mcp-server-axiom'. 2. Set AXIOM_TOKEN and AXIOM_ORG_ID environment variables. 3. Run 'mcp-server-axiom' to start the server. Optional: Create a config.json with token, url, orgId, queryRate, queryBurst, datasetsRate, datasetsBurst for alternative configuration.

grants.name: Grants Search MCP Server
grants.description: An MCP server for searching government grants using the Simpler Grants API.
grants.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/Tar-ive/grants-mcp && cd grants-mcp && npm install
grants.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and navigate to the project directory.
2. Run 'npm install' to install dependencies.
3. Set the API_KEY environment variable with your Simpler Grants API key.
4. Start the server with 'npm start'.
5. Connect using an MCP client (e.g., Claude Desktop) and use the 'search-grants' tool.

k8s-interactive.name: k8s-interactive-mcp
k8s-interactive.description: MCP server for running Kubernetes commands with kubeconfig support
k8s-interactive.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/TaichiHo/k8s-interactive-mcp && cd k8s-interactive-mcp && npm install && npm run build
k8s-interactive.usageInstructions:
1. Clone repository and cd into it
2. Run 'npm install' to install dependencies
3. Run 'npm run build' to build the server
4. Configure Claude Desktop by adding server config to claude_desktop_config.json
5. For development, use 'npm run watch' for auto-rebuild
6. For debugging, run 'npm run inspector'

uml.name: UML-MCP-Server
uml.description: UML diagram generation tool based on MCP that generates diagrams from natural language or PlantUML code.
uml.usageInstructions: 1. Install via Smithery using 'npx -y @smithery/cli install @Swayingleaves/uml-mcp-server --client claude'. 2. For manual installation: clone repository, create virtual environment, and install dependencies with 'pip install -r requirements.txt'. 3. Configure MCP in Cursor IDE by modifying config.json with server details.

uniprot.name: UniProt MCP Server
uniprot.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides access to UniProt protein information, allowing AI assistants to fetch protein function and sequence data.
uniprot.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/TakumiY235/uniprot-mcp-server.git && cd uniprot-mcp-server && uv pip install -r requirements.txt
uniprot.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies. 2. Add the server configuration to your Claude Desktop config file under the 'mcpServers' section. 3. Use the server in Claude Desktop by asking for protein information using UniProt accession numbers. For development, create a virtual environment and install development dependencies with 'pip install -e .[dev]'.

perplexity-insight.name: Perplexity Insight MCP Server
perplexity-insight.description: An MCP server implementation for interfacing with the Perplexity AI API, providing advanced question answering capabilities through the standardised Model Context Protocol.
perplexity-insight.usageInstructions: 1. Create a `.env` file with your Perplexity API key. 2. Run `npm start` to start the server. 3. Use the `perplexity_ask` and `perplexity_search` tools with optional parameters like model, system prompt, and max tokens. 4. For Windsurf integration, configure the MCP server with the correct command, arguments, and environment variables.

fetch-browser.name: Fetch Browser
fetch-browser.description: A headless browser MCP server that enables AI agents to fetch web content and perform Google searches without requiring API keys.
fetch-browser.usageInstructions: 1. Install via Smithery CLI with the appropriate client flag (e.g., --client claude, --client cursor, or --client typescript). 2. Use the `google_search` tool with a query, response type, max results, and topic. 3. Use the `fetch_url` tool with a URL, response type, and optional timeout. 4. Choose from supported response formats: markdown, json, html, or text.

edgeone-pages.name: EdgeOne Pages MCP
edgeone-pages.description: An MCP service for deploying HTML content, folders, and zip files to EdgeOne Pages and obtaining a publicly accessible URL for fast edge delivery.
edgeone-pages.usageInstructions:
1. Install the MCP server globally using 'npm install -g edgeone-pages-mcp'.
2. Configure the MCP server in your application by providing the 'EDGEONE_PAGES_API_TOKEN' in the environment variables.
3. Optionally specify an existing project name using 'EDGEONE_PAGES_PROJECT_NAME' to update an existing EdgeOne Pages project.
4. Use the 'deploy_html' tool to send HTML content to the server, which will return a public URL for the deployed content.

luma.name: Luma MCP Server
luma.description: Luma AI's video generation API as a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server
luma.usageInstructions: 1. Install using 'npm install @sunwood-ai-labs/luma-mcp-server'. 2. Obtain Luma API key from https://lumalabs.ai/dream-machine/api/keys. 3. Set LUMA_API_KEY environment variable. 4. Use available tools like generate_video, generate_video_from_image, extend_video, interpolate_videos.

gitlab-kanban.name: GitLab Kanban MCP Server
gitlab-kanban.description: A Model Context Protocol server for managing GitLab Kanban board operations.
gitlab-kanban.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/Sunwood-ai-labs/gitlab-kanban-mcp-server.git && cd gitlab-kanban-mcp-server && npm install
gitlab-kanban.usageInstructions: Create a .env file with GITLAB_TOKEN and GITLAB_URL. Run 'npm run build' to build the server. Configure cline_mcp_settings.json with the correct command and environment variables.

documind.name: DocuMind MCP Server
documind.description: A next-generation Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for advanced README quality analysis through neural processing.
documind.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/Sunwood-ai-labs/documind-mcp-server.git && cd documind-mcp-server && npm install && npm run build
documind.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and cd into it.
2. Run 'npm install' to install dependencies.
3. Run 'npm run build' to compile the project.
4. Configure Claude Desktop by editing '%APPDATA%/Claude/claude_desktop_config.json' to include the path to 'build/index.js'.
5. Use the 'evaluate_readme' command with a valid 'projectPath' argument.

aira.name: Aira MCP Server
aira.description: MCP server for creating commit messages from git staged files and managing Gitflow operations
aira.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/Sunwood-ai-labs/aira-mcp-server.git && cd aira-mcp-server && npm install && npm run build
aira.usageInstructions: Configure the MCP server in your settings.json with 'command': 'node' and 'args': ['path/to/build/index.js']. Available tools: get_status, create_commit, init_gitflow, create_branch, merge_branch, list_branches

azure.name: Azure MCP Server for Claude Desktop
azure.description: An MCP server enabling Claude Desktop to interact with Azure services through natural language conversations.
azure.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/Streen9/azure-mcp.git && cd azure-mcp && npm install
azure.usageInstructions: 1. Close Claude Desktop. 2. Configure claude_desktop_config.json with the MCP server path. 3. Start Claude Desktop. 4. Authenticate using Azure CLI or environment variables. 5. Ask Azure-related questions in the chat.

win-cli.name: Windows CLI MCP Server
win-cli.description: MCP server for secure command-line interactions on Windows systems, enabling controlled access to PowerShell, CMD, Git Bash shells, and remote systems via SSH.
win-cli.usageInstructions: To use with Claude Desktop, add the server configuration to claude_desktop_config.json. For custom configuration, create a config.json file using 'npx @simonb97/server-win-cli --init-config ./config.json' and specify it with the --config flag.

github-kanban.name: GitHub Kanban MCP Server
github-kanban.description: GitHub Kanban MCP ServerGitHubissueLLMModel Context ProtocolMCP
github-kanban.usageInstructions:
1. Node.js 18.xnpm 9.x
2. GitHub CLI (gh)gh auth login
3. MCPserver
4. (list_issues, create_issue, update_issue, add_comment)MCP

command-executor.name: Command Executor MCP Server
command-executor.description: A secure Model Context Protocol server for executing pre-approved commands with configurable allowed commands and integration with Claude Desktop.
command-executor.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies with `npm install`. 2. Build the server using `npm run build`. 3. Configure allowed commands via the `ALLOWED_COMMANDS` environment variable. 4. For Claude Desktop integration, add the server configuration to the appropriate config file. 5. Run the server using `node build/index.js`. Use the MCP Inspector for debugging if needed.

autumn.name: Autumn MCP Server
autumn.description: Unofficial MCP server for Autumn's pricing API, providing tools for customer management, entitlements, invoices, and billing portal generation
autumn.usageInstructions:
1. Install via Smithery with the provided command
2. For manual installation: clone the repo, run 'bun install', then execute 'bun run index.ts --apiKey="{your api key}"'
3. Configure your AI app (Claude Desktop, Cursor, etc.) with the server command and API key
4. Use the MCP server to manage customers, entitlements, invoices, and billing portals through the Autumn API

memory-journal.name: Smart Photo Journal MCP Server
memory-journal.description: An MCP server for searching and analyzing your macOS Photos library with features like location search, label search, people search, and photo analysis.
memory-journal.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/Siddhant-K-code/memory-journal-mcp-server.git && cd memory-journal-mcp-server && uv sync
memory-journal.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies using uv. 2. Update claude_desktop_config.json with the server command and path. 3. Start the server with 'uv run server.py'. 4. Use the MCP tools for location, label, and people search, or photo analysis.

jina-ai-multimodal-search.name: Jina AI MCP Server
jina-ai-multimodal-search.description: An MCP server providing semantic, image, and cross-modal search capabilities through Jina AI's neural search platform.
jina-ai-multimodal-search.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/Sheshiyer/jina-ai-mcp-multimodal-search.git && cd jina-ai-mcp && npm install && npm run build
jina-ai-multimodal-search.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies. 2. Create a .env file with your Jina AI API key. 3. Build the server using 'npm run build'. 4. Configure the MCP settings file with the server details. 5. Use the provided search tools (semantic_search, image_search, cross_modal_search) with appropriate arguments.

setus.name: Setu MCP Servers
setus.description: MCP servers for Setu's APIs enabling interaction with KYC verification and UPI Deeplinks services
setus.installCommand: pip install setu_mcp_kyc # for KYC verification or pip install setu_mcp_upi_deeplinks # for UPI Deeplinks
setus.usageInstructions:
1. Install desired MCP server using pip
2. Configure environment variables as specified in server's README
3. Add server configuration to Claude Desktop's config file
4. Start using tools through Claude

timeserver.name: MCP-timeserver
timeserver.description: An MCP server providing datetime information through URI schemes and a tool for getting current local time.
timeserver.usageInstructions: To use this server, configure it using the provided JSON configuration. The server exposes datetime information through URI schemes like datetime://Africa/Freetown/now and provides a tool get_current_time() to fetch the current local time.

vcd.name: MCP-VCD Server
vcd.description: An MCP server for Value Change Dump (VCD) waveforms, providing signal changes to models.

llms-txt.name: MCP-llms-txt
llms-txt.description: MCP server for integrating Awesome-llms-txt with Claude Desktop, enabling direct documentation access in conversations.
llms-txt.usageInstructions:
1. Install via Smithery using the provided command.
2. Configure your claude config with the specified command and environment variables.
3. Use mcp-cli to test the server with the provided config file.

azuredevops.name: Azure DevOps MCP Integration
azuredevops.description: A powerful integration for Azure DevOps that provides seamless access to work items, repositories, projects, boards, and sprints through the Model Context Protocol (MCP) server.
azuredevops.usageInstructions: After installation, configure the server using environment variables for Azure DevOps connection details. Create a Personal Access Token (PAT) with appropriate permissions for Azure DevOps Services. For on-premises installations, additional configuration options are available.

xano.name: Xano MCP Server
xano.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for interacting with the Xano API, providing secure and type-safe tools for database operations.
xano.installCommand: git clone [your-repo-url] && cd xano_mcp && npm install
xano.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies. 2. Copy the .env.example file to .env and update it with your Xano credentials. 3. Build the project with 'npm run build'. 4. Run the server in development mode with 'npm run dev' or start it with 'npm start'.

stockmcp.name: Yahoo Finance Model Context Protocol for LLaMA 3.2 3B
stockmcp.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) implementation that integrates Yahoo Finance API with LLaMA 3.2 3B, enabling real-time financial data retrieval and enhancing the model's capabilities for financial queries.
stockmcp.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/Shak2000/StockMCP && cd StockMCP && pip install -r requirements.txt
stockmcp.usageInstructions:
1. Install Ollama from https://ollama.ai/.
2. Pull the LLaMA 3.2 3B model using `ollama pull llama3.2:3b`.
3. Clone the repository and install dependencies with `pip install -r requirements.txt`.
4. Run the integration script with `python mcp_ollama_integration.py`.
5. For advanced usage, use the YahooFinanceMCP class in your code to call financial functions directly.

wolfram-alpha.name: MCP-wolfram-alpha
wolfram-alpha.description: An MCP server that connects to the Wolfram Alpha API to answer questions using the full results API.
wolfram-alpha.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/SecretiveShell/MCP-wolfram-alpha && cd MCP-wolfram-alpha && pip install -r requirements.txt
wolfram-alpha.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and navigate into the directory. 2. Install the required dependencies using pip. 3. Set the WOLFRAM_API_KEY environment variable with your Wolfram Alpha API key. 4. Run the server using the command: uv --directory MCP-wolfram-alpha run MCP-wolfram-alpha. 5. For debugging, use the mcp-cli-inspector with a config.json file as described in the README.

rootly.name: Rootly MCP Server
rootly.description: An MCP server for the Rootly API that integrates with MCP-compatible editors like Cursor and Windsurf to resolve production incidents directly from the IDE.
rootly.usageInstructions: 1. Install Python 3.12 and uv. 2. Install the package using `uv pip install rootly-mcp-server`. 3. Set the `ROOTLY_API_TOKEN` environment variable with your Rootly API token. 4. Configure your MCP-compatible editor with the provided JSON configuration. 5. Optionally customize `allowed_paths` in `src/rootly_mcp_server/server.py` to expose additional API endpoints.

memos-py.name: MCP Server Memos
memos-py.description: A Python package that provides LLM models with the ability to interact with Memos server through the Model Context Protocol (MCP) interface.
memos-py.usageInstructions: To use this server, configure it in your MCP setup with the command `uvx mcp-server-memos --host [host] --port [port] --token [your-access-token]`. You can also run it directly via CLI or use it as a Python library. Required parameters include the Memos access token, while optional ones include host and port. The server provides tools for searching memos, creating new ones, retrieving memo content, and managing memo tags.

databricks.name: Databricks MCP Server
databricks.description: An MCP server for interacting with Databricks, leveraging Unity Catalog metadata and enabling comprehensive data lineage exploration.
databricks.usageInstructions: After installation, configure the server with your Databricks credentials. Run the server using the command provided in the README. Use the available tools and features to interact with Databricks Unity Catalog.

google-cse.name: Google Custom Search Engine MCP Server
google-cse.description: An MCP server providing search capabilities using Google Custom Search Engine, returning search results that can be combined with other tools for content extraction.
google-cse.usageInstructions: 1. Create a Google Custom Search Engine and obtain API_KEY and ENGINE_ID. 2. Configure Claude Desktop by adding 'mcp-google-cse' to claude_desktop_config.json with required env vars. 3. Run using 'uvx mcp-google-cse' or 'python -m mcp-google-cse' after pip installation.

infura.name: Infura MCP Server
infura.description: MCP server providing Ethereum blockchain access through Infura's infrastructure
infura.usageInstructions:
1. Get Infura API key from https://developer.metamask.io/
2. Configure in Claude Desktop or VS Code using provided JSON config
3. For Claude: Add to claude_desktop_config.json
4. For VS Code: Add to User Settings (JSON) or .vscode/mcp.json

minimax-tools.name: Minimax MCP Tools
minimax-tools.description: An MCP server implementation with Minimax API integration for AI-powered image generation and text-to-speech functionality.
minimax-tools.usageInstructions:
1. Ensure Node.js 16 or higher is installed.
2. Create or update MCP configuration file with 'minimax-mcp-tools' server configuration.
3. Set MINIMAX_API_KEY and MINIMAX_GROUP_ID environment variables in the config.
4. Run the server using 'npx minimax-mcp-tools'.

github-meta.name: GitHub MCP Server
github-meta.description: An MCP server for interacting with GitHub's API, supporting repository creation and management.
github-meta.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/PoliTwit1984/github-meta-mcp-server.git && cd github-meta-mcp-server && npm install && npm run build
github-meta.usageInstructions: 1. Configure GITHUB_TOKEN in MCP settings file. 2. Use tools like 'create_repo' with natural language commands to create or update GitHub repositories.

pipedream.name: Pipedream Integration Platform
pipedream.description: Pipedream is an integration platform for developers to connect apps and develop event-driven automations.
pipedream.usageInstructions: To get started, visit https://pipedream.com/docs/quickstart/ for workflow creation and configuration instructions. For support, visit https://pipedream.com/support.

fireflies.name: Fireflies MCP Server
fireflies.description: MCP Server for the Fireflies.ai API, enabling transcript retrieval, search, and summary generation.
fireflies.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/Props-Labs/fireflies-mcp && cd fireflies-mcp && npm install && npm run build
fireflies.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and install dependencies with `npm install` or `pnpm install`.
2. Build the project with `npm run build` or `pnpm build`.
3. Start the server with `FIREFLIES_API_KEY=your_api_key npm start` or `pnpm start`.
4. Integrate with Claude Desktop by adding the MCP server configuration to `claude_desktop_config.json` as described in the README.

mcpchartplotter.name: MCP Chart Plotter
mcpchartplotter.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides chart plotting functionality, likely for data visualization purposes.
mcpchartplotter.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/ReallyFloppyPenguin/MCPChartPlotter.git && cd MCPChartPlotter && uv run server.py
mcpchartplotter.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository using `git clone https://github.com/ReallyFloppyPenguin/MCPChartPlotter.git`.
2. Navigate to the cloned directory.
3. Use the provided JSON configuration with an IDE like Cursor to run the server using `uv run server.py`.
4. Ensure the correct path to the server directory is specified in the JSON command.

zonos-tts.name: Zonos TTS MCP Integration
zonos-tts.description: MCP integration for Zonos TTS, enabling Claude to generate speech directly through text-to-speech functionality.
zonos-tts.usageInstructions: 1. Ensure Zonos API is running. 2. Configure PulseAudio access. 3. Add server configuration to Claude's config.json file with the path to the compiled server.js. 4. Use speak_response() function in Claude to generate speech.

coincap.name: Coincap MCP
coincap.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that queries cryptocurrency information from Coincap's public API without requiring API keys or registration.
coincap.usageInstructions: 1. Add the Coincap MCP server configuration to your Claude Desktop config file. 2. Launch Claude Desktop. 3. Use prompts like 'What is the price of bitcoin?' or 'What are the available crypto assets?' to interact with the server. For local development, build the server using 'npm run build' and update the config file with the local path to the build.

pixverse.name: PixVerse MCP
pixverse.description: A tool that allows you to access PixVerse's latest video generation models via applications that support the Model Context Protocol (MCP), such as Claude or Cursor.
pixverse.usageInstructions: 1. Obtain a PixVerse API key from the PixVerse Platform. 2. Install Python 3.10+ and UV/UVX. 3. Configure your MCP client (e.g., Claude or Cursor) with the PixVerse MCP server command and API key in the configuration file. 4. Restart your MCP client and use text prompts to generate videos with optional parameters like quality, duration, and aspect ratio.

obsidian-rest.name: Obsidian MCP REST Server
obsidian-rest.description: An MCP server that provides access to Obsidian vaults through a local REST API, enabling AI assistants to interact with Obsidian notes and manage vault content.
obsidian-rest.usageInstructions:
1. Install the Local REST API plugin in Obsidian and generate an API key.
2. Create a config.json file with Obsidian API settings.
3. Start the server with: obsidian-mcp-rest --config path/to/config.json
4. Configure Claude Desktop or other AI assistants to use this MCP server with the specified command and arguments.

koboldcpp.name: Kobold MCP Server
koboldcpp.description: An MCP server implementation for KoboldAI integration, enabling text generation and chat completion capabilities.
koboldcpp.usageInstructions: Initialize the server using: const server = new KoboldMCPServer(); server.start(); Configuration can be passed as an object or through environment variables. Ensure Node.js (v16 or higher) and a running KoboldAI instance are available.

peliqan.name: Peliqan MCP Server
peliqan.description: MCP server for integrating with Peliqan services, enabling data fetch and writeback operations across various SaaS applications.
peliqan.usageInstructions: 1. Create a peliqan_config.json in your home folder with account_id and api_token. 2. Configure Claude Desktop by adding mcpServers entry to claude_desktop_config.json. 3. Set up API handler script in Peliqan and link it to a custom API endpoint.

paddle.name: Paddle MCP Server
paddle.description: MCP server for interacting with Paddle Billing API, providing tools for managing products, prices, customers, transactions, and subscriptions.
paddle.usageInstructions: To use the MCP server, create an API key in Paddle Developer tools. Configure the server in your MCP client using the command: 'npx -y @paddle/paddle-mcp --api-key=PADDLE_API_KEY --environment=(sandbox|production)'. For local development, run 'pnpm install' and 'pnpm build', then update your MCP config to use the local build.

deep-research.name: Open Deep Research MCP Server
deep-research.description: An AI-powered research assistant that performs deep, iterative research on any topic by combining search engines, web scraping, and AI to generate comprehensive reports.
deep-research.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/Ozamatash/deep-research && cd deep-research && npm install && npm run build
requiredEnvVars: Variables defined in .env.local, such as FIRECRAWL_BASE_URL if using local Firecrawl
deep-research.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies. 2. Create .env.local from .env.example. 3. Build the project using 'npm run build'. 4. Run the server using 'npm run start:http' for HTTP mode. 5. Configure Claude Desktop to use this MCP server.

odbc.name: MCP ODBC Server
odbc.description: An MCP server providing access to ODBC data sources via a Data Source Name configured for a specific ODBC Connector.
odbc.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/OpenLinkSoftware/mcp-odbc-server.git && cd mcp-odbc-server && npm init -y && npm install @modelcontextprotocol/sdk zod tsx odbc dotenv
odbc.usageInstructions: After installation, configure environment variables in a .env file. Use commands like get_schemas, get_tables, describe_table, and query_database to interact with the ODBC data source.

cmd.name: CMD MCP Server
cmd.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for executing CMD commands on both Windows and Linux, as well as allowing SSH connections.
optionalParams: Configuration options passed to MCPCmdServer constructor
Port or host settings if needed
cmd.usageInstructions: Import the MCPCmdServer class from 'server-cmd', initialize it with optional configuration, and call the start() method to begin the server. The server can be configured via environment variables or a configuration object. For development, clone the repository, install dependencies, and build the project using the provided npm scripts.

opendatamcp.name: Open Data Model Context Protocol
opendatamcp.description: A tool to connect open data sources to LLM applications, enabling access to public datasets and publishing them for broader use.
opendatamcp.usageInstructions: 1. Install `uv` as a prerequisite. 2. Use `uvx odmcp` to access available commands. 3. For publishing, clone the repository, set up a virtual environment, and implement a new provider module in `src/odmcp/providers/`.

encoding-devops.name: Encoding DevOps MCP Server
encoding-devops.description: An AI-powered Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that connects Anthropic's Claude to video encoding workflows, providing real-time analysis, error translation, and actionable solutions for encoding issues.
encoding-devops.installCommand: curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh && uv pip install encoding-devops
encoding-devops.usageInstructions:
1. Install the package using the provided command.
2. Copy the .env.example file to .env and add your API keys and configuration.
3. Register with Claude Desktop using 'uv run mcp install ./src/encoding_devops/main.py'.
4. Start the server with 'uv run mcp dev ./src/encoding_devops/main.py'.
5. Use the server in Claude Desktop to ask about encoding issues, request email drafts, or check job statuses.

web-eval-agent.name: operative.sh web-eval-agent MCP Server
web-eval-agent.description: An MCP server that autonomously evaluates and debugs web applications using a browser agent, capturing UX reports, console logs, and network traffic.
web-eval-agent.installCommand: curl -LSf https://operative.sh/install.sh -o install.sh && bash install.sh && rm install.sh
web-eval-agent.usageInstructions:
1. Obtain an API key from operative.sh/mcp.
2. Run the installation script provided.
3. Add the JSON configuration to your code editor (Cursor/Cline/Windsurf) with your API key.
4. Restart your code editor.
5. Use the chat interface to trigger the `web_eval_agent` tool with a task and URL, e.g., 'Test my app on http://localhost:3000. Use web-eval-agent.'

noves.name: Noves MCP Server
noves.description: An MCP server providing natural language blockchain data through Noves Intent service, supporting 100+ blockchain networks.
noves.usageInstructions: Add to Cursor configuration file (~/.cursor/mcp.json) and restart Cursor. The server supports various blockchain analysis tools and natural language queries about blockchain data.

pgyer.name: PGYER MCP Server
pgyer.description: PGYER MCP Server  iOS/Android  PGYER  Model Context Protocol (MCP)  ClaudeVSCode
pgyer.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/PGYER/pgyer-mcp-server.git && cd pgyer-mcp-server && npm install
pgyer.usageInstructions:
1.  Node.js  Docker 
2. 
3.  PGYER_API_KEY  PGYER API 
4.  Claude  VSCode 
5.  `upload-app``list-my-apps`  `get-app-info-by-shortcut`

npm-sentinel.name: NPM Sentinel MCP
npm-sentinel.description: A powerful MCP server for AI-assisted NPM package analysis, providing security, dependency, and performance insights.
npm-sentinel.usageInstructions: To use with VS Code, add the server configuration to your MCP config file. For Claude Desktop, modify claude_desktop_config.json with the provided server configuration. The server can also be run using Docker with the nekzus/npm-sentinel-mcp image.

sar.name: AWS Service Reference MCP Server
sar.description: MCP server providing tools to interact with AWS Programmatic Service Reference, allowing listing of AWS services and details about their API actions.
sar.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/MitchyBAwesome/sar-mcp.git && cd sar-mcp && python -m venv .venv && source .venv/bin/activate && pip install -r requirements.txt
sar.usageInstructions:
1. Run the server: python aws_service_reference.py
2. Configure Claude Desktop by adding server configuration to claude_desktop_config.json
3. Restart Claude Desktop
4. Use tools like list_aws_services, get_service_actions, get_action_condition_keys, get_action_resource_types, get_action_properties

minimax-js.name: MiniMax MCP JS
minimax-js.description: JavaScript/TypeScript implementation of MiniMax MCP providing image generation, video generation, text-to-speech, and more.
minimax-js.usageInstructions: 1. Get API key from MiniMax International Platform. 2. Configure MCP client (Claude Desktop or Cursor) with appropriate environment variables. 3. Start server using 'npx minimax-mcp-js' or through client configuration.

raygun.name: Raygun MCP Server
raygun.description: MCP Server for Raygun's API V3 endpoints, providing access to Crash Reporting and Real User Monitoring applications through the Model Context Protocol.
raygun.usageInstructions:
1. Install using the command: npx -y @raygun.io/mcp-server-raygun
2. Set the RAYGUN_PAT_TOKEN environment variable with your Raygun PAT token.
3. Optionally configure SOURCEMAP_ALLOWED_DIRS for source map operations.
4. Add the server configuration to your claude_desktop_config.json file as shown in the README.

github-oauth.name: MCP-Github-Oauth
github-oauth.description: An MCP server implementation for GitHub OAuth integration, enabling authentication and tool registration for the Claude desktop app.
github-oauth.installCommand: curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh && uv pip install -r requirements.txt
github-oauth.usageInstructions: 1. Install uv as described in the README. 2. Set up the claude_desktop_config.json file with the correct command and directory path. 3. Set required environment variables (GITHUB_CLIENT_ID, GITHUB_CLIENT_SECRET, REDIRECT_URI). 4. Run the server using 'uv --directory src/github_oauth run server.py'. 5. Use the MCP Inspector for debugging with 'npx @modelcontextprotocol/inspector uv --directory [project_dir] run github-oauth'.

octagon.name: Octagon MCP Server
octagon.description: The Octagon MCP server provides specialized AI-powered financial research and analysis by integrating with the Octagon Market Intelligence API, enabling users to analyze public filings, earnings call transcripts, financial metrics, stock market data, and private market transactions.
octagon.usageInstructions:
1. Sign up for an Octagon API key at https://app.octagonai.co/signup/
2. Set the OCTAGON_API_KEY environment variable with your API key.
3. Run the server using `npx -y octagon-mcp` or `npm install -g octagon-mcp` followed by `octagon-mcp`.
4. Configure the server in supported clients like Claude Desktop, Cursor, or Windsurf by adding the MCP server configuration with the API key.
5. Use the available agents for financial research, such as SEC filings analysis, earnings call transcripts, financial metrics, stock data, and private market research.

nebulablock.name: NebulaBlock API MCP Server
nebulablock.description: The NebulaBlock API Model Context Protocol (MCP) server integrates with the fastmcp library to expose NebulaBlock API functionalities as accessible tools in any MCP-compatible environment.
nebulablock.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/Nebula-Block-Data/nebulablock-mcp-server && cd nebulablock-mcp-server && python3 -m venv .venv && source .venv/bin/activate && uv pip install -e .
nebulablock.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and activate a virtual environment. 2. Install dependencies using `uv pip install -e .`. 3. Set the NEBULA_BLOCK_API_KEY in a `.env` file or use the `--api-key` command-line argument. 4. Run the server with `uv run -m src.main`. 5. Configure an MCP client to connect to this server using the provided `settings.json` example.

bloodhound-ai.name: BloodHound-MCP
bloodhound-ai.description: BloodHound-MCP integrates the Model Context Protocol (MCP) with BloodHound to enable natural language querying of Active Directory attack paths and security analysis.
bloodhound-ai.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/MorDavid/BloodHound-MCP-AI.git && cd BloodHound-MCP-AI && pip install -r requirements.txt
bloodhound-ai.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies using pip. 2. Configure the MCP Server with the required environment variables for Neo4j connection. 3. Run the BloodHound-MCP server using the provided command. 4. Query the server using natural language for Active Directory analysis.

minimax.name: MiniMax Model Context Protocol (MCP) Server
minimax.description: Official MiniMax Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables interaction with Text to Speech, video/image generation, and other APIs for MCP clients like Claude Desktop, Cursor, and Windsurf.
minimax.usageInstructions: 1. Get your API key from MiniMax (https://www.minimax.io/platform/user-center/basic-information/interface-key). 2. Install uv (Python package manager) using `curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh`. 3. Configure the API host and key in your MCP client (e.g., Claude Desktop or Cursor) with the required environment variables. 4. Ensure the API key matches the host to avoid 'Invalid API key' errors.

klaudium.name: MCP Klaudium
klaudium.description: An enhanced MCP memory server with dynamic compression and context management features.
klaudium.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/MilosBastaja/mcp-klaudium.git && cd mcp-klaudium && npm install
klaudium.usageInstructions: After installation, start the server by running 'npm start'. The server provides RESTful API endpoints for managing entities and relations. Configuration can be done through environment variables.

consulting-agents.name: ConsultingAgents MCP Server
consulting-agents.description: An MCP server providing AI consulting agents for code analysis and problem solving through multiple AI models.
consulting-agents.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/MatthewPDingle/consulting-agents-mcp.git && cd consulting-agents-mcp && python -m venv mcp_venv && source mcp_venv/bin/activate && pip install -r requirements.txt
consulting-agents.usageInstructions:
1. Create .env file with API keys
2. Start server with ./start_mcp_server.sh
3. Register with Claude Code using: claude mcp add ConsultingAgents /absolute/path/to/consulting-agents-mcp/start_mcp_server.sh
4. Start Claude Code with --mcp-debug flag

gsuite.name: Google Workspace MCP Server
gsuite.description: MCP server for interacting with Google products including Gmail and Calendar
gsuite.usageInstructions:
1. Create OAuth2 credentials in Google Cloud Console
2. Create .gauth.json with client credentials
3. Create .accounts.json with account information
4. Configure Claude Desktop to use the MCP server

yt-description.name: YouTube Transcript Extractor MCP
yt-description.description: An MCP server that extracts transcripts from YouTube videos for AI assistants.
yt-description.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/MalikElate/yt-description-mcp.git && cd yt-description-mcp && pnpm install && pnpm run build
yt-description.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies. 2. Configure the MCP server in Cursor or Claude Desktop with the command 'node /absolute/path/to/build/index.js'. 3. Use the AI assistant to extract transcripts by providing a YouTube video URL.

sentry.name: Sentry MCP Server
sentry.description: A Model Context Protocol server for retrieving and analyzing issues from Sentry.io, providing tools to inspect error reports and stacktraces.
sentry.usageInstructions: After installation, configure Claude Desktop by adding the server details to claude_desktop_config.json with your Sentry credentials. Alternatively, use with Zed by modifying settings.json.

templateio.name: MCP TemplateIO Image Generation Tool
templateio.description: An MCP server for image generation using Templated.io API
templateio.usageInstructions:
1. Install dependencies: npm install
2. Build the project: npm run build
3. Configure Claude Desktop config file with the server path and TEMPLATED_API_KEY
4. For local development, use 'node /absolute/path/to/mcp-templateio/dist/index.js'

clever-doc.name: Clever Cloud Documentation MCP Server
clever-doc.description: An MCP server that exposes Clever Cloud's documentation using FastMCP, allowing integration with MCP clients like Claude Desktop.
clever-doc.usageInstructions: To use this server in an MCP client, configure it with the command `npx -y mcp-clever-demo`. For development and testing, use `npx fastmcp dev src/index.ts` to run the server with mcp-cli, or `npx fastmcp inspect src/index.ts` to inspect it with the MCP Inspector.

dbt-cli.name: DBT CLI MCP Server
dbt-cli.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that wraps the dbt CLI tool, enabling AI coding agents to interact with dbt projects through standardized MCP tools.
dbt-cli.installCommand: git clone --recurse-submodules https://github.com/MammothGrowth/dbt-cli-mcp.git && cd dbt-cli-mcp && uv venv && source .venv/bin/activate && uv pip install -e .
dbt-cli.usageInstructions: After installation, use the CLI to run dbt commands through the MCP server. For example: `dbt-mcp run --models customers --project-dir /path/to/project`. Ensure the `project_dir` parameter is an absolute path to your dbt project directory. Configure the server with environment variables like `DBT_PATH`, `ENV_FILE`, and `DBT_PROFILES_DIR`. For integration with MCP clients, configure the server command and environment variables in the client's configuration file.

ta-tool.name: LumiFAI MCP Technical Analysis Server
ta-tool.description: A FastMCP server providing technical analysis tools for cryptocurrency trading data, focusing on EMA calculations for Binance pairs with MongoDB integration.
ta-tool.installCommand: git clone <repository-url> && cd lumifai-mcp-ta && uv sync
ta-tool.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and navigate into the project directory. 2. Create a `.env` file with the MONGODB_URI set to your MongoDB connection string. 3. Run the server using `uv run mcp-server.py`. 4. Use the available tools: `get_emas(agent_name, time_ago, interval, interval_frequency)` for EMA calculations and `get_date_time()` for current date/time.

mcpfoundrydev.name: Foundry VTT MCP
mcpfoundrydev.description: A structured developer prompt for creating Foundry VTT modules using best practices.
mcpfoundrydev.installCommand: No installation required, download the .mcp file directly
mcpfoundrydev.usageInstructions: To use this MCP server, download the foundry-mcp.mcp file from the GitHub repository and follow the instructions for integrating it with your Foundry VTT development environment.

db-navigator.name: MySQL Navigator MCP
db-navigator.description: A powerful MySQL/MariaDB database navigation tool using MCP (Model Control Protocol) for easy database querying and management.
db-navigator.usageInstructions:
1. Install the package using 'pip install mcp-db-navigator'.
2. Create a .env file with your database credentials (DB_HOST, DB_PORT, DB_NAME, DB_USER, DB_PASSWORD).
3. Run the MCP server using 'mcp-db --config /path/to/your/project/.env'.
4. For advanced usage, configure the server in Cursor or Claude Desktop by specifying the 'mcp-db' command with the '--config' argument pointing to your .env file.

ghost.name: Ghost MCP Server
ghost.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for interacting with Ghost CMS through LLM interfaces like Claude. It provides secure and comprehensive access to your Ghost blog, leveraging JWT authentication and a rich set of MCP tools for managing posts, users, members, tiers, offers, and newsletters.

tmdb.name: TMDB MCP Server
tmdb.description: MCP server integrating with The Movie Database (TMDB) API for movie information and recommendations
tmdb.usageInstructions: 1. Get TMDB API key from https://www.themoviedb.org/. 2. Configure Claude Desktop by adding server details to ~/Library/Application Support/Claude/config.json. 3. Use commands like 'Search for movies about artificial intelligence' or 'Get trending movies today'

speech.name: Speech MCP
speech.description: A Goose MCP extension for voice interaction with modern audio visualization, providing speech-to-text and text-to-speech capabilities.
speech.usageInstructions: 1. Install PortAudio according to your OS instructions. 2. Run 'uv pip install -e .[all]' to install with all features. 3. Configure voice preferences through the UI or by setting SPEECH_MCP_TTS_VOICE environment variable.

vikingdb.name: VikingDB MCP Server
vikingdb.description: An MCP server for VikingDB store and search functionality
vikingdb.usageInstructions: After installation, configure Claude Desktop by editing claude_desktop_config.json with the appropriate command and args. For development, use 'uv sync' to sync dependencies, 'uv build' to build distributions, and 'uv publish' to publish to PyPI.

ens.name: ENS MCP Server
ens.description: MCP Server for Ethereum Name Service (ENS) that enables resolving names, checking availability, and retrieving records.
ens.usageInstructions: 1. Configure Ethereum providers by creating a .env file with PROVIDER_URL (optional). Defaults will be used if not set. 2. Add the server configuration to claude_desktop_config.json using either npx or local script method. 3. Verify Ethereum providers are working and accessible if you encounter errors.

mac-apps-launcher.name: Mac Apps Launcher MCP Server
mac-apps-launcher.description: An MCP server for launching and managing macOS applications.
mac-apps-launcher.usageInstructions: Add the server configuration to your Claude Config JSON file as shown in the README. The server manages applications in the /Applications folder.

simulator.name: iOS Simulator MCP Server
simulator.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides programmatic control over iOS simulators through a standardized interface.

jina-ai.name: Jina AI MCP Server
jina-ai.description: An MCP server that provides access to Jina AI's powerful web services through Claude, offering tools for web page reading, web search, and fact checking.
optionalParams: image retention and alt text generation
jina-ai.usageInstructions: 1. Obtain a Jina AI API key from https://jina.ai/. 2. Install the server using the recommended method: `npx -y @smithery/cli install jina-ai-mcp-server --client claude`. 3. Add the server configuration to your Claude Desktop config file with the `JINA_API_KEY` environment variable set. 4. Use the tools `read_webpage`, `search_web`, and `fact_check` to interact with Jina AI's web services.

deep-reasoning.name: Deep Reasoning Server
deep-reasoning.description: Model Context Protocol (MCP)  deepseek-r1  MCP Clients Cursor

markitdown.name: MarkItDown MCP Server
markitdown.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that converts various file formats to Markdown using the MarkItDown utility.
markitdown.usageInstructions:
1. Install the server using the provided command.
2. Configure it with an MCP client like Zed Editor by specifying the server command in the client's settings.
3. Use the `/md <file>` command to convert files to Markdown.
4. Ensure the server is running and accessible to the client.

appinsightmcp.name: App Market Intelligence MCP
appinsightmcp.description: An MCP server providing market intelligence by analyzing data from Apple App Store and Google Play Store.
appinsightmcp.usageInstructions: Start the MCP server using 'node src/server.js'. Configure in Claude Desktop by adding to claude_desktop_config.json. Supports Docker installation.

jira-python.name: MCP JIRA Python
jira-python.description: A Python implementation of an MCP server for JIRA integration, providing tools to manage JIRA issues, comments, attachments, and relationships.
jira-python.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/kallows/mcp-jira-python.git && cd mcp-jira-python && pip install -r requirements.txt
jira-python.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies. 2. Set the required environment variables (JIRA_HOST, JIRA_EMAIL, JIRA_API_TOKEN). 3. Configure the server in claude_desktop_config.json with the correct command and directory path. 4. Restart Claude Desktop to enable the server. 5. Use the provided tools to interact with JIRA via the MCP interface.

inspector-v0.6.0.name: MCP-Inspector-v0.6.0 GitHub MCP Server
inspector-v0.6.0.description: An MCP server enabling AI assistants to interact with GitHub repositories, issues, and pull requests.
inspector-v0.6.0.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/yourusername/github-mcp-server.git && cd github-mcp-server && pip install -r requirements.txt
inspector-v0.6.0.usageInstructions:
1. Set GITHUB_TOKEN environment variable: export GITHUB_TOKEN=your_github_token_here
2. Run the server: python server.py
3. Use endpoints like GET /mcp/discover and POST /mcp/execute

markdownify-utf8.name: Markdownify MCP Server - UTF-8 Enhanced
markdownify-utf8.description: An enhanced version of Markdownify MCP with improved UTF-8 encoding support and multilingual content handling.
markdownify-utf8.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/JDJR2024/markdownify-mcp-utf8.git && cd markdownify-mcp-utf8 && pnpm install && pnpm run build
markdownify-utf8.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and cd into it.
2. Install dependencies using 'pnpm install'.
3. Build the project with 'pnpm run build'.
4. Start the server using 'pnpm start'.
5. Use 'python convert_utf8.py <url or file path>' to convert content to Markdown.

ingeniux-cms.name: Ingeniux CMS MCP Server
ingeniux-cms.description: MCP server for integrating Ingeniux CMS with Cline IDE, providing CMS operations through natural language commands.
ingeniux-cms.usageInstructions: 1. Install using 'npm install -g ingeniux-cms-mcp-server@latest'. 2. Configure mcp.json with server details and environment variables. 3. Restart Cline IDE. 4. Use natural language commands in Cline agent chat to invoke CMS operations.

dingdingbot.name: MCP DingDing Bot Server
dingdingbot.description: An MCP server application that sends various types of messages to DingDing group robots.
dingdingbot.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/HundunOnline/mcp-dingdingbot-server.git && cd mcp-dingdingbot-server && make build && sudo ln -s $PWD/dist/mcp-dingdingbot-server_xxx_xxxx /usr/local/bin/mcp-dingdingbot-server
dingdingbot.usageInstructions: Configure the server by setting the required environment variables. Use the command 'mcp-dingdingbot-server' to start the server. Refer to the configuration guide for DingDing group robot setup: https://open.dingtalk.com/document/robots/custom-robot-access

command-proxy.name: MCP Command Proxy
command-proxy.description: An MCP server that acts as a proxy for CLI commands, specifically designed for Expo development but adaptable for any command-line application.
command-proxy.usageInstructions: To use: 1) Run `mcp-command-proxy --prefix 'ServerName' --command 'your_command'` 2) Configure Cursor settings: MCP -> +Add new MCP server with URL http://localhost:port/sse 3) Use MCP tools like getRecentLogs and sendKeyPress

find-similar-github-issues.name: GitHub Support Assistant
find-similar-github-issues.description: An MCP server that helps support engineers find similar GitHub issues to speed up troubleshooting.
find-similar-github-issues.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/Jake-Mok-Nelson/mcp-find-similar-github-issues && cd mcp-find-similar-github-issues && npm install
find-similar-github-issues.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies with 'npm install'. 2. Set your GitHub token as an environment variable. 3. Build the server with 'npm run build'. 4. Integrate with Claude by updating the configuration file to include the server path. 5. Use the 'find-similar-issues' tool by providing repository owner, name, issue description, and optional max results.

linkedin.name: MCP Server for LinkedIn
linkedin.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for LinkedIn to seamlessly apply for jobs, search through the feed, and retrieve user profiles using an unofficial LinkedIn API.
linkedin.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/Hritik003/linkedin-mcp && cd linkedin-mcp && pip install -r requirements.txt
linkedin.usageInstructions: After installation, configure the server by setting the required environment variables (LINKEDIN_EMAIL and LINKEDIN_PASSWORD). Use the provided configuration file to adjust the LOCAL_PATH and run the linkedin.py script. Test the server using the MCP-client for job search, profile retrieval, and feed post fetching.

resend.name: Resend MCP Server
resend.description: An MCP server for the Resend API that allows LLMs to compose and send emails.
resend.usageInstructions:
1. Sign up for a Resend account and generate an API key.
2. Set the required environment variables: RESEND_API_KEY and SENDER_EMAIL_ADDRESS.
3. Optionally set REPLY_TO_EMAIL_ADDRESSES if needed.
4. Run the server using the install command provided.
5. Use the `send_email` tool to send emails via the Resend API with the specified parameters.

clicksend.name: ClickSend MCP Server
clicksend.description: An MCP server that enables AI models to send SMS messages and initiate Text-to-Speech (TTS) calls using ClickSend's API.
clicksend.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/J-Gal02/clicksend-mcp.git && cd clicksend-mcp && npm install && npm run build
clicksend.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies. 2. Build the project with 'npm run build'. 3. Add the server configuration to your MCP client's settings file (e.g., cline_mcp_settings.json) with the correct path to the build folder and your ClickSend credentials. 4. Use the 'send_sms' and 'make_tts_call' tools with valid phone numbers and message content. 5. The server enforces a rate limit of 5 actions per minute.

readwise.name: Readwise MCP Server
readwise.description: An MCP server that provides access to Readwise library highlights and documents, with integration for Claude and other MCP-compatible assistants.
readwise.usageInstructions:
1. Get your Readwise API key from https://readwise.io/access_token
2. Run 'npm run setup' or start with --api-key YOUR_API_KEY
3. Start the server with 'readwise-mcp' for stdio transport or 'readwise-mcp --transport sse --port 3000' for SSE
4. Use the MCP Inspector with './scripts/inspector.sh' or 'npm run inspector' for testing
5. Available tools: get_highlights, get_books, get_documents, search_highlights
6. Available prompts: readwise_highlight, readwise_search

matter-ai.name: Matter AI MCP Server
matter-ai.description: Matter AI MCP Server provides code review tools, implementation planning, and pull request generation for AI agents in IDEs.
matter-ai.usageInstructions:
1. Obtain API key from https://app.matterai.dev/settings
2. Create MCP configuration file with API key
3. Run server using 'python server.py'
4. Connect to http://localhost:9000/sse from supported IDEs

hana.name: HANA Cloud MCP Server
hana.description: MCP server implementation for SAP HANA Cloud DB integration with Cursor IDE, providing model registry, context management, and protocol adapters.
hana.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/HatriGt/hana-mcp-server.git && cd hana-mcp-server && python -m venv venv && source venv/bin/activate && pip install -r requirements.txt && python setup.py
hana.usageInstructions: After installation, configure your HANA Cloud connection by following the setup script prompts. The server uses a .env file for additional configuration. Ensure you have Python3.8+, SAP HANA Cloud Database, Flask, HDBCLI, and Pandas installed.

yolo.name: YOLO MCP Service
yolo.description: A powerful YOLO computer vision service integrating with Claude AI through Model Context Protocol (MCP) for object detection, segmentation, and classification.
yolo.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/GongRzhe/YOLO-MCP-Server.git . && python -m venv .venv && source .venv/bin/activate && python setup.py
yolo.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and navigate to it.
2. Create and activate a virtual environment.
3. Run 'python setup.py' to install dependencies and generate MCP configuration.
4. Download YOLO models to the models directory.
5. Configure Claude Desktop by merging the generated configuration into your Claude Desktop configuration file.

quickchart.name: Quickchart MCP Server
quickchart.description: An MCP server for generating charts using QuickChart.io
quickchart.usageInstructions: 1. Install using npm install @gongrzhe/quickchart-mcp-server. 2. Configure Claude Desktop by adding server config to claude_desktop_config.json. 3. Use 'generate_chart' or 'download_chart' tools with appropriate Chart.js configuration.

keitaro.name: Keitaro TDS API MCP Plugin
keitaro.description: MCP server for integration with Keitaro TDS API, providing tools to work with campaigns, streams, offers, and other Keitaro entities.
keitaro.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/GodzillaDancer/keitaro-mcp.git && cd mcp-keitaro-tds && npm install && npm install -g . && node install-cursor-plugin.js
keitaro.usageInstructions:
1. Create .env file with KEITARO_API_URL and KEITARO_API_KEY
2. Configure Cursor MCP configuration file (~/.cursor/mcp.json)
3. Launch Cursor and select Keitaro from command palette

handwriting-ocr.name: Handwriting OCR MCP Server
handwriting-ocr.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) Server that integrates with the Handwriting OCR API to enable document transcription via OCR, allowing users to upload images/PDFs, check status, and retrieve OCR results as Markdown.
handwriting-ocr.usageInstructions: 1. Install Node.js (18.x or higher). 2. Create an account on the Handwriting OCR Platform and obtain an API token. 3. Set the API_TOKEN environment variable with your token. 4. Use the server to upload documents, check status, and retrieve OCR results as Markdown.

dubco.name: Dub.co MCP Server
