dubco.description: An MCP server for interacting with the Dub.co link shortener API, allowing AI agents to create, update, and manage short links.
dubco.usageInstructions: After installation, configure the server in your MCP configuration with the DUBCO_API_KEY environment variable. Use the provided tools (create_link, update_link, upsert_link, delete_link) to manage short links via Dub.co. Ensure you have a Dub.co account and API key before use.

redis.name: Redis MCP Server
redis.description: A Redis Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for interacting with Redis databases. It enables LLMs to interact with Redis key-value stores through a set of standardized tools.
redis.usageInstructions: To use the Redis MCP Server, run the installation command with the Redis connection URL. For advanced usage, configure the server in the 'mcpServers' section of your 'claude_desktop_config.json' file. For Docker usage, use the provided Docker command with the Redis URL. Ensure Redis is running and accessible at the specified host and port.

audio.name: Audio MCP Server
audio.description: An MCP server that provides audio input/output capabilities for AI assistants like Claude, enabling microphone recording, speaker playback, and audio file handling.
audio.usageInstructions: 1. Install via Smithery with the provided command or manually clone the repository and install dependencies. 2. Configure the server in Claude Desktop's configuration file with the correct paths. 3. Restart Claude Desktop and use the hammer icon to access audio tools. 4. Use commands like 'list_audio_devices', 'record_audio', 'play_latest_recording', and 'play_audio_file' to interact with the server.

pulsar.name: Pulsar MCP Server
pulsar.description: An MCP server for Apache Pulsar that provides tools to interact with Pulsar clusters through MCP-compatible clients.
pulsar.usageInstructions: After installation, run 'pulsar-mcp-server'. Configure using environment variables or a .env file. For Cursor MCP usage, add configuration to ~/.cursor/mcp.json.

wolframalpha-llm.name: WolframAlpha LLM MCP Server
wolframalpha-llm.description: An MCP server providing access to WolframAlpha's LLM API for querying various domains and getting structured responses.
wolframalpha-llm.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/Garoth/wolframalpha-llm-mcp.git && cd wolframalpha-llm-mcp && npm install
wolframalpha-llm.usageInstructions: 1. Get WolframAlpha API key from developer.wolframalpha.com. 2. Configure in Cline MCP settings.json: 'env': {'WOLFRAM_LLM_APP_ID': 'your-api-key'} with command: 'node' and args: ['/path/to/build/index.js']. 3. Run using configured settings in VSCode.

focus.name: Focus Data MCP Server
focus.description: An MCP server enabling AI assistants to query data results from DataFocus using natural language.
focus.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/FocusSearch/focus_mcp_data.git && cd focus_mcp_data && gradle clean && gradle bootJar
focus.usageInstructions: 1. Register on DataFocus and obtain bearer token. 2. Clone repository and build using gradle. 3. Configure MCP settings in ~/AppData/Roaming/Code/User/globalStorage/saoudrizwan.claude-dev/settings/cline_mcp_settings.json with command: java -jar path/to/focus_mcp_data/focus_mcp_data.jar

systemprompt-notion.name: SystemPrompt MCP Notion Server
systemprompt-notion.description: A high-performance MCP server integrating Notion into AI workflows, enabling AI agents to interact with Notion pages and databases.
systemprompt-notion.usageInstructions: 1. Install via Smithery or npm. 2. Create a .env file with SYSTEMPROMPT_API_KEY and NOTION_API_KEY. 3. Configure MCP client to use the server.

systemprompt-gmail.name: Systemprompt MCP Gmail Server
systemprompt-gmail.description: A specialized MCP server for Gmail integration with AI Agent capabilities
systemprompt-gmail.usageInstructions:
1. Generate base64 encoded GOOGLE_CREDENTIALS and GOOGLE_TOKEN using the script from https://github.com/Ejb503/multimodal-mcp-client/blob/master/scripts/google-auth/README.md 
2. Set GOOGLE_CREDENTIALS and GOOGLE_TOKEN as environment variables 
3. Get API_KEY from https://systemprompt.io/console and set it as an environment variable 
4. Run the server using 'npx -y systemprompt-mcp-gmail'

systemprompt-core.name: Systemprompt Agent Server
systemprompt-core.description: A specialized Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for creating, managing, and extending AI agents through a powerful prompt and tool management system.
systemprompt-core.usageInstructions:
1. Get an API key from https://systemprompt.io/console.
2. Install the server using the provided install command.
3. Set the API_KEY environment variable with your key.
4. Configure the server to work with the multimodal-mcp-client for full functionality.
5. Use the server to manage AI agents, system prompts, and tools via MCP.

math.name: Math-MCP
math.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides basic mathematical and statistical functions to Large Language Models (LLMs).
math.usageInstructions: After installation, add the server to your MCP configuration file with the command and path to the server's index.js file. The server provides functions like add, subtract, multiply, division, sum, average, min, max, floor, ceiling, and round for numerical calculations.

for-mas-developments.name: privateGPT MCP Server
for-mas-developments.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that bridges MCP clients with privateGPT, enabling secure chat, knowledge source management, and group-based permissions.
for-mas-developments.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/Fujitsu-AI/MCP-Server-for-MAS-Developments.git && cd MCP-Server-for-MAS-Developments && pip install -r requirements.txt
for-mas-developments.usageInstructions: After installation, configure the server using the `config.yaml` file. Set required environment variables like API keys and encryption keys. Start the server with `python main.py`. Use an MCP-compatible client to connect and interact with privateGPT through the server.

sketchfab.name: Sketchfab MCP Server
sketchfab.description: A microservice for interacting with the Sketchfab API using MCP, allowing model search and download.
sketchfab.usageInstructions: 1. Create a Sketchfab account. 2. Get your API token from https://sketchfab.com/settings/password. 3. Set SKETCHFAB_API_TOKEN environment variable with your token. Alternatively, use Docker: docker build -t sketchfab-mcp . && docker run -it --rm -p8000:8000 -e SKETCHFAB_API_TOKEN=YOUR_TOKEN sketchfab-mcp

systemprompt-interview.name: systemprompt-mcp-interview
systemprompt-interview.description: A specialized Model Context Protocol (MCP) server enabling AI-powered interview roleplay scenarios with interactive voice interface.
systemprompt-interview.usageInstructions: 1. Connect the MCP server in your systemprompt.io console. 2. Add a CV in text format using the summarize_cv tool. 3. List CVs and copy the URI of the resource. 4. Configure the interview using the configure_interview tool with the resource URI and your instructions. 5. Activate the agent to start the roleplay interview. Demo videos are available for setup and demonstration.

pocketbase.name: Advanced PocketBase MCP Server
pocketbase.description: A comprehensive MCP server providing advanced tools for interacting with PocketBase databases, including schema management, data manipulation, and full Cloudflare Workers support for serverless deployment.
pocketbase.usageInstructions: 1. Set required environment variables (POCKETBASE_API_URL, POCKETBASE_ADMIN_TOKEN, SMTP credentials). 2. Optionally configure Stripe and Cloudflare for advanced features. 3. Run the server using `npm start`. 4. Use MCP tools for database operations, email management, and payment processing. 5. For Cloudflare deployment, configure `wrangler.toml` and deploy with `wrangler publish`.

huntress.name: Huntress API MCP Server
huntress.description: An MCP server providing programmatic access to Huntress API functionality including account management, organization management, and incident reports.
huntress.usageInstructions: 1. Install via Smithery CLI or manual installation. 2. For manual installation: Clone the repository, run 'npm install', create .env file with HUNTRESS_API_KEY and HUNTRESS_API_SECRET, then run 'npm run build'. 3. Configure MCP settings with server command and environment variables.

automated-bod-25-01-cisa-microsoft-polic.name: CISA M365 MCP Server
automated-bod-25-01-cisa-microsoft-polic.description: MCP server implementing CISA BOD25-01 security controls for Microsoft365
automated-bod-25-01-cisa-microsoft-polic.usageInstructions: 1. Configure Azure AD application with required permissions. 2. Create .env file with TENANT_ID, CLIENT_ID, and CLIENT_SECRET. 3. Configure MCP settings in JSON file. 4. Use available tools like block_legacy_auth, enforce_phishing_resistant_mfa.

docswrite.name: Docswrite MCP Server
docswrite.description: An MCP server that integrates Google Docs and WordPress through Docswrite, enabling document creation, publishing, and management.
docswrite.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/Docswrite/docswrite-mcp.git && cd docswrite-mcp && npm install && npm run build
docswrite.usageInstructions: 1. Create a Google Cloud Project and enable Google Docs API and Google Drive API. 2. Configure OAuth2 credentials and save as credentials.json. 3. Run the server with: node dist/index.js --docswriteToken=your-docswrite-token

meta.name: Meta MCP Server
meta.description: A tool for dynamically generating customized MCP servers by specifying directories and files to be created, with support for automated file management and MCP tool integration.
meta.usageInstructions: 1. Install using the command: npx -y meta-mcp-server. 2. Configure by specifying directories and files to be created. 3. Utilize the MCP SDK for tool integration. 4. Enable debugging support for detailed logging.

polygon.name: Polygon MCP Server
polygon.description: An MCP server providing seamless integration with the Polygon blockchain network for AI assistants.
polygon.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/Dbillionaer/polygon-mcp.git && cd polygon-mcp && npm install
polygon.usageInstructions:
1. Create a .env file with required environment variables.
2. Run 'npm start' to start the server.
3. Use provided API methods like 'getAddress()', 'listBalances()', 'transferFunds()' for wallet operations.

canvas-lms.name: Canvas MCP Server
canvas-lms.description: A comprehensive Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Canvas LMS with complete student, instructor, and account administration functionality
canvas-lms.usageInstructions: 1. Install using 'npm install -g canvas-mcp-server'. 2. Set CANVAS_API_TOKEN and CANVAS_DOMAIN environment variables. 3. Run 'canvas-mcp-server'. For Docker: 'docker run -d --name canvas-mcp -e CANVAS_API_TOKEN="your_token" -e CANVAS_DOMAIN="school.instructure.com" ghcr.io/dmontgomery40/mcp-canvas-lms:latest'

alphavantagemcpserver.name: Alphavantage MCP Server
alphavantagemcpserver.description: An MCP server for the Alphavantage stock market data API, enabling integration with tools like Claude Desktop.
alphavantagemcpserver.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/DonMorr/AlphavantageMCPServer && cd AlphavantageMCPServer && uv pip install -r requirements.txt
alphavantagemcpserver.usageInstructions:
1. Sign up for a free Alphavantage API key at https://www.alphavantage.co/support/#api-key.
2. Set the `ALPHAVANTAGE_API_KEY` environment variable with your key.
3. Configure the server in your `claude_desktop_config.json` as shown in the README with the correct directory path.
4. Run the server using the specified command in the configuration.

cloudflare-github-backup.name: Cloudflare to GitHub Backup MCP Server
cloudflare-github-backup.description: An MCP server that backs up Cloudflare projects to a GitHub repository.
cloudflare-github-backup.usageInstructions:
1. Install the server using the provided install command.
2. Configure the `cline_mcp_settings.json` file with your Cloudflare API token, GitHub access token, and repository name.
3. Restart the VS Code extension to start the MCP server.
4. Use the `use_mcp_tool` tool to call the `backup_projects` function to initiate the backup process.

hal.name: HAL (HTTP API Layer)
hal.description: HAL is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides HTTP API capabilities to Large Language Models. It allows LLMs to make HTTP requests and interact with web APIs through a secure, controlled interface.
hal.usageInstructions: HAL is designed to work with MCP-compatible clients. To use it, add HAL to your MCP configuration with the command `npx hal-mcp`. For Swagger/OpenAPI integration, set the `HAL_SWAGGER_FILE` and `HAL_API_BASE_URL` environment variables. Secrets can be managed using `HAL_SECRET_*` variables and referenced in requests using `{secrets.key}` syntax. HAL provides secure secret management and URL restrictions for enhanced security.

netlify.name: Netlify MCP Server
netlify.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Netlify, providing comprehensive access to all Netlify CLI features through the latest MCP SDK and Netlify CLI.
netlify.usageInstructions:
1. Set required environment variables: NETLIFY_AUTH_TOKEN and NETLIFY_SITE_ID.
2. Optionally configure PORT, DEBUG, or other optional parameters.
3. Run the server using the installed CLI command.
4. Use the provided tools to interact with Netlify resources and manage deployments, functions, and analytics.

coresignal.name: Coresignal MCP Server
coresignal.description: Enables AI applications to access B2B data about companies, employees, and job postings via a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server
coresignal.usageInstructions:
1. Install Node.js
2. Run 'npm install -g mcp-remote@0.0.22' to install the client
3. Configure with the provided JSON format in your MCP client configuration
4. Replace '<api_key>' with your actual API key
5. Connect to https://mcp.coresignal.com/sse using the configured client

3d-printer.name: MCP 3D Printer Server
3d-printer.description: An MCP server that connects to 3D printer management systems like OctoPrint, Klipper, Duet, Repetier, Bambu Labs, Prusa Connect, and Creality to allow Claude to interact with 3D printers via the Model Context Protocol.
3d-printer.usageInstructions: After installation, configure the required environment variables for your printer management system (e.g., OCTOPRINT_API_KEY, BAMBU_SERIAL, etc.). Start the server with `mcp-3d-printer-server` and connect it to your printer system. Use MCP-compatible tools to interact with the server for printer status, file management, and print control.

ebaymcpserver.name: Ebay MCP Server
ebaymcpserver.description: An MCP server that fetches auctions from Ebay.com using the official MCP Python SDK.
ebaymcpserver.installCommand: curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh && uv pip install git+https://github.com/CooKey-Monster/EbayMcpServer.git
ebaymcpserver.usageInstructions: After installation, set CLIENT_ID and CLIENT_SECRET environment variables obtained from the Ebay developer portal. Use prompts like 'Find me 10 auctions for batman comics' to fetch auctions.

openai-websearch.name: OpenAI WebSearch MCP Server
openai-websearch.description: MCP server providing access to OpenAI's websearch functionality for AI assistants
openai-websearch.usageInstructions: 1. Install using 'pip install openai-websearch-mcp'. 2. Configure Claude or Zed settings with the installation path and OPENAI_API_KEY. For Claude, modify settings to include 'mcpServers': {'openai-websearch-mcp': {'command': 'python', 'args': ['-m', 'openai_websearch_mcp'], 'env': {'OPENAI_API_KEY': 'your-api-key-here'}}}. For Zed, modify 'context_servers' similarly.

chronulus.name: Chronulus MCP Server
chronulus.description: MCP Server for integrating Chronulus AI Forecasting & Prediction Agents with Claude
chronulus.usageInstructions: 1. Install Claude for Desktop. 2. Configure Claude by adding the MCP server configuration to claude_desktop_config.json. 3. Set CHRONULUS_API_KEY environment variable with your API key.

memorymesh.name: MemoryMesh
memorymesh.description: A knowledge graph server for AI models, particularly suited for text-based RPGs and interactive storytelling.
memorymesh.usageInstructions: After installation, configure your schemas in the dist/data/schemas directory. Use the SchemaManager tool for creating and editing schemas. The server will automatically detect and process schema files on startup.

google-news.name: Google News MCP Server
google-news.description: An MCP server providing Google News search capabilities via SerpAPI integration with multiple language and region support.
google-news.usageInstructions: 1. Install via Smithery or manually using npm/yarn/pnpm. 2. Configure SERP_API_KEY in claude_desktop_config.json. 3. Start the server using npm start.

python-jira.name: Python Jira MCP Server
python-jira.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation in Python that integrates with Jira API, allowing AI models to interact with Jira through a standardized protocol.
python-jira.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/Chase-Bullock/python-jira-mcp.git && cd python-jira-mcp && pip install -r requirements.txt
python-jira.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and install dependencies.
2. Copy `.env.example` to `.env` and fill in your Jira credentials.
3. Run the server with `python main.py`.
4. Integrate with Cursor by setting the MCP server path to `main.py`.
5. Use JQL search and Get Issue tools via JSON tool calls.

blog.name: MCP Blog Upload Service
blog.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) service that automates the process of copying blog posts from Obsidian to a local directory, processing image links, and pushing changes to GitHub.
blog.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/Carrie-L/blog && cd blog && pip install -r requirements.txt
blog.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and navigate into the directory. 2. Install dependencies using pip install -r requirements.txt. 3. Set required environment variables for Obsidian source, blog target, GitHub repo, and authentication. 4. Run the service and input 'blog+' to trigger the upload process.

keycloak-model-context-protocol.name: Keycloak MCP Server
keycloak-model-context-protocol.description: A Model Context Protocol server for Keycloak administration, providing tools to manage users and realms.
keycloak-model-context-protocol.usageInstructions: After installation, configure the server in your Claude Desktop configuration file with the required environment variables (KEYCLOAK_URL, KEYCLOAK_ADMIN, KEYCLOAK_ADMIN_PASSWORD). Use the available tools like 'create-user', 'delete-user', 'list-realms', and 'list-users' to manage Keycloak realms and users. For local development, clone the repository, install dependencies, and run the server using Node.js.

obsidian-jsoncanvas.name: JSON Canvas MCP Server
obsidian-jsoncanvas.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for working with JSON Canvas files according to the JSON Canvas 1.0 specification, enabling creation, modification, and validation of infinite canvas data structures.
obsidian-jsoncanvas.usageInstructions: To use the JSON Canvas MCP Server, configure it in your `claude_desktop_config.json` with Docker or UV. For Docker, use the command `docker run -i --rm -v canvas-data:/data mcp/jsoncanvas` and set `OUTPUT_PATH` as needed. For local development, use `uv venv`, activate the virtual environment, and run `uv pip install -e .`. Example usage includes creating nodes, edges, and canvases using the provided Python API.

prometheus.name: Prometheus MCP Server
prometheus.description: An MCP server for retrieving and analyzing data from Prometheus databases, enabling LLMs to invoke tool functions for metric data retrieval and analysis.
prometheus.usageInstructions: 1. Install via Smithery using 'npx -y @smithery/cli install @CaesarYangs/prometheus_mcp_server --client claude'. 2. For manual installation: create a Python venv, activate it, and install requirements using 'pip install -r requirements.txt'. 3. Configure Claude Desktop by adding the MCP server configuration to claude_desktop_config.json. 4. Run using 'uv --directory /path/to/prometheus_mcp_server run server.py' or 'python3 server.py'.

virustotal.name: VirusTotal MCP Server
virustotal.description: An MCP server for querying VirusTotal API, providing comprehensive security analysis tools with automatic relationship data fetching.
virustotal.usageInstructions: 1. Install via Smithery CLI or manually using npm. 2. Configure Claude Desktop with the server details and VIRUSTOTAL_API_KEY. 3. Restart Claude Desktop.

dnstwist.name: DNStwist MCP Server
dnstwist.description: An MCP server for dnstwist, a DNS fuzzing tool for detecting typosquatting and phishing.
dnstwist.usageInstructions: 1. Install Docker and ensure it's running. 2. Run 'npm install -g mcp-dnstwist'. 3. Configure Claude Desktop by adding 'dnstwist' server configuration to the config file located at ~/Library/Application Support/Claude/claude_desktop_config.json (macOS) or %APPDATA%\Claude\claude_desktop_config.json (Windows). 4. Restart Claude Desktop.

outlook-email.name: Email Processing MCP Server
outlook-email.description: MCP server providing email processing capabilities with MongoDB integration for semantic search and SQLite for efficient storage and retrieval.
outlook-email.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/Cam10001110101/mcp-server-outlook-email.git && cd mcp-server-outlook-email && uv venv .venv && .venv\Scripts\activate && uv pip install -e . && uv pip install fastmcp
outlook-email.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and set up the virtual environment as per installation instructions. 2. Configure Claude for Desktop by modifying claude_desktop_config.json with the appropriate paths and environment variables. 3. Ensure Ollama is running locally with the required models. 4. Use the process_emails tool to start processing emails.

cursor.name: Cursor MCP - Claude Desktop Integration
cursor.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) implementation that enables seamless integration between Claude AI and desktop applications through Cursor IDE, enhancing AI-powered development workflows.
cursor.usageInstructions:
1. Install via Smithery with `npx -y @smithery/cli install cursor-mcp-tool --client claude`.
2. Alternatively, install globally with `npm install -g mcp-cursor`.
3. Create a `.env` file and set `DEFAULT_WORKSPACE_PATH`.
4. Add the server to Claude's MCP configuration with the provided JSON snippet.
5. Start the server with `mcp-cursor` (global) or `npm start` (local).
6. For development, use `npm run dev` for hot reload or `npm run build` for production.

summarization-functions.name: MCP Summarization Functions
summarization-functions.description: An MCP server providing intelligent text summarization for AI agents, optimizing context window usage through focused summaries of command outputs, files, directories, and API responses.
summarization-functions.usageInstructions: 1. Add the server to your MCP configuration file with the command: node path/to/summarization-functions/build/index.js and set required environment variables (PROVIDER, API_KEY). 2. Use the available functions: summarize_command, summarize_files, summarize_directory, and summarize_text with appropriate parameters. 3. Integrate with AI agents by following the recommended prompt instructions for mandatory summarization of large outputs.

shodan.name: Shodan MCP Server
shodan.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for querying the Shodan API and Shodan CVEDB, providing network intelligence, vulnerability tracking, and device discovery capabilities.
shodan.usageInstructions: 1. Install the server globally via npm: 'npm install -g @burtthecoder/mcp-shodan'. 2. Add to your Claude Desktop configuration file with the SHODAN_API_KEY environment variable set. 3. Restart Claude Desktop. For source setup, clone the repository, build, and configure the command path in the configuration file.

maigret.name: Maigret MCP Server
maigret.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for Maigret, an OSINT tool that searches for user accounts across social networks and analyzes URLs.
maigret.usageInstructions:
1. Install Docker if not already installed.
2. Install the server globally via npm: `npm install -g mcp-maigret`.
3. Create a reports directory and set the `MAIGRET_REPORTS_DIR` environment variable to its path.
4. Add the server to your Claude Desktop configuration file with the command `mcp-maigret` and the reports directory environment variable.
5. Restart Claude Desktop to use the server.

To use the server, call the `search_username` or `parse_url` tools with the required parameters.

bracketbot.name: Multi-Robot Control MCP Agent
bracketbot.description: MCP server for controlling multiple robots via FastAPI servers
bracketbot.usageInstructions:
1. Ensure Python3.10+ and UV are installed
2. Run robot control FastAPI servers on different ports
3. The MCP server is automatically run by Claude desktop client

gauntlet-incept.name: Gauntlet-Incept MCP Server
gauntlet-incept.description: Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for educational content generation, enabling Claude Desktop to create, tag, and grade K-8 educational materials.
gauntlet-incept.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/Birdsmith/Gauntlet-Incept-MCP && cd Gauntlet-Incept-MCP && npm install
gauntlet-incept.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and install dependencies with 'npm install'.
2. Copy .env.example to .env and update with your database credentials.
3. Start the server with 'npm start' or run with Docker using 'docker-compose up -d'.
4. Access the API at http://localhost:3000 and the MCP server at http://localhost:3001.
5. For SSH tunneling, configure the optional SSH_TUNNEL_* variables in .env.

watch.name: Server Watch MCP
watch.description: A CLI wrapper that monitors command output and exposes it as an MCP server for development workflows.
watch.usageInstructions: 1. Install globally using 'npm install -g server-watch-mcp'. 2. Start the MCP server with your command: 'server-watch-mcp <your-command>'. 3. Configure Claude Code using 'claude mcp add -s user -t sse server-watch-mcp http://localhost:6280/sse'. 4. Use tools in Claude Code to get recent logs or search logs.

pushover.name: Pushover MCP
pushover.description: An MCP server for sending notifications via Pushover.net, implementing the Model Context Protocol specification.
pushover.usageInstructions: 1. Get Pushover.net application token and user key from dashboard. 2. Configure MCP server in Cursor IDE or Roo Code settings using the npx command. 3. Agent will use the tool automatically or on explicit commands.

clojars.name: Clojars MCP Server
clojars.description: An MCP server providing tools for fetching Clojars dependency information, including latest versions, version existence checks, and version history.
clojars.usageInstructions: To use the server, first run it using 'npx clojars-deps-server'. Then configure Claude by adding the server details to cline_mcp_settings.json or claude_desktop_config.json. The server exposes three tools: get_clojars_latest_version, check_clojars_version_exists, and get_clojars_history.

memory-custom.name: Memory Custom MCP Server
memory-custom.description: An MCP server that enhances memory management with custom file paths and timestamping for knowledge graph interactions.
memory-custom.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository: git clone git@github.com:BRO3886/mcp-memory-custom.git && cd mcp-memory-custom. 2. Install dependencies: npm install. 3. Configure MEMORY_FILE_PATH environment variable. 4. Update claude_desktop_config.json or .cursor/mcp.json with server details. 5. Run: npm run build && node dist/index.js

database-updater.name: Database Updater MCP Server
database-updater.description: An MCP server that updates databases from CSV and Excel files, supporting PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB, and SQLite.
database-updater.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/AnuragRai017/database-updater-MCP-Server && cd database-updater-MCP-Server && npm install && npm run build
database-updater.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies using 'npm install'. 2. Build the server using 'npm run build'. 3. Configure Claude Desktop by adding the server config to claude_desktop_config.json. 4. Use the 'update_database' tool with required parameters like filePath, databaseType, connectionString, and tableName.

macos.name: macOS
macos.description: The repository appears to be a placeholder or incomplete project with no clear description or functionality provided.
macos.usageInstructions: The repository does not provide any usage instructions, setup steps, or configuration details. Further information is required to determine how to use or configure this project.

command.name: MCP Command Server
command.description: A secure Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for executing system commands through LLM applications like Claude, with features such as command whitelisting, user confirmation, audit logging, and Claude Desktop integration.
command.usageInstructions: 1. Install the package using the install command. 2. Set the required environment variable ALLOWED_COMMANDS to specify allowed commands. 3. Add the server to your Claude Desktop configuration with the provided JSON format. 4. Optionally configure optional parameters like PORT, LOG_LEVEL, and AUDIT_LOG_PATH for customization. 5. Start the server using the command specified in the Claude Desktop configuration.

python-docs.name: Python Docs Server
python-docs.description: A TypeScript-based Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that fetches Python documentation using the Brave Search API.
python-docs.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/AnuragRai017/python-docs-server-MCP-Server && cd python-docs-server-MCP-Server && npm install
python-docs.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and install dependencies with `npm install`.
2. Set the `BRAVE_SEARCH_API_KEY` environment variable with your Brave Search API key.
3. Build the server with `npm run build`.
4. For development with auto-rebuild, use `npm run watch`.
5. Add the server configuration to the Claude Desktop config file as described in the README.
6. To debug, run `npm run inspector` and use the provided URL for debugging tools.

agentops.name: AgentOps MCP Server
agentops.description: The AgentOps MCP server provides observability and tracing data for debugging complex AI agent runs, offering crucial context about where the AI agent succeeds or fails.
agentops.usageInstructions: 1. Add the MCP configuration to your configuration file with the command `npx agentops-mcp` and set the `AGENTOPS_API_KEY` environment variable. 2. Use the available tools such as `auth`, `get_trace`, `get_span`, and `get_complete_trace` to retrieve observability data. 3. For local development, clone the repository, run `npm install`, build the project with `npm run build`, and run the server with `npm pack`.

code-explainer.name: Code Explainer MCP
code-explainer.description: A Cloudflare Worker MCP server that analyzes and explains code with architecture diagrams, component breakdowns, and functionality analysis for multiple programming languages.
code-explainer.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/BillDuke13/code-explainer-mcp.git && cd code-explainer-mcp && npm install
code-explainer.usageInstructions:
1. Set up Cloudflare account and install Wrangler
2. Configure secret key in wrangler.jsonc or via wrangler secret put SHARED_SECRET
3. Deploy with npm run deploy
4. Send POST requests to your worker URL with Authorization: Bearer [your_secret_key] and JSON body containing code and language

barnsworthburning.name: Barnsworthburning MCP Server
barnsworthburning.description: An MCP server for searching barnsworthburning.net through its API endpoint.
barnsworthburning.usageInstructions: After installation, connect the server to an MCP client like Claude for Desktop. Use search queries like 'Search barnsworthburning.net for [topic]'.

multi-service.name: Model Context Protocol (MCP) Server
multi-service.description: A modular MCP server implementing the Model Context Protocol standard with tools for GitHub, GitLab, Google Maps, Memory storage, and Puppeteer web automation.
multi-service.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/AdamPippert/multi-service-mcp-server.git && cd multi-service-mcp-server && pip install -r requirements.txt && npm install
multi-service.usageInstructions: Create a .env file with required environment variables, then start the server with 'python app.py'. Alternatively, use Docker or Podman for containerized deployment.

nostr.name: Nostr MCP Server
nostr.description: An MCP server enabling AI models to interact with Nostr protocol, allowing posting notes and real-time communication.
nostr.usageInstructions:
1. Create .env file with required variables (NOSTR_NSEC_KEY, NOSTR_RELAYS)
2. Run 'npm run dev' for development mode or 'npm start' for production

browser-tools.name: BrowserTools MCP
browser-tools.description: A powerful browser monitoring and interaction tool enabling AI-powered applications via Anthropic's Model Context Protocol (MCP)
browser-tools.usageInstructions:
1. Install Chrome extension from https://github.com/AgentDeskAI/browser-tools-mcp/releases/download/v1.2.0/BrowserTools-1.2.0-extension.zip
2. Run `npx @agentdeskai/browser-tools-mcp@latest` in your IDE
3. Run `npx @agentdeskai/browser-tools-server@latest` in a new terminal
4. Open Chrome DevTools and access the BrowserToolsMCP panel

db.name: db-mcp
db.description: A utility for Model Context Protocol (MCP)-compatible AI assistants to query databases using DSNs.
db.usageInstructions: After installation, run `db-mcp` to start the server. Use the `-default-dsn` flag to specify a default database connection string. Construct DSNs for PostgreSQL, MySQL, or SQLite as described in the FAQ. Use the `connect`, `query`, and `flavor` tools to interact with the database.

lightning.name: Lightning Network MCP Server
lightning.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that enables AI models to interact with Lightning Network, allowing them to pay invoices.
lightning.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and navigate into it: `git clone https://github.com/AbdelStark/lightning-mcp && cd lightning-mcp`
2. Install dependencies: `npm install`
3. Create a `.env` file with your Lightning Network credentials.
4. Start the server in development mode: `npm run dev` or in production mode: `npm start`.
5. Use the `pay_invoice` tool to pay Lightning Network invoices by sending a JSON payload with the invoice string.

adamik.name: Adamik MCP Server
adamik.description: A powerful blockchain MCP server that connects to 60+ blockchains, enabling natural language interactions for account management, transactions, and blockchain operations with Claude, ChatGPT, and other MCP clients.
adamik.usageInstructions:
1. Get your free API key from https://dashboard.adamik.io/
2. Run the server using 'npx @adamik/mcp-server' and set the ADAMIK_API_KEY environment variable.
3. Configure your MCP client (e.g., Claude Desktop) with the server command and API key.
4. Use natural language commands like 'Check my ETH balance' or 'Send 0.1 ETH to 0x123'.

truerag.name: MCP Server for GraphQL Policies API
truerag.description: An MCP server implementation that provides access to policies via a GraphQL API, built using the Python SDK for MCP and the GQL library.
truerag.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/Ad-Veritas/mcp-server-trueRAG.git && cd mcp-server-trueRAG && uv run fastmcp run server.py
truerag.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and navigate to the directory.
2. Install uv if not already installed.
3. Create a .env file with GRAPHQL_API_KEY and GRAPHQL_ENDPOINT.
4. Add the server to an MCP client like Claude Desktop by updating the configuration file with the provided command.
5. Run the server using uv run fastmcp run server.py.

activitywatch.name: ActivityWatch MCP Server
activitywatch.description: An MCP server that connects to ActivityWatch, allowing LLMs like Claude to interact with time tracking data.
activitywatch.usageInstructions: 1. Install ActivityWatch and Claude for Desktop. 2. Configure Claude: Add 'activitywatch-mcp-server' to claude_desktop_config.json. 3. Restart Claude. 4. Use queries like 'What ActivityWatch buckets do I have?' or 'Can you show me which applications I've used the most today?'. Ensure ActivityWatch is running at http://localhost:5600.

veri5ight.name: Veri5ight
veri5ight.description: An MCP server providing direct interface between Claude and Ethereum nodes for real-time token info, smart contract data, and node access.
veri5ight.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/5ajaki/veri5ight.git && cd veri5ight && npm install && npm run build
veri5ight.usageInstructions: 1. Copy .env.example to .env and configure ETH_NODE_URL. 2. Configure Claude Desktop with the path to dist/index.js. 3. Run manually with 'node dist/index.js' or configure to launch automatically.

bitcoin.name: Bitcoin & Lightning Network MCP Server
bitcoin.description: An MCP server enabling AI models to interact with Bitcoin and Lightning Network, allowing key generation, address validation, transaction decoding, and blockchain queries.
bitcoin.usageInstructions: To use with Claude Desktop, configure claude_desktop_config.json with 'npx -y bitcoin-mcp@latest'. For Goose, add as an extension using STDIO or SSE mode. Check documentation for detailed setup.

terminal-use.name: MCP Terminal Use
terminal-use.description: An MCP server for terminal access, allowing Claude to interact with specified system directories.
terminal-use.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/AItheLab/mcp-terminal-use.git && cd mcp-terminal-use && npm install
terminal-use.usageInstructions: 1. Clone the repository and install dependencies using 'npm install'. 2. Configure ALLOWED_DIRECTORY either through a .env file, system environment variables, or claude_desktop_config.json. 3. Update claude_desktop_config.json with the correct path to the server's index.js.

safe.name: Safe MCP Server
safe.description: An MCP server implementation for interacting with Safe (formerly Gnosis Safe) smart contract wallets, providing tools to query transactions, decode data, and integrate with the Safe API.
safe.usageInstructions: After installation, build and start the server using 'npm run build && npm start'. By default, it uses the Safe Transaction API mainnet endpoint. To use a different endpoint (e.g., testnet), set the SAFE_API_URL environment variable before starting the server.

mcpnotes.name: MCP Notes
mcpnotes.description: A note-taking application built on the Model Context Protocol (MCP) that allows users to record and manage notes using AI and a web interface, with storage via AWS DynamoDB.
mcpnotes.usageInstructions:
1. Install Node.js if not already installed.
2. Use the provided install command to run the server with npx.
3. Configure AWS credentials via environment variables or a DynamoDB connection string.
4. Access the web interface by running the web server command and navigating to http://localhost:3100.
5. Use the MCP tools (listNotes, getNote, writeNote, deleteNote) to manage notes via AI or the web interface.

make-integration-issue.name: Make-MCP Integration Server
make-integration-issue.description: A custom MCP server for integrating Make (Integromat) with Claude Desktop, implementing JSON-RPC 2.0 and WebSocket communication.
make-integration-issue.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/3rzy/make-mcp-integration-issue && cd make-mcp-integration-issue && npm install
make-integration-issue.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository and install dependencies using 'npm install'.
2. Set the MAKE_API_TOKEN and PORT environment variables.
3. Run the server using 'node make-mcp-server.js'.
4. Configure Claude Desktop with the server URL (e.g., ws://localhost:5555) and ensure the PORT matches.
5. Verify the server logs for connection and initialization status.

qwen.name: Qwen Max MCP Server
qwen.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server implementation for the Qwen Max language model, providing integration with Claude Desktop and support for multiple Qwen commercial models.
qwen.usageInstructions:
1. Install the server using the provided command.
2. Set the DASHSCOPE_API_KEY in a .env file.
3. Configure Claude Desktop with the server command and API key.
4. Use the server to generate text with Qwen models by sending MCP API requests.

record-to-markdown.name: Record to Markdown / Apple Notes
record-to-markdown.description: An MCP server that records Claude conversations to markdown or Apple Notes.
record-to-markdown.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/29decibel/record-to-markdown && cd record-to-markdown && uv pip install -r requirements.txt
record-to-markdown.usageInstructions:
1. Clone the repository using 'git clone https://github.com/29decibel/record-to-markdown'.
2. Navigate into the directory and install dependencies with 'uv pip install -r requirements.txt'.
3. Edit the Claude desktop config file at '~/Library/Application Support/Claude/claude_desktop_config.json' to include the MCP server configuration.
4. Run the server using 'uv --directory /FULL_PATH_TO/record-to-markdown run server.py'.

taskwarrior.name: MCP Taskwarrior Server
taskwarrior.description: An MCP server for managing tasks in Taskwarrior, providing tools to add, update, delete, and list tasks.
taskwarrior.usageInstructions: To use this MCP server, run 'npx @0xbeedao/mcp-taskwarrior' or install locally by cloning the repository, running 'pnpm install', and then using the '/path/to/this/repo/src/tasks.ts' as the command argument in an MCP client.

etherscan.name: MCP Etherscan Server
etherscan.description: An MCP server providing Ethereum blockchain data tools via Etherscan's API, featuring balance checking, transaction history, and more.
etherscan.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/5ajaki/mcp-etherscan-server.git && cd mcp-etherscan-server && npm install && npm run build
etherscan.usageInstructions: 1. Start the server using 'npm start'. 2. Configure Claude Desktop to use the server by adding an MCP server configuration with command 'node /path/to/mcp-etherscan-server/build/index.js'. Requires Node.js >=18 and an Etherscan API key.

markdown2pdf.name: Markdown2PDF MCP Server
markdown2pdf.description: An MCP server for converting Markdown documents to PDF files with syntax highlighting and custom styling.
markdown2pdf.installCommand: git clone https://github.com/2b3pro/markdown2pdf-mcp.git && cd markdown2pdf-mcp && npm install && npm run build
markdown2pdf.usageInstructions: Start the server with 'npm start'. Use the 'create_pdf_from_markdown' tool with required 'markdown' parameter and optional parameters like 'outputFilename', 'paperFormat', 'paperOrientation', 'paperBorder', and 'watermark'. Configure output directory using M2P_OUTPUT_DIR environment variable.

mcpexec.name: MCPExec
mcpexec.description: MCP Server to execute local CLI commands, enabling integration with Claude for Desktop.
mcpexec.installCommand: curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh && uv init exec && cd exec && uv venv && source .venv/bin/activate && uv add "mcp[cli]"
mcpexec.usageInstructions:
1. Install uv by running the provided curl command.
2. Create a new directory for the project and navigate into it.
3. Set up a virtual environment and activate it.
4. Install the 'mcp[cli]' package using uv.
5. Configure the MCP server in your Claude for Desktop settings with the command and arguments for the local CLI command you want to execute.
